JLOMAHUTON is a group of four persons, all residing in the same neighborhood in Benin. The representative of the group, Pascaline Akoua (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 40 years old. She is married to Etienne. The couple have three children, all enrolled in school and still under their parents' care. Pascaline Akoua lives together with her husband and her children. She did not attend school. The couple share in supporting the household. 

In order to contribute to covering the needs of the family, Pascaline Akoua has been selling plastic items, soap, cloth, and vegetable oil for eight years through the distribution system. She buys her wares in a marketplace in Benin. In order to respond to the needs of her ever growing clientele,  Pascaline Akoua is requesting, together with the other members of the group called JLOMAHUTON, a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan has been correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy cloth and jerrycans of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Espoir Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ESPOIR est formé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Catherine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Catherine est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un électricien du nom de Geofroy. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Catherine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Il y a cinq ans que Catherine mène comme activité, la vente des conserves et des pâtes alimentaires pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire, Catherine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ESPOIR, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The ESPOIR group is made up of four persons who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Catherine, is the one who is raising her hand in the photo. She is 34 years old and married to an electrician named Geofroy. The couple have four children, all enrolled in school and still under their parents' care. Catherine lives together with her husband and children and helps her husband support the family. 

For five years, Catherine has been selling tinned goods and pasta to contribute to covering the needs of the family. Wishing to satisfy her clientele and grow her sales, Catherine is requesting, together with the other members of the group called ESPOIR, a second loan from ALIDé. The prior loan has been correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy tinned goods and pasta.

loans.name: Ney Soraida

texts.es:
Ney tiene 33 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, vive en la ciudad de Pisaq de la provincia del Calca departamento del Cusco, Perú. Ney nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de artesanía de tipo bisutería, ella tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde elabora artesanía. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Ney requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales y también collares y aretes. Ney pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Los socios del Banco Comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Ney is 33, and has two children.  She lives in the city of Pisaq, in Calca province, Cusco department, Peru.

Ney tells us that she sells costume jewelry handicrafts. She has a small workshop in her home, where she makes crafts. She has been in this busines for several years now, and it is going very well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

On this occasion, Ney needs the loan to buy materials, and also necklaces and earrings.  Ney belongs to the “Mosoq Ñusta” communal bank of Asociación Arariwa, and she is thankful for the opportunity provided by this means.  As well, she promises to make her payments in accordance with the loan schedule.

The members of the "Mosoq Ñusta" communal bank meet every month in Pisaq district, in Calca province (Cusco, Peru). Cusco is known as a very important tourist and commercial area; for its traditional Inti Raymi festival; and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located there.

loans.use: To buy materials, and also necklaces and earrings.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia tiene 68 años de edad, tiene ocho hijos y vive en la ciudad de Pisaq de la provincia del Calca departamento del Cusco, Perú. Lucia se dedica a la venta de pan y tortas de forma ambulatoria en la avenida principal de la ciudad de Pisaq, ella requiere el préstamo para incrementar el capital del negocio y desea comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, manteca, azúcar y otras cosas más que se necesitan para elaborar pan. Lucia pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Los socios del Banco Comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Lucia is 68, and has eight children. She lives in the city of Pisaq, in Calca province, Cusco department, in Cusco, Peru. Lucía is a street vendor selling bread and cakes on the main avenue of Pisaq.  

She needs the loan to increase her working capital, and wishes to buy ingredients such as flour, lard, sugar, and other things needed to to make bread. 

Lucia belongs to the "Mosoq Ñusta" communal bank of Asociación Arariwa, and she is thankful for the opportunity provided to her through this means. As well, she promises to make her payments in accordance with the loan schedule.

The members of the "Mosoq Ñusta" communal bank meet every month in Pisaq district, in Calca province (Cusco, Peru). Cusco is known as a very important tourist and commercial area; for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located there.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as flour, lard, sugar, and other things.

loans.name: Tres Marias Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal TRES MARIAS; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia Triolinda tiene 39 años es casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azucar, leche, golosinas, gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual  mediante este la socia saca adelante a su familia, la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia, 
la socia trabaja todos los días en su negocio para de esta manera brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de mas mercaderia para su negocio como arroz, azucar, leche, huevos, gaseosas entre otros y de esta manera tener mas variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.

Los otros socios se dedican a la compra y venta de leña, brindar el servicio de taxi, venta  de fruta, venta de productos de primera necesidad masivo.

En esta oportunidad algunos socios continuan en el banco comunal y otros se retiraron por motivos personales como la socia Valentina. 

La socia agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.

La socia pertenece  al banco comunal TRES MARIAS; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.
texts.en:
The member belongs to Tres Marías Communal Bank, located in the district of Wanchaq in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.  The member, Triolinda, is 39 years old and married, with two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business.  She sells different types of products such as rice, sugar, milk, candy, and sodas, among others.  She has been in this business for years, and with it she gets her family ahead.  She is a very happy and responsible person who very much wants to get ahead for her family.  She works every day in her business so she can give her family a better quality of life.

She is requesting the loan to buy more merchandise for her business such as rice, sugar, milk, eggs, and soda, among other things, and in this way have a greater variety of products to offer her customers.

The other members work buying and selling firewood, offering taxi service, selling fruit, and selling basic household necessities.  This time some members are staying with the communal bank and others left for personal reasons, such as the member Valentina.

She is grateful for this means by which the loan is given to her and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business such as rice, sugar, milk, eggs, and soda, to have greater variety for her customers.

loans.name: Ibet

texts.es: Ibet   de 53 años de edad es una mujer viuda que vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 29 a 31 años. Ella emprendió su propia aventura de negocios  de  venta de comidas, corrientes y asados, actividad que inició ofreciendo almuerzos entre sus vecinos y hoy ha logrado crecer, entechando su terraza y ubicando sillas donde atienden a sus clientes. Su negocio está ubicado en un corredor muy comercial por eso es muy conocido en el barrio y como prepara deliciosos almuerzos que vende diariamente  y asados que prepara los fines de semas; de esta manera  sus actuales clientes le recomiendan nuevos compradores y así ha logrado sostenerse y generar ingresos para el bienestar de su familia. Su credikiva es el segundo financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual  realizó adecuaciones de su local porque puso la cubierta a gran parte de él;  ahora Ibet brinda más comodidad a sus clientes y desde que recibió su  primer crédito se ha incrementado el número de ellos y ha tenido que comprar más sillas y mesas y con esas nuevas utilidades ha hecho mejoras a su vivienda, generando un ambiente familiar agradable. En la actualidad está aplicando a un primer credikiva  con  cual  terminará el entechado de su negocio, mejorando poco a poco la infraestructura de él y dándole así mayor formalidad. Su mensaje a la Fundación es el siguiente: “Estoy muy contento con el crédito y el apoyo que me ha dado la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y ahora con Kiva, para seguir adelante con mi negocio. ¡Gracias!
texts.en:
Ibet is 53 years old and is a widow. She lives in the city of Barranquilla and has 3 children between the ages of 29 and 31 years old. She started her own business venture selling food, cooked meals and grilled meats. She started by offering lunches to her neighbors, and now her business has grown so that she has put a roof over her terrace to have a place where she can serve her customers. Her business is located in a commercial corridor that is well known in the neighborhood for having delicious lunches that are sold daily and grilled meats that are prepared on the weekends. Her business has grown because her current customers always recommend new customers, which has allowed her to sustain herself and make a profit for the well-being of her family.    

Her Kiva loan is the second loan that she will receive through the 'Fundación Mario Santo Domingo'. The first loan she used to make improvements to her restaurant, making a covering for a large part of it. Now Ibet provides more comfort to her customers. Since the first loan that she took out she has increased her number of customers and has had to put more chairs and tables. With these new purchases she has made improvements to her location, giving it a friendly and enjoyable environment.  

Currently she is requesting a loan which will be her first loan from Kiva, which she will use to finish the roof on her business. Little by little she is improving the infrastructure of her business and making it more formal. Her message to the foundation is the following: "I am very happy with the loan and the support that the 'Fundación Mario Santo Domingo' has given me and now with Kiva, to continue moving ahead with my business. Thank you!"

loans.use: to finish the roofing on her business, improving the infrastructure little by little.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oats, cream-of-wheat, label tea, over-tea, milk, and many other items for his business

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 57 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elma runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell. She has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future Elma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Narcisa works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing. Narcisa is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish for her fish vending business.

Narcisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Johanna Carol

texts.es: Johanna de 33 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad en un barrio muy tradicional que combina espacios productivos formales e informales, actividades financieras y de comercio en general.Ella  tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad   con el que sueña ver convertido en un profesional exitoso y con este propósito trabaja día a día, en su propio negocio el cual inició después de ha ver quedado desempleada, ella aunque tenia conocimientos básicos en la preparación de productos derivados de la harina de trigo, hizo una capacitación  en técnicas de panadería y repostería para perfeccionar su arte y lograr la sostenibilidad de su emprendimiento, el cual inició hace 2 años. Su meta es tener su propio local donde pueda adecuar su taller y tener un punto comercial en ese mismo sitio, generando empleos en su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una batidora industrial de 5 libras, para lograr ampliar su productividad y competitividad, pues en la actualidad preparar sus productos manualmente.
texts.en: Johanna is 33 years old. She lives south of the city in a very traditional neighborhood that combines formal and informal businesses, financial activities and trade in general. She has a son who is 6 years old, whom she dreams will become a successful professional and with this in mind she works from day to day in her own business which she started after being unemployed. Even though she had basic knowledge of the preparation of products made from wheat flour, she took a course in bakery techniques and pastries to perfect her art and to obtain sustainability in her venture, which she started two years ago. Her goal is to have her own place where she can locate her shop and also have a store front in the same location, creating jobs in her family. She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan she has taken out through 'Fundación Mario Santo Domingo', with which she will buy an industrial  electric mixer with capacity of 5 pounds, to increase her production and competitiveness. She currently make her products by hand.

loans.use: to buy an industrial electric mixer with five-pound capacity.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо ведущий специалист в бюджетной организации, которая имеет одну дочь, которая учится в средней школе в 9 классе на отлично.Её муж в отъезде в Россию на заработках, уже второй год. Недавно он позвонив сказал ей , что приезжает в ближайшие месяца. узнав об этом Мархабо решила  сделать сюрприз к его приезду , сделав мини ремонт. В основном она хочет побелить потолок кухни и заменить трубы на пластмассовые. Просит для своей цели 2000 сомони.
texts.en: Marhabo is a leading specialist at a budgetary organization.  She has one daughter, who is an excellent ninth-grade student at a secondary school.  Marhabo's husband is away working in Russia for the second year now.  He recently called her and told her that he was coming home in the coming months, and, having learnt this, Marhabo decided to surprise him for his return by repairing their apartment.  She primarily wants to whitewash the kitchen ceiling and replace the pipes with plastic ones.  She is requesting 2000 somoni for this purpose.

loans.use: to make repairs to her apartment

loans.name: Magalis

texts.es: Magalis está muy contenta con su credikiva anterior pues compró materiales con los que fabricó adornos recordatorios y otras manualidades en cerámica y en porcelanicron. Con esta compra recibió descuentos porque la hizo en mayor volumen y de contado. Ahora ha quedado entusiasmada y está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con  el cual comprará materiales y moldes para hacer nuevas figuras y cumplir con los pedidos actuales, lo cual garantiza su éxito en la inversión. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Continúen apoyando a los microempresarios con créditos a bajo costo. Y muchas gracias.
texts.en: Magalis is very happy with her previous Kiva loan, with which she bought materials to make decorations, figurines and other crafts from ceramic and porcelain. She received a discount on her purchases because she bought in higher volume and with cash. Now she remains enthusiastic and is applying for a new loan through Kiva with which she will buy materials and forms to make new figures and finish orders that have been made, which guarantee her success in this investment. Her message to the lenders of Kiva is as follows: "Continue to support the micro-businesses with low cost loans. Thank you very much."

loans.use: to buy materials and forms to make new figures and complete orders that have been made.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмире 50 лет, замужем, имеет одного сына. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, 10 лет назад  Гульмира начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве со стартовой суммой 40,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гульмиры, на сегодня  ее хозяйство со скотом приносит около 20,000 сом в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов.  Доходы от бизнес – деятельности позволяют Гульмире оплачивать обучение сына в Медицинском институте. Для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Гульмира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы и овцематок. Доходы Гульмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Gulmira is 50 years old, married and has one son. In search of an financing source for her family, Gulmira started her own business in animal husbandry and farming ten years ago with an initial sum of 40,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her persistent work, today her livestock business yields about 20,000 som per month from sales of milk and milk products.  The earnings from the business allow Gulmira to pay for her son's education at the Medical Institute.  In order to further expand her business, Gulmira requested a loan in the sum of 75,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy a dairy cow and ewes. She plans to invest the earnings into a further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sarath

texts.en: Sarath, 47, is widowed and resides with one school age child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling embroidered clothing for over five years, earning approximately USD 10 per day. Due to her eagerness to improve the family’s economic situation, Sarath is requesting for a loan of USD 700 to run an additional business by purchasing fruits for resale at a profitable price to generate extra income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her child get a bachelor degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fruits for resale

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали проживает в районе Вахдат. Ему 46 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Шерали занимается животноводством. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Кредит берет для закупа коровы.
texts.en: Sherali lives in the Vahdat district.  He is 46 years old, married and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Sherali is involved in animal husbandry.  He earns a living by breeding cattle.  He is requesting this loan to purchase a cow.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Sihate

texts.en: Sihate, 22, is single and resides with her parents in Kampong Chnnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running a beauty salon for over six years, earning approximately USD 7 per day. In order to improve her business, Sihate is requesting for a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more cosmetics and salon equipment for her business. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and to provide a better living condition for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and salon equipment for her business

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos  de 60 años se dedica a la elaboración de cortinas , percianas, cenefas y decoración en general, desde hace 28 años cuando comenzó su negocio;  inicialmente realizaba trabajos sencillos, pero como gradualmente fue capacitándose en el arte de decoración,  agregó mayor valor a su trabajo. En la actualidad tiene de clientes a almacenes importantes de la ciudad y trabaja con dos empleados; con su negocio ha logrado ampliar su infraestructura locativa y con la calidad de sus prendas ha conseguido sostener una selecta clientela,  que usualmente remiten nuevos compradores. Su meta en el negocio es de crecimiento y posicionamiento en le mercado y lograr independizar su espacio familiar del espacio productivo para lograr mayor sosiego. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará telas, puyón, cordón, en mayor volumen,  para ganar descuentos pues tiene pedidos sobre los que trabajará y hará de su inversión todo un éxito.
texts.en: Carlos, 60, has designed and sewn curtains, blinds, trim and decoration in general, since starting his business 28 years ago. Initially he only took on simple designs, but he gradually became more skilled in decorative art, he added more value to his work. Currently he has clients that include important department stores and has two employees. With the business he gets, he’s been able to expand his location and grow his infrastructure. The quality of his garments has allowed him to maintain a select clientele that usually send him new clients. His goal is to grow his business and position himself in the market and separate his production space from his family space to achieve tranquility. He’s requesting a Kiva loan, his 1st financing through the Maria Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy fabric, cord and needles in large quantities in order to get a discount, as he has orders he’ll be working on. He’ll make his investment a success.

loans.use: buy fabric, cord and needles in large quantities.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Vanna, 29, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working in a garment factory for over three years, earning approximately USD 7 per day. Due to the difficulty in family transportation, Vanna is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. In the future, she would like to rebuild her house and help her children get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 57 years old and widowed with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Edna has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 17 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Edna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally, 34, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in garment factory for over five years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Additionally, he grows rice in the dry season to generate extra income for the family. Approximately, he earns USD 5 per day. 

Due to lack of machinery, Phally is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase a pumping machine for her husband to use in his farming work. In the future, she would like to expand her husband's business, repair some parts of her house, and help her children get Bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a pumping machine for her husband to use in his farming work

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel de 55 años de edad  se dedica a la confección  de cortinas y cubre lechos, ella en su condición de separada ha logrado genera ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hijo de 20 años, con el que sueña ver convertido en una persona de mucho éxito y esta es el motor que la impulsa a trabajar de manera incansable en su propio negocio.  Su experiencia  como confeccionista, data desde hace 30 años, cuando trabajaba en una empresa como empleada en las operaciones de la confección, en la Zona franca de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Con su experiencia reconocida emprendió desde hace 15 años su aventura de negocio, para lograr atender las actividades de su hogar, al mismo tiempo que generaba ingresos; ella ha  logrado sostener esta actividad productiva, con la calidad de sus prendas y el servicio oportuno a sus clientes. Con su negocio adquirió su vivienda propia y esto fue uno de sus triunfos. En la actualidad se prepara para recibir su credikiva, sexto financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que le ha permitido mejorara sus condiciones habitacionales, mediante apalancamientos financieros,  que la ayudaron  a tener un capital con el cual responder a su clientela. Ella se siente muy agradecida también,  porque su hijo muy pronto emprenderá su propia aventura de negocios, apoyado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Con su credikiva, comprará remates de telas que adquiriéndolos de contado y en una mayor proporción,  le permiten obtener mayores utilidades que reinvierte y esto es justamente el éxito de su inversión. Su meta mas adelante es ener un local a un lado de su vivienda para separarlo de su actividad productiva y genera mayor sosiego.
texts.en:
Isabel is 55 years old and makes a living as a seamstress, making curtains and bed covers. She is separated from her husband. She has succeeded in generating income to sustain her son who is 20 years old. She dreams that he will be a very successful person; this is the motor that drives her to work tirelessly in her own business. Her experience as a seamstress began 30 years ago, when she worked in a business as an employee in the operations of the shop, located in the area of Franca in the city of Barranquilla. With her recognized experience she undertook her own business venture 15 years ago, to be able to attend to activities in her home as well as generate income. She has succeeded in her business as a result of her high quality products and the timely service she provides to her customers. With her business she has been able to buy her own house, which was a great triumph for her. 

She is currently preparing to receive her Kiva loan, the sixth loan she has taken out through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, the organization which has allowed her to improve her living conditions, by financial means, and have helped her to have capital to be able to respond to her customers.   

She feels very thankful also, because her son will be opening his own business very soon, supported by the ' Fundación Mario Santo Domingo'.

With her loan she will buy fabric borders which she will buy with cash and in high volume, which will allow her to have more income to reinvest, making her investment a success. Her goal is to have a small shop to the side of her home to separate her work activity and make her home more calm.

loans.use: to buy fabric borders at a discounted price and in high volume.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 63 years old, married and has one child. She is from Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Erlinda runs a general store selling a variety of products in her community. Erlinda has been in her business for 12 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand the product offering at her general store

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong, 37, is married, resides with her husband and six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is an arc welder who approximately USD 5 per day. Two of her children are employed in the garment factory. They earn about USD 6 per day. In order to improve her family’s economy, Kong is requesting for a loan of USD 1000 to purchase groceries for running a grocery store in order to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to purchase rice to store and to resale when the price is higher. Moreover, she plans to build a fence and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for running a grocery store

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is from Prenza, Tangub City. She is 38 years old. Maribel is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Maribel owns and operates a raising crops venture. Maribel has been in her business for 10 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Maribel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Zulmira

texts.es: Zulma de 55 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias es una mujer casada que tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 26 a 33 años. Ella tienen un negocio de producción de productos fritos y venta de refrescos, el cual inició con muy poco capital de trabajo y apoyada por la mas importante  empresa de cervezas en Colombia. Gradualmente su negocio creció en clientela y con ello en capital de trabajo y se vinculó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en el programa de grupos solidarios, para lograr un capital con el cual comprar de contado y en mayor proporción. Desde ese momento ha recibido 6 financiamientos,  con los que ha logrado adquirir bienes inmuebles y sobre todo la posibilidad de comprar de contado  a sus proveedores y también ha logrado convertir su negocio en su principal fuente de ingresos del hogar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, séptimo financiamiento que hace ala Fundación, con el que comprará refrescos por cajas e insumos, para elaborar los deliciosos productos alimenticios que prepara y que a su clientela le gusta. Su meta es continuar creciendo empresarialmente y también en su autonomía.El éxito de su inversión radica en lograr descuentos y un surtido importante en el primer trimestre del año, que exige una gran inversión para responder a su clientela en las fiestas y festivos..
texts.en: Zulma, 55, lives in Cartagena de Indias.  She is married and has 4 children, ages 26-33.  Her business is making fried foods and selling soft drinks, a business which she began with little working capital but helped by the most important beer company in Colombia.  Her client base grew gradually and with it her working capital.   She joined the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation in the program of communal groups to gain enough capital to buy on credit and in greater volume.  Up to now she has received 6 loans and they have helped her acquire some property and especially for the possibility of buying on credit from her suppliers.  She has also succeeded in converting her business to her main source of income for her home.  Currently she is applying for Kiva financing, her seventh through the Foundation, and she will use it to buy cartons of soft drinks and ingredients to make the delicious foods that her customers like.  Her goal is to continue developing as an entrepreneur and also to be independent.  The success of her investment is in getting discounts and a good variety of products in the first third of the year.  This demands a big investment to support her sales during parties and festivals for her customers.

loans.use: to buy cartons of soft drinks and ingredients to prepare the delicious food that she makes

loans.name: Mahukpego 10 Group

texts.fr: MAHUKPEGO 10 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Machoucoura est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Machoucoura est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Sikirou. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Machoucoura vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Afin de subvenir aux diverses charges de la maison, Machoucoura vend depuis treize ans des assiettes, des glacières et des plastiques de façon ambulante. Machoucoura s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin et dans une région du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Machoucoura et les autres membres du groupe MAHUKPEGO 10 sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: MAHUKPEGO 10 is a group of three women who are friends and live in the same neighborhood. The leader of the group is Machoucoura, who has her hand raised in the photo. Machoucoura is married to a driver named Sikirou. The couple has four children together who are in school. Machoucoura lives together with her husband and four children. The couple is responsible for all their family's expenses. In order to take care of her family's needs, Machoucoura has been selling for the past 13 years, plates, ice boxes and other plastic goods door-to-door. Machoucoura buys her products in a city in Benin. In order to strengthen her business and satisfy her client's needs, Machoucoura and the other members of MAHUKPEGO 10 are requesting their fifth loan from ALIDé. Their goal is to grow the business. All their past loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase plates, ice boxes and other plastic household goods.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela de 65 años de edad es una mujer viuda que tiene una hija de 40 años y vive en el municipio de Sabanagrande, lugar  ubicado cerca a la ciudad de Barranquilla. Mariela se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada que distribuye y también vende en una miscelánea ubicada en su propia casa, negocio que inició dese hace 7 años. Ella comenzó con pocos clientes y un pequeño capital, el que gradualmente ha incrementado, y en la medida en que esto ocurre,  su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para mantener surtida su miscelánea y  para que el cliente llegue a su negocio y encuentre cualquier mercancía que necesite. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  productos cosméticos, papelería, variedades que son parte de la usual solicitud que hacen sus clientes. Su meta mas adelante es ampliar su local para organizarse mejor y vender en mayor cantidad y su mayor desafío es lograr tener un efectivo fijo disponible para mantenerlo surtido pues tien ventas a crédito y sus clientes le le pagan quincenalmente, mientras realiza sus compras en la ciudad de  Barranquilla en almacenes, que la reconocen y la llman para que aproveche las promociónes para surtir el negocio.
texts.en: Mariela is a 65-year-old widow who has a 40 year old daughter and lives in the municipality of Sabanagrande, located near the city of Barranquilla. Mariela sells various merchandise by distribution and she also sells from a little shop in her house, which she started 7 years ago. She began with very few clients and little capital, but has gradually increased her clientele so much she can’t keep up with the demand, as her business capital isn’t enough to keep her shop stocked with the various items her clients need. This is why she is requesting a loan with Kiva, her 1st financing through Maria Santo Domingo Foundation, with which she will buy cosmetics, paper products and a variety of other products that clients usually ask for. Her future goal is to expand her shop in order to organize herself better and sell more quantities. Her biggest challenge is to have enough disposable cash to keep her shop stocked since some clients use credit and only pay every two weeks. She goes shopping in the department stores in the city of Barranquilla where they know her and call her so she can take advantage of any sales on products for her shop.

loans.use: buy cosmetics, paper products and a variety of other products.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra tiene 28 años de edad y se dedica a la distribución de pollo en un expendio. Inicialmente compraba al detal por 1 bulto de pollo, y vendía en su propia casa;  pero en la medida en que su mercado fue creciendo fue buscando nuevas opciones de compra. Así fue como por  recomendación de un amigo adquirió con uno de los grandes proveedores de estos productos, un código para realizar las compras mediante una asignación de crédito y  a domicilio. Gradualmente fue extendiendo su negocio a otros sectores como tiendas y diversas microempresas de alimentos. En su infraestructura cuenta con un congelador de 700 libras 2 basculas para el peso. Su meta es lograr acondicionar un cuarto en su vivienda para adecuar el negocio y adicionar otras carnes. En la actualidad   está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación, con el que comprará pollos de contado para incrementar las ventas y obtener descuentos en mas o menos en un 50% y esto es justamente lo que garantiza su éxito en esta inversión.
texts.en:
Sandra is 28 years old and works in retail distribution of chicken.  She initially bought retail for 1 package of chicken and sold from home, but the market was growing so she was looking for new options. From the recommendation of a friend, she acquired a code to make purchases using a credit allowance at home from one of the largest suppliers of these products.

Gradually, she was extending its business to other sectors such as shops and various small shops that provide food. In her home she has a freezer that is 700 pounds, 2 scales for weight. Sandra's goal is to put a room in her home to accommodate the business and add other meats. Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing from the Fundación.  With the loan, Sandra will buy chickens in bulk to increase sales and obtain discounts of about 50%.  This is precisely what guarantees her success in this investment.

loans.use: to buy chickens in bulk to increase sales and obtain discounts.

loans.name: Jehovah Shalom Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JEHOVAH SHALOM est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, du nom de Woto Baï Colette est celle ayant la main levée sur la photo. Woto Baï Colette n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Woto Baï Colette est âgée de 44 ans et est une veuve. Woto Baï Colette est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Woto Baï Colette vit seule avec ses deux enfants et assure seule les diverses charges de sa famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Woto Baï Colette vend depuis huit ans, des produits cosmétiques de façon ambulante. Woto Baï Colette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Woto Baï Colette et les autres membres du groupe JEHOVAH SHALOM sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The group JEHOVAH SHALOM consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group’s representative is Woto Baï Colette, the lady with her hand raised in the photo. Woto Baï Colette never went to school. She is a 44-year-old widow with two dependent children, both in school. She lives alone with her children and handles the various household expenses on her own. 

In order to provide for her family, Woto Baï Colette started selling cosmetic products door-to-door eight years ago. She buys her merchandise at a market in Benin. 

Eager to strengthen their activity and better serve their customers, Woto Baï Colette and the other group members are seeking their first loan from ALIDé. Their goal is to bolster their activity.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Essoyo-Monwoé

texts.fr:
Essoyo-Monwoè est une femme âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un technicien. Elle a 3 enfants. 
Essoyo-Monwoè travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2002. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits au grand marché de Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Essoyo-Monwoè a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Essoyo-Monwoè voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Essoyo-Monwoè is 35 years old. She is married and has three children. 
Essoyo-Monwoè has been working as a retailer since 2002. She sells general food items out of a shop to many clients. She purchases her inventory from the Grand Marche in Lome. She works alone. At this time, her main challenge is keeping up with demand.
Essoyo-Monwoè is requesting her third loan from WAGES to purchase general food items. She plans to reinvest in the business.
In the next few years, she would like to grow the business further. She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase general food items.

loans.name: Ma. Aida

texts.en:
Ma. Aida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish vending business. Ma. Aida has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

Ma. Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Abla est une femme âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée å un commerçant. Elle a 2 enfants.
Abla travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2002. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients dans un quartier de la place. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Abla a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Abla voudrait renforcer la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Abla is 40 years old. She is married to a shopkeeper and has two children.
Abla has been working as a retailer since 2002. Elle sells general food products to many clients in her neighborhood. She purchases her inventory in Lomé. She works alone. At this time, her main challenge is keeping up with demand.
Abla is requesting her 2nd loan from WAGES to purchase general food products. She would like to reinvest in the business.
In the coming years, she plans to increase the size of the business and says that with the profits, she will take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase spirits(alcohol) and other food products.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru:
Бактыгул 45 лет, разведена, имеет двух детей. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, в 2006 году Бактыгул начала свой бизнес в полеводстве со стартовой суммой 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул, на сегодня  ее хозяйство с орошаемой землей в 1 га с картофелем приносит около 10,000-12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Также, для покрытия небольших ежедневных расходов своей семьи, Бактыгул занимается скупкой черного металла, который затем сдает предприятию. 
Для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Бактыгул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля. Доходы Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Baktygul is 45 years old, she is divorced and has two children.  In search of a source of funding for her family,  in 2006 Baktygul started her agriculture business with a starting sum of 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Batygul's hard work, today her land holdings of 1 acre planted with potatoes bring in around 10,000-12,000 som (KGS) per month.  In addition, to cover daily family expenditures, Baktygul purchases scrap metal that she then turns in to a factory.  In order to further grow her business, Baktygul has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase potato seeds.  Baktygul plans to invest her earning in order to further grow her holdings.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Mahrambi

texts.ru: Махрамби проживает в городе Вахдат. Она занимается шитьем национальных видов платьев. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Ей 47 лет. У нее трое детей. Она берет кредит для покупки разноцветных ниток и тканей.
texts.en: Mahrambi lives in the town of Vahdat. She sews traditional Tajik types of dresses. She has been in this business for four years. She is 47 years and old and she has three children. Mahrambi is taking out the loan to buy different colors of threads and fabrics.

loans.use: to buy different colors of threads and fabrics.

loans.name: Mahoumegnidaho Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUMEGNIDAHO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Ahoefa Marie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Ahoefa Marie est âgée de 54 ans et est mariée à un certain  Toubias. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à leur charge. Ahoefa Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Ahoefa Marie a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour subvenir aux diverses charges de la maison, Ahoefa Marie vend depuis cinq ans du maïs et des ustensiles de cuisine par le système de distribution. Ahoefa Marie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire, Ahoefa Marie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUMEGNIDAHO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The MAHOUMEGNIDAHO group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin.  The representative of the group, Ahoefa Marie, is raising her hand in the photo.  She is 54 years old and married to a man named Toubias.  The couple has three children who all attend school.  Two of the children are their dependents.   Ahoefa Marie lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various family expenses with her husband.

Ahoefa Marie left school at the elementary level.   For the past five years, she has been selling maize and kitchen utensils through the distribution system, in order to cover the diverse household expenses. She stocks up at a market in Benin.

In order to meet her customers' needs and to increase her turnover, she and the other members of the MAHOUMEGNIDAHO group are requesting a second loan from  ALIDé.  The previous loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Gavkhar

texts.ru:
Гавхар 28 лет, воспитывает троих детей 9, 7, и 4 лет. В 2011 году Гавхар начала свой бизнес в торговле продуктами питания, продав для этого имеющийся в семье скот.  Стартовав с суммой в 60,000 сом (KGS), и купив торговое место,  Гавхар сумела развить свой бизнес в продаже продуктов питания и мыломоющими средствами с ежемесячным доходом в сумме 30,000 сом.   
В целях расширения ассортимента товаров, Гавхар обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS).  Гавхар мечтает открыть свой собственный магазин с оптовой продажей товара.
texts.en: Gavkhar is 28 years old and raising three children, who are nine, seven and four years old.  She started her own business of selling food products by selling the livestock that the family had.  Having started with a sum of 60,000 som (KGS), Gavkhar was able to develop her food and cleaning products sales business to have a monthly income of 30,000 som.  In order to expand her product selection, Gavkhar requested a loan in the sum of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company.  She dreams of opening up her own store and sell merchandise wholesale.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Moh

texts.fr:
Madame Moh est une femme mariée de 33 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui réside avec  son époux à Bougouni, dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord. 
N’ayant pas fréquentée le système scolaire, elle s’intéressa très tôt aux activités génératrices de revenus telles l’achat vente de crèmes, d’ignames, de patates et de chaussures. Elle mène ses activités à la maison et au marché de  la ville de Bougouni.
Avec une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans la vente de chaussures, elle maîtrise bien ce créneau, qu’elle apprit auprès d’une de ses amies.
Dans le souci d’agrandir ses activités, Moh décida  d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso.
Après deux prêts solidaires dans une association de femmes de son quartier,  elle est passée au prêt individuel et est à son 9 eme prêt individuel, après avoir correctement remboursés tous ses précédents prêts.
Moh envisage acheter avec son nouveau prêt, 15 douzaines de paires de chaussures de toutes sortes. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako auprès des grossistes. La vente se fait au grand marché de Bougouni et une partie est vendue dans les différents quartiers de façon ambulante, en détail au comptant et à crédit. Sa clientèle est composée de toutes les catégories sociales.
 Elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000FCFA, qui sera essentiellement utilisé pour agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Ms. Moh is 33 years old, a mother of 6 children and lives with her husband in Bougouni, in the neighborhood of Heremakono Nord. 
She didn't complete much schooling as at a very young age she concentrated on income generating activities such as selling creams, yams, potatoes and shoes. She sells from her home as well as at the market in the town of Bougouni.
She has five years of experience in selling shoes and has done very well after learning the trade from a friend.
In the hopes of growing the business, Moh decided to take a loan from Soro Yiriwaso.
After taking two group loans with a women's group from her neighborhood, she starting taking individual loans and has now taken 9 individual loans that have all been properly reimbursed.
Moh plans to purchase with her new loan many pairs of different shoes. She purchases her inventory from a wholesaler in Bamako. She sells partially at the market in Bougouni and also door-to-door in the different neighborhoods on credit to her clients. She has a diverse client base.
She would like to make a monthly profit of 70,000 cfa francs, which she'll use to grow the business.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa est une femme âgé(e) de 57 ans. Elle est mariée à un mécanicien.
Akossiwa travaille comme revendeuse de céréales (mil, mais, sorgho…) depuis 1983. Elle répond à la demande des clients au marché d’AKODESSEWA et s’approvisionne au même lieu.
Akossiwa a requis son troisième crédit (les deux derniers ont été soldés sans problème) de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. Elle veut faire accroitre son activité afin d’assurer les besoins vitaux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is 57 years old and she is married to a mechanic.
Akossiwa is has been a retailer of grains (millet, corn, sorghum) since 1983. She sells her products at the market in Akodessewa and also buys her inventory there.
Akossiwa is requesting her third loan (the two previous loans were properly repaid) from WAGES to purchase more grains. She would like to grow the business to take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase grains.

loans.name: Harambibi

texts.ru: Харамбиби уже три года как занимается торговлей. Ей 47 лет. У нее имеется магазин со смешанным ассортиментом товара. Она вдова. У нее четверо детей. Ее сыновья работают в Российской Федерации. Она берет кредит для покупки женской обуви.
texts.en: Harambibi has been involved in sales for three years.  She is 47 years old.  She has a store with various merchandise.  Harambibi is a widow and has four children.  Her sons work in the Russian Federation.  She is requesting this loan to purchase women's shoes.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes

loans.name: Suyumkan

texts.ru:
Суйумкан 48 лет, вдова, имеет 4 детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Суйумкан занимается животноводством.  Начатое в 2002 году с 30,000 сом хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. На данный момент в хозяйстве Суйумкан  имеется пять коров, две лошади и сорок овец. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Суйумкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков и овец. Доходы Суйумкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Suyumkan is 48 years old, a widow and has four children.  To provide an income source for her family, Suyumkan is involved in animal husbandry.  Started in 2002 with 30,000 som, this business now yields about 10,000 som (KGS) per month.  Currently, Suyumkan's business has five cows, two horses and forty sheep.  In order to further develop her business, Suyumkan requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy bulls and sheep.  She plans to invest the earnings into increasing livestock headcount further.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 45 years old and is the mother of two children. She is married and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hoa and her husband run a food stall, which they have been operating for over ten years. She is requesting a loan to buy new furniture for her stall and purchase more types of food to sell. She hopes that will helps her earn more money so she can reinvest in her current business and save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: buy furniture and food for her food stall

loans.name: Maranatha Group

texts.fr: MARANATHA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Delphine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 48 ans. Delphine est mariée à un certain Justin. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Delphine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Delphine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, Delphine vend depuis près de huit ans, du maïs, du charbon de bois et des condiments dans son quartier. Delphine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Delphine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits ; ce qui lui permettra d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu. Pour cette raison, Delphine sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MARANATHA. Le premier crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
MARANATHA is a group of three persons whose members reside in the same district. The group's representative, Delphine (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 48 years old and married to a man named Justin. They have four children, all provided with schooling and in their care. Delphine lives together with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered.

Delphine did not attend school. To support her family, she has been selling corn, charcoal, and condiments for nearly eight years in her district. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. 

Having the goal of expanding her business, so as to be more competitive in the market, Delphine would like to increase her stock of goods. This will enable her to increase her sales and her revenues. For this reason, Delphine, along with the other members of the group MARANATHA, is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan received was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn, charcoal, and some condiments

loans.name: Yenis

texts.es: Yenis de 26 años de edad  se dedica al comercio de queso, productos lácteos y gelatinas. Ella es una mujer casada que tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad, con el que sueña ver en un futuro convertido en una persona exitosa. Su esposo es conductor  de un taxi público y entre los dos generan los ingresos de su hogar. Su actividad comercial la aprendió desde que tenía 16 años de edad  y trabajaba en almacenes, para apoyar a su viuda  madre.  Por eso cuando hace tres años pensó en generar ingresos de manera autónoma, no dudó en hacer su propio negocio, pues además necesitaba al mismo tiempo dedicarse a las tareas propias de su hogar. Los productos lácteos se los traen del departamento del Magdalena y son muy naturales y frescos, lo cual le ha permitido ganar una buena clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprara queso al por mayor, aprovechando la gran demanda de este producto, que trae consigo la época de carnavales, pues a sus clientes les encanta  hacer pasabocas del queso y derivados de él, lo cual garantiza su inversión éxitosa, porque responde a los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en: Yenis is 26 years old. She sells cheese, dairy products, and gelatins. She is married and has a 1 year-old child who she hopes will become a successful person. Her husband is a public taxi driver and between the two of them they earn the income for their household. She began learning commercial business when she was 16 years old and was working in stores to help out her widowed mother. So, three years ago when she thought of a way to earn money on her own, she had no doubts about opening her own business, also because at the same time she needed to take care of tasks in her own home. She obtains her dairy products from the department of Magdalena and they are very natural and fresh, which has allowed her to gain a good number of customers. She is currently requesting a Kiva loan, her first loan from the Fundación Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy cheese at wholesale price. She will take advantage of the great demand for this product which takes place during carnaval season. Her customers love to make hors d'oeuvres from the cheese and things made from it. This guarantees a successful investment because she responds to her customer’s requests.

loans.use: to buy cheese at wholesale price

loans.name: Wangnigni Group

texts.fr: WANGNIGNI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Léonie Yvonne Afiavi (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 42 ans. Léonie Yvonne Afiavi a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Léonie Yvonne Afiavi ne vit plus avec son mari. Léonie Yvonne Afiavi n’a pas d’enfant. Léonie Yvonne Afiavi vit seule et assure seule ses divers besoins. Pour subvenir à ses besoins,  Léonie Yvonne Afiavi vend depuis neuf ans, divers produits (sucre, farine de manioc, sachet, conserves) et des bois de chauffage dans un quartier du Bénin. Léonie Yvonne Afiavi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité et pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Léonie Yvonne Afiavi désire augmenter le stock de ses produits ; ce qui lui permettra d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu. Pour cette raison, Léonie Yvonne Afiavi sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNIGNI. Le crédit consenti antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
WANGNIGNI is a group of three persons whose members reside in the same district. The group's representative, Léonie Yvonne Afiavi (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 42 years old. She halted her studies in secondary school. She no longer lives with her husband, has no children, and lives alone while seeing to her own needs. 

For nine years, Léonie Yvonne Afiavi has been selling a variety of goods (sugar, cassava flour, plastic bags, canned food) and firewood in a district in Benin. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. 

Having the goal of expanding her business and being more competitive in the market, she would like to increase her stock of goods which will enable her to increase her sales and her revenues. For this reason, Léonie Yvonne Afiavi, along with the other members of the group WANGNIGNI, is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The loan granted previously was indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy various goods (sugar, cassava flour, canned food) and some firewood

loans.name: Taalaykul

texts.ru: Таалайкул 50 лет, замужем. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, 20 лет назад  Таалайкул начала свой бизнес в животноводстве со стартовой суммой 40,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Таалайкул, на сегодня  ее хозяйство , насчитывающее 2 коровы, 1 кобылицу и 13 овец, приносит около 15,000 сом в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов.   Для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Таалайкул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров. Доходы Таалайкул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Taalaykul is 50 years old and married. In search of a financing source for her family, she started her own business in animal husbandry twenty years ago with an initial sum of 40,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Taalaykul's persistent work, her business today has two cows, one mare and thirteen sheep and yields about 15,000 som per month from sales of milk and milk products.  To further expand her business, Taalaykul requested a loan in the sum of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy dairy cows. She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila es una mujer de 52 años, se considera como una persona correcta, alegre, trabajadora y luchadora por el bienestar de su familia. Lucila vive con su esposo, un hijo y sus nietos en la ciudad de Ibarra en la Provincia de Imbabura.

Lucila trabaja con su hijo en la crianza de animales como cerdos, vacas, lo cual sirve para la venta y producción de leche. Trabaja con Fodemi cerca de 10 años, el actual crédito que solicitó es para la compra de cerdos y una vaca lechera que le ayudarán a incrementar sus ventas e ingresos, lo que servirá para cubrir los gastos de la familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Lucila sueña en comprar muchas vacas y dedicarse a la producción de leche, también anhela tener una camioneta para distribuir sus productos.
texts.en:
Lucila is 52 years old. She considers herself to be a moral, cheerful, and hardworking person who works for the wellbeing of her family. Lucila lives with her husband, a son, and her grandchildren in the city of Ibarra in the province of Imbabura. 

Lucila works with her son to raise animals like pigs and cows, which can be sold or used for milk production. She has been working with FODEMI for nearly 10 years. The current loan she is requesting is for buying pigs and a milk cow, which will help her to increase her sales and income, which will serve to cover the family’s expenses and improve their quality of life. 

Lucila dreams of buying many cows and dedicating herself to milk production.  She also wishes to have a small truck for distributing her products.

loans.use: to buy young pigs and a milk cow

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 50-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two children, who are both studying. He’s seeking to cover his family expenses and offer them a fair way of living. 

Jihad is a civil engineer and has opened his own office in 2011. He has sixteen years of experience in the engineering field.   Today, he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new laptop in addition to some architectural tools. He notes that this will speed up his work and facilitate it as well. In the future, he plans to take on bigger projects and increase his earnings.

loans.use: buy a laptop and architectural tools

loans.name: Fifa Ayimevo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFA AYIMEVO est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Baï Mélanie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Baï Mélanie est âgée de 29 ans et est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Emile. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Baï Mélanie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Baï Mélanie n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a huit ans que Baï Mélanie mène comme activité, la vente de pâte fermentée (à base de farine de maïs) de façon ambulante afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Baï Mélanie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Baï Mélanie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFA AYIMEVO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The group FIFA AYIMEVO has three women members who live in the same neighborhood. The leader of the group is Baï Mélanie, who has her hand raised in the photograph. Baï Mélanie is 29 years old and is married to a retailer named Emile. The couple takes care of their two children who are still in school. Baï Mélanie lives with her husband and children and together they are responsible for all the family expenses. Baï Mélanie didn't complete much schooling. For the past 8 years, she has sold corn meal dough door-to-door to help with the family's needs. She purchases her inventory at a market in Bénin. As her goal is to satisfy her client's demand and to grow the business, Baï Mélanie is requesting together with her group FIFA AYIMEVO, a second loan with ALIDé. The first loan was properly reimbursed.

loans.use: to purchase bags of corn, other condiments and oil.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio is 54 years old and lives in Centro Napu,Tudela.  He is married and has 3 children. 

Bonifacio has a furniture business and earns approximately PHP 10000 each month doing this type of work.  He has requested a loan of PHP 50000 to purchase additional materials such as nails, plywood, etc.
 
Bonifacio has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: buy nails, plywood, etc.

loans.name: Marchie

texts.en: Marchie is 29 years old and married. She is living in Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, where her wide array of rice production is located. She normally receives PHP 6,000 a month. In 2010, Marchie joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure to increase production. When the crop is harvested, the revenue from it will be allotted to expanding the farm area to earn more income and to sustain her daily needs.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO est un groupe composé de trois personnes, et dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Joséphine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 43 ans. Joséphine est  mariée à un revendeur du nom de Mathias. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Joséphine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Joséphine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Joséphine vend depuis sept ans, des amuses gueules (faits à base d'arachide et d'acajou) dans un marché du Bénin. Joséphine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Joséphine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
GBENONKPO is a group composed of three persons whose members reside in the same district. The group's representative, Joséphine (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 43 years old and married to a retailer by the name of Mathias. They have three children, all provided with schooling and in their care. Joséphine lives together with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered. 

Joséphine did not attend school. For seven years, she has been selling  tasty treats (made from peanuts and cashews) at a market in Benin. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Having the goal of expanding her business to be more competitive in the marketplace, Joséphine, along with the other members of the group GBENONKPO, is requesting an initial loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy sacks of peanuts, bottles, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is married with 5 children.  She is 47 years old and lives in Buenavista, Tudela.  Jessie is a farmer and grows  fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 22 years. 

Jessie has requested a loan of  PHP 14900 to purchase additional fertilizer for planting crops.  She has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Jessie hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 34-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He’s the main source of income for his family and the one covering his children’s study fees.  

Fadi started his own business as an electrician and plumber in 1990 and continues still. He works upon request on a free-lance basis. Today, he asks for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy additional electrical and plumbing tools. This will definitely allow him to take on more projects, thus increasing his profits. In the future, he plans to open his own plumbing and electrical equipment shop.

loans.use: buy electrical and plumbing tools

loans.name: Danilse De Jesus

texts.es: Danilse invirtió su anterior crédikiva en materiales e insumos con los que confeccionó prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, además de uniformes escolares, que vendió porque trabajó sobre la solicitud de sus clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos como telas en mayor cantidad, para lograr descuentos por pagos de contado y en mayor volumen; con esta inversión logrará financiar la cartera de crédito que tiene con sus clientes de las fábricas. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Gracias por el apoyo importante que están prestando con los recursos a bajo costo. “
texts.en: Danilse invested her previous Kiva loan in materials and supplies with which she made articles of clothing for women, men and children, as well as school uniforms, which she sold because they were orders from her clients. Currently, she’s requesting a Kiva loan to buy basic materials and supplies like fabric in big supply, so she can get discounts for paying in cash and buying large quantities. With this loan, she’ll be able to finance the credit she has with her clients at the factories. Her message to the lenders at Kiva is the following: "Thank you for the important support you are providing at low rates."

loans.use: buy basic materials and supplies like fabric, in big supply, so she can get discounts for paying in cash and buying large quantities.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 49 años que le gusta ser trabajadora, responsable, honrada y luchadora para poder sacar adelante a su familia. María vive con su hijo y la esposa de el en la ciudad de Ibarra.

María trabaja sola en la crianza de pollos para la venta en los puestos del mercado. Ya son tres años que trabaja con Fodemi, el actual crédito que solicita es para invertir en la adecuación del galpón debido a que está en muy malas condiciones y los pollos se están muriendo por falta de espacio, también comprará pollos para criarlos y venderlos y así obtener buenos ingresos, que le ayudarán a sustentar los gastos de su familia.

María sueña en construir varios galpones grandes para ser una comerciante mayorista.
texts.en:
María is a 49 year-old woman who enjoys being hardworking, responsible, honest, and working to help her family get ahead. María lives with her son and his wife in the city of Ibarra. 

María works by herself raising chickens for sale in the market stalls. She has been working with FODEMI for three years. The loan she is currently requesting is for improving her chicken coop because it is in very bad condition and the chickens are dying because of a lack of space. She will also buy chicks to raise them and sell them. This way she can have good income, which will help her to pay her family’s expenses. 

María dreams of building several large chicken coops so she can be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to improve her chicken coop, because it is in bad condition, and to buy more chicks to raise

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is from Prenza Tangub City. She is 45 years old.  Evelyn is widowed and has 2 children. 

To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a banana production business.  She has been in her business for 15 years and earns 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.  In 2010, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 17,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: buy seeds and seedlings

loans.name: Richell

texts.en: Richell is 34 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She is from Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Richell used her last loan  to purchase additional products to sell. Her business has grown and become successful.  Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  She hopes to be able to grow her business more.

loans.use: buy products to resell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 62-year-old Lebanese married man. He’s living with his wife and two school-aged children. He’s doing his best to be able to offer them a respectable life. 

Mohammad opened his own car oil and batteries shop in 2009 and has a variety of products. Today, he is looking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of oil and batteries for his business. He notes that this will boost his sales and allow him to earn superior income. In the future, he plans to better develop his business and increase his revenues.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of oil and batteries for his business.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 65 years old and lives in Sebac, Tudela.  She is married and has 3 children. 

Bernardita has a general store that sells variety of products.  She has had this business for 15 years.  Bernardita requested a loan of PHP 25000 to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Bernardita has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: buy products to resell

loans.name: New Vision Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 36-year-old Lorraine from Harare. She is married with one child, who attends school.  Lorraine runs a retail business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for 6 years. She says the main challenge she faces is poor market facility to operate from. 

Lorraine has requested a loan of $400 to buy more clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to  improve the welfare of her family. In the future, Lorraine plans to operate a shop in the Central Business District of Harare.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Assurance De Phaeton 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Jaccint est le coordinateur de son groupe Assurance de Phaeton. Il habite dans la région de  Assurance où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité.

Jaccint a dirigé son  commerce de poisson pendant les 9 dernières années.  Il est marie il a 4 enfants.  Avant de commencer ce commerce Jaccint  etait a l'ecole

Jaccint voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir  dans l´achat des paniers. Jaccint espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son entreprise
