Des autres membres  Assurance ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon, vetements usees et produits alimentaires
texts.en:
Jaccint is the coordinator of her group "Assurance de Phaeton". He lives in the Assurance region, where electricity is rare, and water is very limited. 

Jaccint has directed his fish business for the last nine years. He is married and has four children. Before starting this business, he was in school.

Jaccint would like to use this loan to invest in baskets. He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his enterprise.

The other members of Assurance have need of a loan for businesses involving charcoal, used clothing, and food.

loans.use: to buy baskets

loans.name: Ritchelle

texts.en:
Ritchelle is 50 years old, married and has one child. 

Ritchelle is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 17000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ritchelle has been raising pigs for 7 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business. In the future, Ritchelle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nounagnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NOUNAGNON est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Adjo, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Adjo est âgée de 28 ans et est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Jean. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Adjo vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Adjo n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a six ans que Adjo mène comme activité, la vente de divers produits (savons, pâtes alimentaires, liqueurs) dans son quartier afin de contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille. Adjo s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Adjo sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NOUNAGNON, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The NOUNAGNON group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood.  Adjo is the representative of the group, and she is raising her hand in the photo.  She is 28 years old and married to a reseller named Jean.  The couple has two children, both in school and both their dependents.  Adjo lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various family expenses with her husband.

Adjo never attended school.  For the past six years, she has been selling various products such as soap, pasta and liqueurs, in her neighborhood, in order to cover her family's needs.  She stocks up at a market in Benin.

In order to meet the needs of her customers, and to increase her turnover and income, she and the other members of the NOUNAGNON group are requesting a second loan from ALIDé.  The previous loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy various products such as soap, liqueurs, and pasta.

loans.name: Fuerza 2008 Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal FUERZA 2008; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia María tiene 46 años es separada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de pizzería ella trabaja conjuntamente con su hija de acuerdo a un horario ya que la socia a la vez la socia trabaja en un restaurante turístico, la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia, la socia desea poder agrandar su negocio abriendo una nueva pizzería, la socia trabaja todos los días para de esta manera brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como queso,embutidos,harina,aceitunas entre otros.

Los otros socios se dedican a la compra y venta de leña, brindar el servicio de taxi, venta  de fruta, compra y venta de ropa, venta de materiales de construcción, venta de refrigerios al paso.

La socia agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Communal Bank “Fuerza 2008” (Strength 2008), which is located in the District of Wanchaq in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 46 years old, separated from her spouse, and has four children. María divides her time between her daily activities and her pizzeria business. She works with her daughter based on a schedule since she also works at a tourist restaurant. María is a cheerful and responsible person who greatly desires to move her family forward. She wants to expand her business by opening a new pizzeria. María works every day so that she can provide her children a better quality of life. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her business such as cheese, sausages, flour, olives, and other items.

The other members buy and sell wool, provide taxi services, sell fruit, buy and sell clothing, sell construction materials, and sell snacks on the go.

María is grateful for this channel by which she is able to access a loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business such as cheese, sausages, flour, olives, and other items.

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es: Maria tiene 19 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla, lugar donde se desempeña como confeccionista de prendas de vestir en las diferentes líneas femenina y masculina e infantil. Su negocio es producto de la herencia que dio a ella su madre, quien lo tenia desde hace alrededor de 10 años. Ella aunque conocía el oficio de manera empírica, lo perfeccionó mediante cursos técnicos. Con su negocio le ha ido muy bien y maneja una clientela fija, a quienes les confecciona uniformes y también hace trabajos personales bajo medidas.  Su meta mas adelante es tener toda la infraestructura técnica necesaria para elaborar nuevos diseños y variedades de productos. En la actualidad  tiene muchos encargos de uniformes y un contrato al que responder con un colegio y no cuenta con un capital de trabajo suficiente para invertir.  sus proveedores son almacenes a los cuales le compra de contado. Sus activos estan representados en sus maquinas y cuentas por cobrar y cuenta con el apoyo económico de su conyuge.Sus cuentas por cobrar rotan rapidamente lo mismo que sus inventarios presentado buen manejo de su cartera.  Actualmente está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que ahce a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas para responder a su contrato y una maquina plana para mejorar los tiempos productivos y la calidad de la prenda. Su inversión es exitosa porque ha sace sobre pedidos y en el marco de la expericnia de 10 años que fortalece su madre.
texts.en:
Maria is 19 years old and lives in the city of Barranquilla.  She works as a seamstress making clothing for different lines of women's, men's and children's clothing.  Her business is the product of an inheritance given to her by her mother, who had it for about ten years.  She knew the business from experience, but perfected it in technical courses.

She has done well with her business and has a set customer base for whom she makes uniforms and also makes personal items to measure.  Her goal in the future is to have all of the technical infrastructure necessary to make new designs and varieties of products.  Currently, she has many orders for uniforms and a contract to fulfill from a high school and she does not have enough working capital to invest.  Her suppliers are stores where she makes purchases in cash.  Her assets are her machines and accounts receivable and she has the financial support of her spouse.  Her accounts receivable rotate their inventories quickly, so her portfolio is well managed.  

She is applying for this loan, her first with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, so that she can purchase supplies to fulfill her contract and a sewing machine to improve her production times and the quality of her work.  Her investment is exciting because she has orders and the mark of 10 years of experience that her mother strengthened.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to complete her contract and a sewing machine to improve production time.

loans.name: Neganda1 Group

texts.en:
Shumirai is a 48-year-old married woman from Masvingo with 4 children, aged 22, 19, 11 and 4 years. Three of her children are still at school.  She operates a poultry project and also has a flea market stall. She has 2 employees working for her and has been in the business for 15 years. 

Shumirai has requested for a loan of $200 to buy stock feeds as well as clothes for resale, for the other business of clothes selling she is running.  With the income generated from the loan, Shumirai will be able to pay school fees for children on time. She says the major challenges she faces are of chicks dying prematurely because of outbreak of some diseases. 

Shumirai is planning to operate her poultry business on a larger scale in the next five years and also to have a much bigger flea market.

loans.use: to buy stock feeds and clothes

loans.name: Alasgar

texts.en:
Alasgar is 33 years old.  He is married and has two small children. He is engaged in cattle breeding and also he uses his own car as a taxi service. 

Alasgar has been selling milk and dairy products at the bazaar for about 12 years. He wants to obtain a loan of 1600 AZN to buy a calf.  He will feed it up and re-sell it at the local bazaar. Alasgar plans to increase his income and expand his business. He wants to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: buy a calf

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 35-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. He’s the main source of income in the family and is looking for a better future. 

Abbas started working as a blacksmith in 2005 and has his own shop.   Now he has a fair number of loyal customers. Today, he’s asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new supplies for his business such, as metal. This will help him continue his work in a proper way and develop his business. In the future, he plans to enhance his work and take bigger projects.

loans.use: buy metalwork supplies

loans.name: Bleidis

texts.es: Bleidis de 34 años de edad, es una mujer casada que tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 2 y 12 años. . Ella tiene una refresquería en el centro de la ciudad. Su actividad de negocio inició con la venta de minutos y cuando empezó a generar ingresos en un punto fijo se le presentó la oportunidad de arrendar un local. Así fue que con algunos ahorros de su cónyuge, quien realiza actividades de mensajería, emprendió su aventura de negocios de refresquería. Sus ingresos gradualmente fueron aumentando en la medida en que se posicionaba en el local y su calidad de vida fue aumentando. Hoy la exigente clientela en un mercado competitivo tiene nuevas exigencias  y su capital  de trabajo no es suficiente para mantener surtido su negocio, especialmente en la temporada de carnaval, cuando se incrementan sus ventas por el aumento del consumo de refrescos y bebidas. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará refrescos, bebidas, galletas y pasabocas. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propia casa y mantener surtido y diversificada su oferta.
texts.en: Bleidis, who is 34 years old, is a married woman that has two children who are 2 and 12 years old.  She has a beverage store in the city's downtown.  Her business began with the sale of small snacks, and when she began to make income in a certain location, she was offered the opportunity to lease a place.  In this way, with some savings from her husband, who does messenger activities, she launched her beverage shop business adventure.  Her income gradually increased since she positioned herself in the location, and her quality of life has improved.  Today the demanding clientele in a competitive market has new requests, and her working capital is not sufficient to keep her business well-stocked, especially in the carnival season when her sales go up because of the increase in consumption of soft-drinks and beverages.  This is the reason that she is turning to her Kiva creditor.  This is the first financing that Fundación Mario Santa Domingo is doing for her, with which she will buy soft-drinks, beverages, cookies, and snacks.  Her goal is to have her own house and to keep her supplies stocked and diversified in the future.

loans.use: buy soft-drinks, beverages, cookies, and snacks.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 32 years old and married with one child.   She works hard to provide for her family.   

Gemma runs a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines.  She has been running the store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.  

Gemma requested a PHP 20500 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.  She has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan.   Gemma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: buy items to resell

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is from Malibangcao, Ozamiz City. She is 67 years old.  Pilar is married and has ten children. 

To make a living, Pilar owns and operates a retail store.  She has been in her business for 5 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Pilar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Pilar is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: buy products to resell

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo es un joven emprendedor de 28 años de edad, es soltero y sin hijos, actualmente esta viviendo en la casa de sus padres la cual esta ubicada en un caserío rural donde los habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería exclusivamente por ser un pequeño caserío en vías de desarrollo por ahora solo cuentan con energía eléctrica, el caserío lleva por nombre “Ayar Uchu” perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande en la provincia de Piura.

Rodolfo cuenta con un terreno agrícola el cual es herencia de su padre, en el que actualmente mantiene  plantaciones de Limón, en la parte posterior de su casa cría ganado que después de haberlos hecho llegar a su tamaño y peso ideal los ofrece en los mercados locales, adicionalmente Rodolfo también cuenta con un vehiculo menor en el cual se dedica a dar servicio de transporte en toda la zona donde vive, así de esa manera se genera sus ingresos para hacer frente a sus responsabilidades.

Desea mejorar su calidad de vida junto a la de sus padres por lo que siempre esta buscando nuevas oportunidades con las que le puede generar mayores ingresos, ahora ha decidido solicitar un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 3000 Nuevos Soles los cuales empleará en la compra de fertilizantes para sus plantación y alimentos balanceados para el engorde de su ganad.
A pesar de ser joven ha asumido con bastante responsabilidad el apoyar a sus padres a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is a young entrepreneur, 28 years old, single and without children. Currently he is living in his parent’s house, which is located in a rural settlement where the inhabitants engage exclusively in agriculture and cattle raising. As of now, the village is in the process of development and has only electricity. The settlement is called “Ayar Uchu” and it belongs to Tambogrande District in Piura Province.

Rodolfo has an agricultural plot which was given him by his father. There he currently plants lemons. At the rear of his house he raises cattle and after they reach an ideal size and weight he takes them to local markets. As well Rodolfo has a small vehicle in which he provides transportation services all over the area where he lives. In this way he generates an income to take care of his obligations.

He wants to improve his quality of life, as well as that of his parents, and is always looking for new opportunities to generate more income. Now he has decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 3,000 nueveos soles . He will use it to purchase fertilizer for his farm and feed to fatten his cattle.

Despite being a young man, he has responsibly assumed the responsibility of helping his parents improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and cattle feed.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old and lives in San Vicente, Sinacaban.  She is married and has 3 children.  

Josephine has a general store that sells a variety of products.  She has had this business for 24 years.  

Josephine requested a loan of PHP 7000 to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.   She has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.  In the future, Josephine hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: buy products to resell

loans.name: Zepyur

texts.en:
Zepyur is progressing with her trading business in Sevan. Thanks to her first Kiva loan, now she sells not only clothes but also shoes. Also, Zepyur was able to enlarge her stall and now she shows to the best advantage her wide assortment of products.

Zepyur continues to bring merchandise from Yerevan once a week and now she is asking for a $2800 loan to buy spring blouses, sweaters, trousers and shoes to resell.

loans.use: buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en:
Suzanne is a 36-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and three children who are still attending school. Suzanne and her husband are joining forces to be able to pay their children’s educational fees. Her husband is working as a taxi driver and has been for four years. As for Suzanne, she has owned a beauty salon since 2008, where she also makes body tattoos. 

Today, Suzanner is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added beauty products and tattoo supplies for her salon. She notes that this will boost her business and allow her to attract new customers. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty center.

loans.use: buy beauty products and tattoo supplies

loans.name: Diyite De Piste 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Luma est le coordinateur de son groupe  diyite de pistere. Il n`est pas marié et il a 4 enfants. Luma habite dans la région nord d’Haiti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Luma a dirigé son commerce pendant les dernières 15 années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, il vent des produits alimentaires et boissons gaseuse. Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir à l`achat des boissons gaseuse

Des autres membres de (son de groupe) ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme le charbon et divers produits.

Luma dit que son but principal  est  d'avoir un plus grand commerce
texts.en:
Luma is the coordinator of the Diyite de Pistere group. He is single and has four children. Luma lives in the northern region of Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited.

Luma has run his business for the past 15 years. Before starting this business, he sold foodstuffs and carbonated beverages. She would like to use this loan to invest in buying carbonated beverages.

Other members (of his group) need loans for business activities such as selling coal and various other products.

Luma says that his main goal is to have a larger business.

loans.use: to buy carbonated beverages

loans.name: Verminia

texts.en:
Verminia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. She earns additional income from raising livestock.

Verminia is borrowing 20000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her business.

Verminia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her two children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing net.

loans.name: Union Progreso Group

texts.es: La Sra. María es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Unión Progreso” grupo conformado por 11 mujeres trabajadoras comprometidas con el Programa- Prosperidad. María tiene 53 años de edad es separada con 05 hijos 01 de ellos aun dependiente. María lleva más de 03 años brindando servicio de costura poco a poco ha mejorado su estabilidad económica,  y con el buen uso que le dio a sus ingresos recientemente acaba de aperturar una librería en su domicilio. María es una mujer empeñosa que con su trabajo a podido apoyar a sus hijos en su educación. Con el fin de seguir creciendo en su librería solicito el crédito para comprar útiles escolares como cuadernos, vinifan, lapiceros, folderes etc. El deseo de María es de seguir creciendo en su librería. La Alcancía Comunal “Unión Progreso” agradecen el crédito brindado ya que hacen posible su progreso.
texts.en:
María is a member of the community bank "Unión Progreso", which is made up of 11 hardworking women from the Prosperity Program.  María is 53 years old and separated.  She has five children, one of whom is still dependent on her. 

María has worked as a seamstress for more than three years and slowly improved her economic stability.  With the good use of her profits, she recently opened a bookstore in her home. María is an earnest woman whose work has been able to support her children's education.  

With the goal of continuing to expand her bookstore, she is asking for this loan to purchase school supplies such as notebooks, Vinifan [clear plastic covering for textbooks], pens, folders, and other items.  María's dream is to continue expanding her bookstore.  

The Unión Progreso community bank is thankful for the loan provided since it makes their progress possible.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, Vinifan, pens, and folders.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: This time Narcisa is borrowing 15,000 PHP to purchase additional stock to sell. The eggs and firewood sales business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide her and her family with income to continue improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Beatriz María

texts.es:
Beatriz tiene 41 años, se describe como una persona alegre, emprendedora y sobre todo muy trabajadora para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Beatriz vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en la ciudad de Ibarra Provincia de Imbabura.

Beatríz tiene una pequeña tienda montada en su casa la cuál es su principal fuente de ingresos para su familia, al momento cuenta con buena clientela pero tiene un problema que su tienda no tiene mucha variedad de productos, entonces los clientes compran en otros lados, es por eso que solicita un crédito a Fodemi con  el afan de comprar productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, fideo, fréjol, atun, aceites, gaseosas, carnicos para que sus clientes tengan variedad al escojer. Esta inversión permitirá aumentar su clientela, sus ventas y sus ingresos que ayudarán a mantener a su familia.

Beatríz sueña con tener un micromercado y una ferretería para poder brindar empleo a las personas que lo necesiten.
texts.en:
Beatriz, age 41, describes herself as a happy, enterprising person who is, above all, working very hard to get her children ahead. Beatriz lives with her husband and three children in the city of Ibarra, Imbabura province.
Beatriz has a small store in her home. It is her main source of income. At the moment, she has a good customer base, but she has a problem: she does not have a good variety of products, so her customers go elsewhere. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Fodemi for the purchase of basic staples such as: rice, pasta, beans, tuna, oil, pop, and meat so that her customers will have a good variety to choose from. This investment will allow her to expand her customer base, increase her sales, and increase her income. This will help her to support her family.
Beatriz dreams of having a small market and a hardware store so that she can employ people who need it.

loans.use: to stock her home with supplies such as rice, pasta, beans, tuna, oil, pop, and meat, so that her customers will have a variety to choose from.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 53 years old.  She is married to Paul and blessed with three children aged 44, 35, and 30 years, respectively.  She owns a kiosk business which she started 28 years ago, and she earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

Anne has requested a loan for KES 25,000 to pay school fees.  She hopes to upgrade her business premises and improve her living standard.  This is her second loan.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Jean D'amour

texts.fr:
Jean d’Amour est né au Rwanda. Il a 32 ans et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 1 à 10 ans, dont 2 enfants sont scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Jean d’Amour est chauffeur de taxi moto. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter ciment, tôles et payer la main d’œuvre  des maçon pour le finissage de sa maison.

Dans les prochaines années, Jean d’Amour voudrait être un chauffeur des automobiles et fournir les services de transport automobile. Avec les profits, il prévoit  de scolariser ses enfants et améliore le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jean d'Amour was born in Rwanda.  He is 32 years old, married, and has three children ranging from 1 to 10 years.  Two of his children attend school.  His own education level is 6 years of elementary school.

Jean d'Amour provides taxi services on his motorcycle.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  As he is finishing his house, he is going to use his loan to buy cement, steel sheets, and to pay for the masons' labor. 

In the coming years, Jean d'Amour would like to be a car driver and provide car transportation services.  With the profits, he is planning to send his children to school and improve the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, steel sheets, and to pay for the labor of the masons who help him finish his house.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 46-year-old married Lebanese man. He lives with his wife and two children, both of whom are in school. He strives to work really hard in order to enrich their way of living and cover the heavy life costs. Mahmoud had twenty years of experience as a furniture painter when he decided to open his own shop in 2000. He has gained a fair number of clients so far. Today, he has the intention to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new painting tools and develop his business. He notes that this will improve his business and enhance the way he works.  In the future, he plans to open his own furniture gallery.

loans.use: to purchase new painting tools and develop his business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Maria works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Maria is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase fishing nets and other materials for the repair of her fishing equipment.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing net and other materials for the repair of her fishing equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, leader du groupe d’affaire «Gloria », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 43  ans, mariée, mère de 8 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Son mari est un professeur enseignant. Elle est  vendeuse de denrées alimentaires. Il y a  10 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  14eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  2 sacs de braises, 2 sacs de farines, arachides, tomates,  de pommes de terre, huile,  etc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et accroitre son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The client, leader of the "Gloria" group, is an entrepreneur, 43 years old, and married. She has eight young children who are all undertaking studies. Her husband is a professor.

She sells foodstuffs. She has been performing little revenue-generating activities like this for the past ten years. She just obtained her 14th loan from Hekima. This new loan will enable her to buy 2 bags of charcoal, 2 bags of flour, peanuts, tomatoes, potatoes, oil, etc. In addition, she hopes to see her children grow up comfortably, and expand her business.

She would like to thank Hekima for helping poor women who do not have access to classic banking.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of charcoal, 2 bags of flour, peanuts, tomatoes, potatoes, oil, etc.

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.es: Bienvenida de 41 años de edad es madre de dos hijos y ha logrado avanzar en su bienestar familiar, mediante su propio negocio en el que se dedica a la venta de accesorios y celulares, dese hace 7 años;  el local donde se encuentra ubicado es propio y posee  una  clientela fija y ocasional prque se encuentra bien ubicado; sus principales clientes son personas  localizada en el sector y en los municipios aledaños  a los cuales ofrece  crédito,  pero generalmente sus ventas son de contado; sus proveedores son almacenes de Barranquilla a los cuales le compra de contado.  En su negocio le va muy bien porque tien un gran reconocimiento de esta población, pero ante la creciente demanda su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente para atender oportunamente a su clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual recurre a un credikiva mediante el cual comprará carcasas, bateria, celulares, para surtir su negocio y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos, cada vez mas modernos. Su meta mas adelante es comprar nuevas vitrinas para enfocar al cliente y mantener ordenado su espacio de exhibición, haciendo mas atractiva su oferta, para potencializar nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Bienvenida is 41, and the mother of two children. She has succeeded in advancing her family's welfare through her own business, in which she has been  selling cell phones and accessories for seven years. She owns the shop where her business is located, and has an established clientele, as well as drop-in customers, because she has a good location. 

Her main customers are people who live in the area, and in the neighboring municipalities, to whom she offers credit. But generally, her sales are for cash. Her suppliers are stores in Barranquilla, from whom she buys with cash.  Her business is going very well, because it is widely recognized by people who live here. But faced with growing demand, her working capital has become insufficient to serve her customers appropriately. 

This is the reason why she is resorting to a credikiva loan with which she will buy cell phones, cell phone covers, and batteries. This is order to supply her business and offer a greater variety of products that are more and more modern. Her future goal is to buy new display cases, in order to focus on the customer and keep her display space tidy. This will make what she sells more attractive, enabling her to attract new customers.

loans.use: To buy cell phones, cell phone covers, and batteries, for supplying her business and to offer a greater variety of products.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр с женой и двумя детьми живет в селе Водяное. Он выращивает помидоры, огурцы, редис. У Александра есть 5 больших теплиц и 2 отдельные теплицы под рассаду, все под отоплением. Он занимается выращиванием овощей уже 10 лет. В хозяйство вложено около 200 000 гривен. Ежегодно приходится тратить около 84 000 гривен на семена и полиэтиленовую пленку для утепления теплиц. 

Дополнительные средства в размере 20 000 гривен Александру необходимы для того, чтобы закупить уголь для отопления теплиц. У него установлена система отопления в каждой из теплиц, но она потребляет много угля, который с каждым годом только дорожает в Украине. Александр видит перспективу для своего бизнеса в этом регионе страны. Рядом с его домом продаются два земельных участка. Он хочет купить их под свой бизнес и расширяться дальше. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Alexander, his wife and their two children live in the village of Vodyanoye. He grows tomatoes, cucumbers and radishes. Alexander has five large greenhouses and two separate ones for seedlings. All the greenhouses are heated. Alexander has been growing vegetables for ten years and has approximately 200,000 Ukrainian hryvnias (UAH) invested in the business. He spends about 84,000 UAH annually on seeds and polyethylene sheeting to insulate the greenhouses. Alexander needs another 20,000 UAH to purchase coal to keep the greenhouses heated. He has set up a heating system in each greenhouse, but it requires a lot of coal, which is getting more and more expensive each year in Ukraine. Alexander believes there is a good future for his business in this region of the country. Near his home there are two plots of land for sale. Alexander hopes to purchase the land for his business and to continue expanding.

loans.use: to purchase coal to heat vegetable greenhouses

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a 31-year-old man from Homabay.  He is married to Caroline and they have two children, aged one and three years.

Benard has operated a hides and skins business for the last three years, making a monthly income of KES 10,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy more hides and skins for sale. He will also use a portion of the loan to add stock to his other business selling cereals. 

Benard intends to use his profits to educate his children. His dream is to educate.

loans.use: To buy hides and skins for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies for the sale of juice, as well as working equipment.

loans.name: Camino Al Progreso (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Camino al Progreso está formado por 11 socias, quienes viven alrededor de la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, parroquia que es conocida como el Mirador, Turi posee hermosos paisaje, cultura propia, una economía artesanal y una arquitectura vernácula. Su gente en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales. Nuestras socias son mujeres luchadoras y muy trabajadoras que se dedican a varias actividades las mismas  que les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares y sacar  adelante a sus familias, se caracterizan por el carisma y alegría de todo el grupo.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Carmen, tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos,  3 son casados y viven independientes y sus hijos solteros tienen 18, 12 y 5 años de edad, su hijo de 18 años pasa en casa y sus dos últimos hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la rama de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña María Carmen labora de lunes a viernes medio día en el cultivo y cuidado de su plantación de fresas, actividad que la desempeña hace dos años, el otro medio día se dedica a  bordar actividad que desempeña hace 30 años pero solo borda bajo pedido. 

Este es su primer crédito y lo va a invertir en abonos y fertilizantes para mejorar la producción de fresas. 

Su sueño es exportar su producto. 

Los niños de la foto soin hijos de dos socias.
texts.en:
The community bank El Camino al Progreso is made up of eleven members who live around the parrish of Turi in Cuenca, which is known as the viewpoint.  Turi has beautiful landscapes, its own culture, a craft economy, and vernacular architecture.  The majority of the inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals.  Our members are strong and hardworking women who work in a variety of fields, which allows them to support their households and get their families ahead.  The group is characterized by charisma and happiness.  

One of the members of this group is María Carmen, who is 42 years old, married, and has six children.  Three are married and live independently and the others are 5, 12, and 18 years old.  Her 18 year old son is at home and her two other children are studying in a school in the city.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer, and they own their own home.

María Carmen works from Monday to Friday for half the day cultivating her strawberry plants, work she has done for two years.  The other half of the day she spends embroidering, work she has done for 30 years, but only makes items by special order.

This is her first loan and she will invest it in manure and fertilizers to improve her strawberry production.  Her dream is to export her products.

The children in the photo are children of two community bank members.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Las Pilitas Group

texts.es: El Banco comunal Las Pilitas está conformadores por 9 emprendedores que se unieron para salir adelante juntos con cada uno de sus negocios, ellos se apoyan y se motivan para salir adelante  brindándose nuevas ideas para sus negocios. La emprendedora Francisca Del Rosario es una emprendedora que es parte de este grupo y su negocio al que se dedica es a la venta de tortilla el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación donde atiende a sus clientes, ella está solicitando financiamiento para comprar leña, cal, maíz entre otros materiales para la elaboración de la tortillas.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Las Pilitas" consists of nine entrepreneurs who have joined together so that they can move forward with each of their businesses. They support and motivate one another as they move forward and all of them bring new ideas for their businesses.

Francisca Del Rosario is one of the entrepreneurs who is part of this group. Her business consists of selling tortillas and is located in her home where she is able to attend to her customers. She is requesting a loan in order to buy firewood, lime, corn, and other supplies for making tortillas.

loans.use: to buy firewood, lime, corn, and other supplies for making tortillas.

loans.name: Anderson

texts.es: Anderson  de 24 años de edad se dedica a la venta de calzado de distintos tipos, los cuales adquiere en almacenes de la ciudad de Barranquilla y también compra a otro microempresario.  Sus ventas las realiza de contado en un punto comercial y maneja también algunos créditos.  Su negocio es brillante y maneja una buena rentabilidad, por  lo cual desea captar la atención de una nueva clientela, haciendo una mejor exhibición de su calzado, con nuevos diseños y en un mayor volumen, que el que usualmente acostumbra. Esta es la razón de su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante l cual comprará Calzado al por mayor y de contado, asegurando mayores descuentos que trasladará a su clientela ofreciendo buenos precios. Su inversión será exitosa, porque se acerca el carnaval de Barranquilla, época en la cual las ventas de productos alusivos a este se incrementan y eso es justamente lo que va a hacer Anderson: a comprar sandalias para el carnaval.
texts.en: Anderson, who is 25 years old, sells footwear of various types, which he acquires in stores in the city of Barranquilla and also buys from another micro-business. He makes his sales for cash at a commercial location and also manages some credit accounts. His business is lively and has good profitability, so he wants to capture the attention of a new clientele, making a better display of his footwear, with new designs and in greater numbers than what he is usually accustomed to. This is the reason for his Kiva loan, the first financing that he has had from Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which he will buy footwear wholesale and for cash, assuring greater discounts which he will pass on to his customers, offering better prices. His investment will be successful, because the Carnaval of Barranquilla is coming, a time in which the sales of related products grows, and this is exactly what Anderson is going to do: buy sandals for the Carnaval.

loans.use: to buy sandals to sell during Carnaval

loans.name: Sarita Nataly

texts.es:
Sarita tiene 21 años, vive en el caserío de Santiago, perteneciente a la ciudad de Ica, Perú, este caserío se caracteriza por su actividad principal que es la agricultura y por sus pobladores que son gente muy amable y acogedora, como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida y uno de los platos que más le gusta es el riquísimo Ceviche; ella estudio hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Ingeniería de Sistemas	.

Con mucho esfuerzo, sacrificio y sobre todo ahorro Sarita pudo iniciar su negocio de venta de hamburguesas y salchipapas, se dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 4 horas, ya que ella ofrece sus productos en la noche principalmente, asimismo sarita trabaja en el campo por temporadas, en especial cuando es tiempo de cosecha y con ella puede tener un dinerito extra, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con sus clientes.	
	
Sarita está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar mesas y sillas para que sus clientes puedan estar mas cómodos y así seguir trabajando para salir adelante y cumplir su gran sueño:” Terminar una carrera profesional”.
texts.en:
Sarita is 21 years old and lives in the town of Santiago near the city of Ica, Peru.  This town is characterized by its principal activity, agriculture, and by its people who are friendly and welcoming.  Like good Peruvians, they like food very much and one of the most well liked dishes is the rich ceviche.  Sarita studied until the fifth grade of secondary school, but she would have liked to study Systems Engineering.

With a lot of effort, sacrifice, and above all, saving, Sarita was able to start her business selling hamburgers and salchipapas (friend potatoes with hot dogs).  She starts her work around 4:00 since she mostly offers her products at night.  She also works in the fields seasonally, especially when it is harvest time, to earn a little extra money.  She believes her business is going well because she is very nice to her customers.

Sarita is very thankful to Kiva lenders since the support they have given her will allow her to purchase tables and chairs so that her customers can be more comfortable and she can continue working to get ahead and reach her dream, to finish a professional degree course.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs.

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 39 años, se describe como una persona fuerte y luchadora en su trabajo por el bienestar de su hijo. María vive con su hijo en un sector de Ambato en la Provincia de Tungurahua.

María trabaja sola en la crianza de ganado para la venta, es el primer crédito que realiza a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de una vaca lechera, debido a que necesita incrementar sus ingresos entrando al negocio de la venta de leche, ya que lo que realiza es su único ingreso económico para sustentar los gastos de su hogar.

María sueña con tener buenos ingresos económicos para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is a 39-year-old woman who describes herself as a strong and determined individual in her work so that she can provide for her son’s well-being. She and her son live in the sector of Ambato in Tungurahua Province.

María works alone by raising cattle to sell. This is her first loan with FODEMI, which she will invest in the purchase of a dairy cow. She needs to increase her income, so she will start a business of selling milk. Her business is the only source of financial income by which she is able to maintain her household expenses.

María dreams of having good earnings so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maykol Gerardo

texts.es:
Maykol es un joven de 26 años de edad y vive con su esposa e hijos en la comunidad de San Rafael de Florencia de San Carlos, en la provincia de Alajuela. Esta comunidad rural presenta mucho potencial de desarrollo, ya que a través de las actividades agrícolas ya que tiene un clima caliente, lo que permite la producción de ciertas frutas que se desarrollan con más fuerza en este tipo de clima asi como la siembra de mango, el melón y otros propios de la zona, es que ha logrado desarrollar actividades conexas y de servicios en la comunidad, tales como el ganado de engorde y la oportunidad de pequeños comercios y microempresas entre otros. Localidad que se caracteriza por sus parques nacionales, su extensa variedad en la flora y en la fauna. 

Desde hace unos meses Maykol tiene como meta mejorar y ampliar su vivienda, ya que se le dificulta realizarlo por sí mismo, porque sus ingresos  en estos momentos son mínimos.

El está solicitando el monto de¢750,000.00 (Setecientos cincuenta mil colones), para comprar materiales de construcción para terminar y ampliar su hogar, comprando madera y otros materiales, ya que es urgente terminar la pared  de la casa por la seguridad de su familia. 

Maykol es miembro de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de SCSAR S.A, este será su primer préstamo razón por la cual está  muy agradecida, por las oportunidades  de acceso al crédito que esta le brinda y poder llevar a cabo sus proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Maykol is a young man who is 26 years old.  He lives with his wife and children in the community of San Rafael de Florencia de San Carlos, in the province of Alajuela.  This rural community offers much potential for development through farming activities, since it has a hot climate.  This allows for the production of certain fruits that develop with greater force in this type of climate as well as the planting of mangos, melon, and other typical items of the area.  He has managed to develop related activities and services in the community, such as the fattening of cattle and the opportunity of small businesses and micro enterprises among other things.  The area is known for its national parks and its extensive variety of wildlife.

A few months ago, Maykol set a goal of improving and increasing the size of his home.  It is difficult for him to complete it on his own, because his income at this time is limited.

He is asking for the amount of 750,000.00 (seven-hundred fifty thousand colones), in order to buy construction materials to complete and increase the size of his home, buying wood and other materials, since it is urgent to finish the wall of the house for the security of his family.

Maykol is a member of the Communal Bank "Empresa de Crédito" of SCSAR S.A.  This will be his first loan, which is why he is very thankful for the opportunities to access the credit that is being offered to him and being able to complete his life projects.

loans.use: buy construction materials for his home.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel, tiene 25 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive  en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú. Raquel se dedica a preparar tortas y vende y distribuye a tiendas, pastelerías y otros. Ella tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde prepara las tortas. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar mas insumos como por ejemplo harina, azúcar, mantequilla, huevos y muchas cosas más.
texts.en: Raquel is 25 years old, has two children, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She prepare cakes that she sells and distributes to stores, pastry shops, and other establishments.  Raquel has a small shop in her home where she prepares the cakes.  She is requesting a loan to buy more supplies such as flour, sugar, butter, eggs, and other items.

loans.use: to buy more supplies such as flour, sugar, butter, eggs, and other items.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: La señora  Miriam es cliente nuevo  es su primer crédito individual la cliente vive el la ciudad de La Paz  tiene una hija es madre soltera se dedica  a la comercialización de  coca (La hoja de coca (Erythroxylum Coca) es utilizada como planta medicinal desde hace siglos, especialmente en las culturas andinas), La Sra. Miriam Trae la coca por Takes (quintales) los cuales los trae de los yungas dos veces por semana los cuales los comercializa en el mercado de la coca el crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de coca por mayor a persona que tiene licencia para la venta de coca, la Sra. Mirian es una persona muy trabajadora, se esfuerza mucho ya que el viaje a la localidad de los yungas es largo y por la carretera muy peligrosa por ser una camino muy accidentado, pero ella siempre fuerte, para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Miriam is a new client and this is her first individual loan.  She lives in the city of La Paz and is a single mother to one daughter.  She works selling coca.  The coca leaf (Erythroxylum Coca) has been used as a medicinal plant for centuries, especially in Andean cultures.  

Miriam brings the coca by quintal (100 pounds) from the warm valleys two times a week.  She sells it in the coca market.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase coca wholesale from a person who has a license to sell coca.  Miriam is a hardworking person and she works very hard since the trip to the valley is long and the road is very dangerous and there have been many accidents on it, but she is always strong in order to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase coca at wholesale.

loans.name: Jeanette De Los Angeles

texts.es: Jeanette De los Ángeles es una emprendedora  que se le ha apoyado en brindarle financiamiento para la compra de producto para que le ofrezca a sus clientes variedad de productos. Ella ya ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, durante el financiamiento ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con buenos valores y ha mantenido su record crediticio intachable durante los ciclos que ha trabajado, ya tiene más clientes que la solicita para que les ofrezca sus producto. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de productos como lápiz labial, polvos, cremas, tratamientos entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Jeanette De Los Ángeles is an entrepreneur who is being helped with a loan so that she can purchase merchandise in order to offer her customers a variety of products. She has already worked with Fundación León 2000. In the previous times when she has received loans, Jeanette has demonstrated that she is a responsible person with good values who has kept her credit record intact during each of the loan cycles. She already has many customers who request the products that she offers.

Jeanette is currently requesting a loan to buy products such as lip pencils, powders, crèmes, treatments, and other products.

loans.use: to buy lip pencils, powders, crèmes, treatments, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La socia continua con su trabajo de nutricion, ella  desea en esta ocasion invertir el prestamo en la compra de productos naturales como batidos y en una capacitacion en relacion al tema que ha estudiado de nutircion; la socia desea a un futuro cercano poder poner un centro de nutricion integral. La socia invertira el prestamo en la compra de productos naturales y de su capacitacion.
texts.en:
This member continues with her work in the field of nutrition. On this occasion, she wants to invest her loan in the purchase of natural products, such as shakes, and in a training class related to the study of nutrition. In the near future, she would like to open a holistic nutrition center.

The member will invest this loan in the purchase of natural products and in her training.

loans.use: to purchase natural products and to pay for training in the field of nutrition.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old. She is married and blessed with two children, aged 8 and 6 years respectively. She sells clothes, a business she started three years ago, and earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

She has requested a loan worth 30,000 (KES) to purchase bales of skirts, trousers and t-shirts. The profit earned will help her acquire land.

Her dream is to provide a quality education, health and housing to her children. This is her second loan.

loans.use: To purchase bales of skirts, trousers and t-shirts for sale.

loans.name: Félix

texts.fr:
Félix est né au Rwanda. Il a 26 ans et il est célibataire. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans(technique) secondaire.

Félix est technicien. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin la réhabilitation de sa maison (acheter du ciment, sable, peinture.

Dans les prochaines années, Félix voudrait améliore la connaissance dans profession. Avec les profits, il prévoit  d’améliore le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Félix was born in Rwanda. He is 26 years old and unmarried. He completed six years of primary education and three years of technical secondary education.
Félix is a technician. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan in order to renovate his house (by buying cement, sand, and paint).
In the coming years, Félix would like to increase his professional knowledge. With his profits, he foresees improving his family's well-being.

loans.use: To renovate his house (by buying cement, sand, and paint).

loans.name: Alo-Aton Wanou Boygbo Group

texts.fr: ALO-ATON WANOU BOYGBO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres habitent dans le même quartier au Benin. La représentante du groupe du nom de Ajouavi Bernadette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgé de 44 ans.  Ajouavi Bernadette est mariée à un certain Isidore. le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés mais seulement trois sont à leur charge. Ajouavi Bernadette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure avec son mari les charges de la maison. Ajouavi Bernadette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges,  Ajouavi Bernadette mène comme activité la vente de produits divers (condiments, conserves) dans une ville du Benin. Ajouavi Bernadette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses, Ajouavi Bernadette sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALO-ATON WANOU BOYGBO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Alo-Aton Wanou Boygbo is a group comprising three people, all of whom live in the same area in Benin. The group representative, named Ajouavi Bernadette (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 44 years old. Ajouavi Bernadette is married to a man named Isidore. The couple have four children, all of whom are in school, but only three of whom are in their parents' care. Ajouavi Bernadette lives together with her children and husband, and supports the family with her husband. Ajouavi Bernadette did not attend school. To meet her various expenses, she runs a business selling various items (condiments, canned goods) in a city in Benin. Ajouavi Bernadette gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of better responding to the needs of her growing clientele, she is seeking a second loan with ALIDÉ, along with the other members of the Alo-Aton Wanou Boygbo group. The first loan was repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy condiments and canned goods.

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe/nyghnk Group

texts.fr:
Vedaste  fait partie du groupe Abishyizehamwe/Nyghnk. Il a 38 ans et il est marié, avec 1 enfant de 1 an, dont 7 scolarisés. Il a 3 enfants dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire et 3 ans d’artisanat.

Vedaste est commerçant. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d'œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de chercher le marché pour son agriculture des tomates. Dans les prochaines années, Vedaste voudrait améliore son agriculture. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Vedaste is a member of the Abishyizehamwe/Nyghnk group. He is 38 years old and married with one child, who is one year old. He has three additional children in his care. He completed six years of primary school and three years of craft training.

Vedaste is a merchant. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for manual labour.

His strategy to expand his business is to find a market for the tomatoes he grows. In the coming years, Vedaste would like to improve his farm. With the profits, he foresees educating his children and building a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizers and pay for manual labour.

loans.name: Jesukpego Group

texts.fr: JESUKPEGO est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Benin. La représentante du groupe du nom de Medessè Rosnelle (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgé de 37 ans. Medessè Rosnelle ne vit plus avec son mari, mais a un enfant qui est scolarisé et à sa charge. Medessè Rosnelle vit seule avec son enfant et assure seule les charges de la maison. Medessè Rosnelle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Medessè Rosnelle mène comme activité la vente de produits divers (des conserves et des savons) de façon ambulante depuis près de sept ans. Medessè Rosnelle s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et se faire plus de profit, Medessè Rosnelle sollicite, ensemble avec les autres  membres du groupe JESUKPEGO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Jesukpego is a group comprising three people who live in the same area in Benin. The group representative, named Medessè Rosnelle (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 37 years old. Medessè Rosnelle no longer lives with her husband, but has one child who attends school and is in her care. Medessè Rosnelle lives alone with her child and provides for the household by herself. She did not attend school. To meet her various expenses, she has run a business selling various items (canned goods and soap) door-to-door for close to seven years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of better responding to the needs of her growing clientele and earning higher profits, Medessè Rosnelle is seeking a second loan with ALIDÉ, together with the other members of the Jesukpego group. The first loan was repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy canned goods and soap.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente leader du groupe d’affaire «Zawadi », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 47  ans, mariée, mère de 9 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Son mari est un petit commerçant. Elle est  vendeuse des de denrées alimentaires (arachides, ndagara, etc.).  Il y a  12 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  18eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  2 sacs des arachides, 1 sac de ndagara, , etc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et accroitre son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que certains coéquipiers du marché  « nyabushongo » se sont joints sur la photo du groupe pour manifester leur solidarité et une des  clientes, porte son bébé en main.
texts.en: The leader of the "Zawadi" business group is an entrepreneur and 47-year-old married mother of nine young children, all of whom are in school. Her husband is a small merchant. She sells basic foodstuffs such as peanuts, ndagala (a type of fish), etc. For 12 years, she has run small income-generating activities like this one. However, she has just obtained her 18th loan from Hekima. This new loan is meant to allow her to supply herself with two bags of groundnuts, one bag of ndagala, etc. In addition, she hopes to see her children grow up comfortably and to enlarge her business. This client is grateful to Hekima for its actions in favour of poor women excluded from the mainstream banking system. It should be noted that certain compatriots of the "Nyabushongo" market are included in the group photo to show their solidarity, and that one of the clients is carrying her baby in her arms.

loans.use: to buy two bags of groundnuts, one bag of ndagala (a type of fish), etc.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has practiced dairy farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 17 years. He is 44 years old, married to Hannah and they have 4 school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He plans to use the loan amount to purchase a dairy cow to add to his milk production.

In the future, Daniel hopes to become one of the leading farmers in his area.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and only child who is still studying. He works nonstop in order to fulfill his family's needs. After 10 years of experience in barbering, he decided to open his own barber shop in 2006. Today, he wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added barbering tools for his salon in order to attract more clients and increase his revenues. In the future, he plans to open a small spa just next to his shop.

loans.use: to purchase added barbering tools for his salon

loans.name: Charen

texts.en: And now, Charen is applying for a loan of 20,000 PHP to fund her ready-to-wear clothing business. The sari-sari (variety) store business that she previously funded through NWTF and Kiva continues to provide Charen and her family to sustain her business operations and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, pants, polo-shirts and other clothing.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan, 60, is a widower and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He is a construction worker and earns approximately USD $3 per day. His two children are employed in the garment factory. Approximately, they earn USD $7 per day. 

Since he is a bit older, he wants to change his career. With this goal in mind, Chan is requesting a loan of $500 to run another business by purchasing a motorbike for carrying brooms to sell. The brooms are bought from the villagers. In the future, he would like to expand his business and build a new wooden house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for carrying brooms to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase livestock and prepare for crop planting.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam is a 46-year-old, married Lebanese woman living with her husband and two children. She’s responsible, with her husband, for covering the family expenses. Ibtisam had the ambition to have her own business; for this reason, she opened her own call center shop in 2011, where she also sells recharge cards. 

Today, she’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new phone for her shop and some recharge cards as well. This will develop her work and, thus, her profits. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans in order to renovate her shop.

loans.use: to purchase a new phone for her shop and some recharge cards as well.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Hiyam is a married 38-year-old Lebanese woman living with her husband and school-age child. She cooperates with her husband, who has been working in a local company since 1997, in order to fulfill her family's needs and offer them a respectable life. And since Hiyam wishes to help her husband with their expenses, she decided to start her own home business in 1997. She has been working in the clothing trade, responding to customers’ requests. Today, she’s asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new collection of clothes in order to develop her business and earn a better income. In the future, she plans to open her own clothing shop.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes in order to develop her business and earn a better income

loans.name: Kibet

texts.en:
Kibet is 34 years old. He is married and supports a family of four dependents. He has owned a chemist shop for the last four years, earning a monthly income of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He has applied for a second loan of KES. 40,000; he plans to purchase drugs for humans for his shop. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to restock, and his future dream is to improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: To purchase drugs for his chemist shop.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna, 39, is married. She resides with her mother, her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working in a garment factory for over 10 years, earning approximately $6 per day. 

Due to the difficulties of family transportation, Vanna is requesting a loan of $450 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to go to work on time and use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to build a new wooden house and help her children get bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Madame KADIATOU est âgée de 29 ans, célibataire et sans enfant. Elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle au quartier Darsalam de Ségou
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença tôt à faire les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa tante qui vendait des habits et chaussures. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à son côté, elle  évolua seule  pour mener la même activité. Elle  mène cette activité depuis 9 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle. Sa force de vente est due à la maîtrise du rouage de ce secteur d’activité mais également à son prix abordable.  
 Dans le souci d’augmenter son fonds de commerce et de faire plus de bénéfices, elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt. Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 48 mois, après 4 prêts individuels bien remboursés. Elle  est à son 5ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 5 cartons de chaussures et 15 pièces d’habits. Elle  s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso.
Madame KADIATOU vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle mixte. Avec ce prêt elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et de mener d’autres activités génératrices de revenus.
Son ambition est   d’ouvrir une boutique de prêt-à-porter à Ségou.
texts.en:
KADIATOU is 29 years old, single, and has no children.  She lives in a traditional family in the Darsalam neighborhood in Ségou.  For social reasons, she never attended school, but rapidly became involved in money-making activities with her aunt who was selling clothes and shoes.  After  several years of apprenticeship by her side, she started to work independently.  She has been working at her business for 9 years and enjoys a good experience and a large number of customers.  Her strength comes from the fact that she knows this field of activity very well, but also from the fact that she practices very affordable prices.

In order to increase her business and to generate more profits, she is requesting a new loan.  She has been working with Soro Yiriwaso for 48 months, and has already duly repaid 4 individual loans.  This is her fifth individual loan.  She plans to use it to buy 5 boxes of shoes and 15 sets of clothes.  She buys her merchandise in Burkina Faso.

KADIATOU sells for cash or on credit to customers of both genders.  With this loan, she is expecting monthly profits to reach 150,000 CFA francs.  This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to get involved in other money-making activities.  Her ambition is to open a clothing shop in Ségou.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Kadidiatou

texts.fr:
Madame Kadidiatou est âgée de 38 ans, mariée  et mère  de 3 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle au quartier Sécoura Bamanan è Ségou. Elle est déclarante en Douane transit de formation. Elle commença à faire les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa maman qui faisait le commerce d’articles divers. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissages auprès de cette dernière, elle opta pour évoluer seule depuis maintenant 10 ans, en menant également le commerce d’articles divers tels, les céréales les habits etc. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter son fonds de commerce et de réaliser plus de bénéfices, elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt. Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 48 mois, après 4 prêts  individuels bien remboursés. Elle est à son 5ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter une tonne d’arachide. Elle s’approvisionne sur place auprès des producteurs.
Madame Kadidiatou vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Avec ce prêt elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et de mener autres activités génératrices de revenus.
texts.en:
Kadidiatou is 38 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children.  She lives in a traditional family in the Sécoura Bamanan neighborhood in Ségou.  By training, she is a custom transit agent. She started to get involved in income-generating activities with her mother who used to sell various items.  After several years of apprenticeship by her side, she chose to work independently about 10 years ago, and now also sells various items such as grains, clothes etc.

She is requesting this new loan in order to increase her business and to make more profits.  She has been working with Soro Yiriwaso for 48 months and has already duly repaid 4 individual loans.  This is her fifth individual loan, which she will use to buy one ton of groundnuts.  She buys her merchandise from local producers and resells it for cash or on credit to a diverse group of customers.

With this loan, she is expecting monthly profits to reach 150,000 CFA francs.  This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to get involved in other income-generating activities.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts.

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es: La señorita Evelin  es  soltera actualmente se encuentra estudiando en la normal en la carrera de magisterio ella es la hija mayor se dedica al comercio de coca que trae desde el chapare hasta el acopio donde vende por paquetes, ella tiene un permiso especial para poder comercializar la hoja de coca ya que es una planta muy tradicional de Bolivia la utilizan para medicina mucha gente la consume para aliviar el cansancio, con el dinero del crédito comprara el cupo de coca que tiene para poder vender qa un precio mas alto,  ella es una joven muy  trabajadora con esta actividad paga sus estudios y mantiene a su familia ya que vive en la casa de sus papas y es el único ingreso que tiene, se siente muy feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Srta. Evelin is single and currently studying at a teaching college for her education degree. She is the eldest daughter of a coca merchant who brings in products from El Chapare to the collection center where they are sold in packets. Evelin has a special permit that enables her to sell coca leaf since it is a traditional plant of Bolivia that is used by many people as medicine to alleviate fatigue.

The money from this loan will be used to buy her quota of coca leaf so that she can sell it at a higher price. Evelin is a young woman who works hard in this activity in order to pay for her studies and support her family. She lives at her parents' house and this is her only source of income. Evelin is very pleased and appreciates the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to purchase coca leaf.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa tiene 68 años de edad es casada y sus hijos son mayores e independientes económicamente, vive en casa propia la cual esta ubicada en el  caserío rural de nombre CP – 15  que pertenece al Distrito de Tambogrande en la provincia de Piura. Es un caserío pequeño donde solo cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica Tomasa es a la venta de Fertilizantes y aves de corral, negocios para los cuales trabaja durante todos los días de la semana, su esposo ayuda al sustento familiar dedicando a la agricultura para lo que cuenta con una parcela en la que actualmente ha sembrado plantaciones de mango y arroz. Tomasa, esposo e hijos mantienen una buena relación familiar
y siempre se han preocupado por mejorar sus condiciones de vida en base a mucho trabajo

Tomasa sabe que en cada campaña de arroz hay bastante demanda de fertilizantes y no quiere perder la oportunidad de surtir mas su negocio para poner sus productos a la venta, por lo que solicita un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles los cuales servirán para la compra de variedades de fertilizantes y así poder obtener mayores utilidades para cumplir con sus responsabilidades.

Es un cliente recurrente y se le conoce por ser muy responsable en el cumplimiento no solo de su negocio si no que también con su responsabilidad en nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 68 years old and married. Her children are grown and financially independent. She lives in her own home in the rural village named "CP-15" that is in the District of Tambogrande in Piura Province. The only service that is provided in this small village is electricity.

Tomasa's business involves selling fertilizers and poultry. She works in these businesses every day of the week. Her husband helps support the family as a farmer and has a parcel of land on which he currently grow mangoes and rice. Tomasa, her husband, and her children maintain a good family relationship. They are always concerned about improving their living conditions, so they work very hard.

Tomasa knows that each rice growing season there is enough demand for fertilizers, so she does not want to lose this opportunity to restock her business with more inventory to sell. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN for purchasing a variety of fertilizers. This will enable her to generate more profits so that she can fulfill her responsibilities.

Tomasa is a returning client who is known for being very responsible, not only in her business, but also in her dealings with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to sell.

loans.name: Matar

texts.fr: Monsieur Matar  est un jeune homme de 34 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Il est marié et père d’un enfant de 2 ans. Il a aussi en charge deux autres personnes sous son toit.  C’est  un conducteur qui détient son permis de conduire mais le commerce étant beaucoup plus rentable  pour lui, il exerce  pratique la vente de parfums et d’autres produits divers depuis 2010.Il a choisi cette activité par le biais d’un de ses amis commerçants  qui au début l’approvisionnait en produits qu’il écoulait par placement.  Ce sont des produits qui marchent très fort surtout en période de chaleur. Il est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juillet 2004. Il a déjà remboursé 2 prêts  antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit de  300 000 frs  prévu pour l’achat de parfums, de gel de bain et d’autres articles destinés à renforcer son activité de commerce.  Ses bénéfices lui permettent d’assurer la dépense quotidienne  pour  sa famille et aussi d’épargner pour réaliser ses projets futurs.
texts.en: Monsieur Matar is a young man of 34 years who lives in Senegal. He is married and the father of a two year old. He also has two other people in his care and under his roof. He is a driver who holds a driver's license, but since 2010 he has sold perfumes and other various products, this business being much more profitable for him. He chose this business through one of his storekeeper friends, who at the beginning, stocked him up with products that he sold by investment. These are products that work very well especially in hot periods. He has been a member of an UIMCEC branch since July 2004. He has already repaid two past loans. He is asking for a loan of 300,000 francs, planned for the purchase of perfumes, bath gel, and other items intended to strengthen his business activities. His earnings will allow him to provide for the everyday spending for his family and also to save in order to realize his future plans.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and other products to resell.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr: Monsieur  Moussa  accompagnait depuis le bas âge son père, aux champs ce qui a réveillé en lui le métier d’agriculteur. Il a acquis maintenant une expérience de 20 ans. Moussa s’est surtout tourné dans le maraichage plus précisément la culture de pomme de terre. L e crédit va donc lui servir à acheter des semences de pomme de terre et des intrants agricoles. Moussa passe une longue journée de travail qui démarre à 6h du matin pour se  terminer à 20h du soir ; cela montre aussi tout l’amour qu’il voue à son activité. Marié, Moussa parvient à nourrir convenablement ses enfants et sa famille grâce aux revenus de son activité. Comme projet futur, il aimerait ouvrir un magasin ou il vendrait que des produits agricoles à grande échelle.
texts.en: Monsieur Moussa accompanied his father into the fields beginning at a young age, which whet his appetite for the agricultural profession. He has now acquired twenty years of experience. Moussa has especially turned toward truck farming, more precisely, potato farming. The loan will therefore be used to buy potato seeds and agricultural fertilizers. Moussa spends long days working, which begin at six o'clock in the morning and end at eight in the evening; this also shows all the love that he dedicates to his business. Married, Moussa succeeds in properly feeding his children and his family thanks to the profits from his business. As a future project, he would like to open a store where he would sell only agricultural products on a large scale.

loans.use: to buy 8 bags of potato seeds, 10 bags of fertilizer, 15 bags of manure, and 40 liters of diesel.

loans.name: Ave Maria 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AVE MARIA 1 est formé de trois personnes qui ont les mêmes considérations religieuses. La représentante du  groupe, nommée Victorine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Victorine est âgée de 41ans et est  mariée à un  certain Ferdinand. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. Victorine vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Victorine n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a deux ans que Victorine mène comme activité, la vente de fruits de saison dans son quartier au Benin. Victorine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin.
