Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire, Victorine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AVE MARIA 1 un deuxième  crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Ave Maria 1 group is made up of three people who have the same religious convictions. The representative of the group, whose name is Victorine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 41 years old and married to a man called Ferdinand. The couple has one child who is at school and in their care. Victorine lives with her husband and child, and she and her husband cover the various family expenses between them. Victorine did not attend school. For the past two years she has had an activity selling seasonal fruits in her neighborhood in Benin. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

With a view to satisfying customer demand and increasing her turnover, Victorine is requesting a second loan from Alidé with the other members of the Ave Maria 1 group. The first loan they received has been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits

loans.name: Amar

texts.fr: Monsieur Amar  est agriculteur de profession, mais fait de l’embouche en même temps.  Il loge dans un petit village ou ses deux activités génèrent  pas mal de profit. Il a une expérience de plus de 15 ans. Le prêt qu’il a demandé, va lui servir à acheter  des moutons pour revendre dans le marché local. Amar est père de famille et s’occupe des besoins de sa famille. Avec l’appui des préteurs, Amar  a comme souhait de développer, diversifier son embouche en y associant les bœufs, et cela  avec un bon fond de roulement qui pourra l’aider à ne pas être en rupture de bêtes.
texts.en:
Amar is a cultivator by trade, but also fattens livestock. He lives in a small village and these two activities generate a reasonable amount of profit. He has more than 15 years experience. His loan will be used to buy sheep, which will then be resold at the local market. 

Amar is a father and supports his family. With the support of lenders, Amar wishes to develop and diversify his business, and buy cattle to fatten as well. He hopes to build up a good working capital to ensure that he always has a good supply of animals.

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten and resell

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Monsieur Ousmane  est  un jeune agriculteur  qui  habite à environ 17 km de la ville principale. Il  possède un large champ ou il cultive des choux. IL est marié et père de famille. Ousmane a une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans ce domaine et il adore son métier (à le voir sur la photo il se confond à ses cultures.) Avec les bénéfices il  arrive à prendre en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de son foyer. Il a comme projet futur d’étendre son exploitation à d’autres terres voisines tout en comptant sur l’appui financier des préteurs.
texts.en: Monsieur Ousmane is a young farmer who lives about 17 km from the large city in his area. He has a large field where he cultivates cabbages. He is married and father of a family. Ousmane has more than 20 years of experience in this domain and loves his job (see the photo where he's mixed in with his crops). With the profits, he is able to take care of the everyday expenses of his household. His future project is to expand his farm to other neighboring land, counting on the financial support of lenders.

loans.use: to buy a machine for pumping well water.

loans.name: Egnonnoumi Group

texts.fr: EGNONNOUMI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Françoise (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 32 ans. Françoise est mariée  à un certain tailleur du nom de Djamiou. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et sont à leur charge. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Françoise vend la viande de lapin, de l’escargot et  la viande d’agouti dans une ville du Benin. Françoise s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité et  pour être plus compétitif sur le marché, Françoise désire augmenter le stock de ses produits ; ce qui lui permettra d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire. Pour cette raison, Françoise sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe EGNONNOUMI. Les premier  crédit  consenti  a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Egnonnoumi is a group of three people who live in the same district. The representative of the group, Françoise (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 32 years old. She is married to a tailor by the name of Djamiou. The couple has two children, both at school and in their care. In order to provide for her needs, Françoise sells rabbit meat, snails, and agouti meat in a town in Benin. She gets her supplies from a town in Benin. With a view to expanding her business and becoming more competitive on the market, Françoise would like to boost her stock; this will allow her to increase her turnover. For this reason, she is requesting a second loan from Alidé, together with the other members of the Egnonnoumi group. The first loan they were granted has been repaid.

loans.use: to buy rabbit meat, snails, agouti and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labourers

loans.name: Mahoutin Group

texts.fr: MAHOUTIN  est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier . La représentante du groupe, Laure (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37ans. Laure est mariée  à un certain Camille. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Laure,  Pour subvenir à ses besoins,  vend depuis près de sept ans des produits divers ( des fripperies,  des mèches et de maïs)dans une ville du Benin. Laure s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité et  pour être plus compétitif sur le marché, Laure désire augmenter le stock de ses produits ; ce qui lui permettra d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu. Pour cette raison,  Laure sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUTIN. Le premier crédit consenti a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Mahoutin is a group of three people who live in the same district. The representative of the group, Laure (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 37 years old. She is married to a man called Camille. The couple has two children, both at school and in their care. In order to provide for her needs, Laure has been selling a variety of products (second-hand clothing, hair extensions and corn) for almost seven years in a town in Benin. She gets her supplies from a Benin market. With a view to expanding her business and becoming more competitive on the market, Laure would like to boost her stock; this will allow her to increase her turnover and income. For this reason, she is requesting a second loan from Alidé, together with the other members of the Mahoutin group. The first loan they were granted has been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing, hair extensions and corn

loans.name: Madine

texts.fr:
Madame Madine est âgée de 45 ans, mariée  et mère  de 7 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille nucléaire au quartier Darsalam. 
Ayant abandonné l’école en classe de 7e année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien)  pour se marier par sa propre volonté, ainsi elle commence à faire les activités génératrices de revenus pour aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales. 
Elle s’approvisionne ici à Ségou et à Bamako. Ses bénéfices lui serviront à rembourser les échéances et de s’entretenir soit même et de participer aux évènements sociaux. 
Dans le souci de faire face à la demande clientèle et de faire plus de bénéfices, elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt.
Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 72 mois, après 4 prêts solidaires et 4 prêts individuels, tous bien remboursés. Elle est à son 5ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 4 balles de friperies. 
Madame Madine vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle mixte. 
Avec ce prêt elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000FCFA.
 Son ambition est de construire une maison.
texts.en:
Madame Madine is 45 years old, married, and mother of seven children. She lives in a nuclear family in the Darsalam area. 
Having abandoned school in the seventh fundamental year (Malian education system) to get married by her own will, she therefore started to engage in revenue generated activities to help her husband in the management of the family expenses.
She stocks up here in Segou and in Bamako. Her profits will be used to reimburse her financial commitments and to take care of herself and to participate in social events. 
In an effort to meet the demands of her customers and to make more profits, she is asking for this new loan.
She has had a relationship with Soro Yiriwaso for 72 months, and has has four group loans and four individual loans, all correctly repaid. She is on her fifth individual loan, which she counts on using to buy four bales of used clothes. 
Madame Madine sells for cash and credit to a mixed clientele.
With this loan she envisages making a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA.
Her ambition is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grains to resell.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Madame Aissatou  est une veuve de 41 ans qui habite au Sénégal. Elle est  mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 12 et 20 ans. Elle évolue depuis 8 ans dans le commerce  de tissus, parfums et autres articles divers. C’est  après le décès  de son mari qu’elle s’est lancée sur cette activité pour avoir l’opportunité de réaliser un chiffre d’affaire  et nouer  des relations  fidèles avec sa clientèle. Il est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEc C de sa zone d’habitation depuis 8 ans. Elle a déjà remboursé 2 crédits antérieurs et sollicite un prêt de 150 000 frs prévu pour  de tissus et de parfums  qui vont servir a renouveler son stock. Ses  bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de subvenir  à ses besoins personnels de meme que ceux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Aissatou is 41-year-old widow living in Senegal. She is the mother of three children aged between 12 and 20. 

For eight years she has been building a business selling cloth, perfumes and other products. She entered business after her husband died, and it allows her to earn money and develop good customer loyalty. Her business has been a member of the local branch of UIMCEC for eight years. She has already repaid two previous loans and is requesting a 150 000 F loan to purchase cloth and perfumes in order to replenish her stock. Her profits will help her meet her and her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy cloth and perfumes to resell

loans.name: Twisungane/ Nyghnk B Group

texts.fr:
Jean Marie Vianney  fait partie du groupe Twisungane/Nyghnk. Il a 27 ans et il est célibataire. Il a 2 personnes dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de secondaire.

Jean Marie Vianney  est agriculture. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir les champs en achetant d’autres champs. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Marie Vianney  voudrait moderniser son agriculture des tomates. Avec les profits, il prévoit de construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is a member of the Twisungane/Nyghnk B group. He is 27 years old and unmarried. He has two people to support in addition to his children. Jean Marie Vianney completed six years of secondary education and is a farmer.

This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and pay labourers. His business growth strategy is to expand his farmland by buying more fields. In the coming years, Jean Marie Vianney would like to modernize his tomato-growing business. With the profits, he is planning to build a house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay labourers

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, leader du groupe d’affaire «Zabayo », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 43  ans, mariée, mère de 10 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Son mari est un petit commissionnaire. Elle est  vendeuse de farines de manioc. Il y a  10 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  7eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  2 sacs de farine, etc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement, accroitre son entreprise, et construire un habitat pour son foyer.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The client is the group leader of Zabayo. She is a businesswoman aged 43 years old, and is married with 10 children, who all go to school. Her husband is a small-scale commission agent.

She sells manioc flour, and has been involved in similar small business activities for ten years. This is her seventh loan from Hekima, and will help her buy 2 sacks of flour, amongst other items. 

She wishes to see her children grown up in comfort, expand her business and build a house for her family. She would like to thank Hekima for its work helping poor women who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy two bags of flour and other supplies

loans.name: Yesica

texts.en:
Yesica belongs to a village bank called “Señor de Accha”. The bank is located in Pisac, a district of Urubamba province in the Cusco department. Yesica is 28 years old and lives with her partner and child. She supports her family by operating an internet and telephone shop, which is frequented by both local community members and tourists passing through the area. 

Yesica is requesting a loan in order to invest in equipment such as telephones and cables and to pay for maintenance of computer equipment. Yesica hopes the loan will allow her to improve her life and provide for her child’s future.

loans.use: to invest in telephone and computer equipment and maintenance.

loans.name: Sharon Andrea

texts.es: La señora Sharon es cliente antigua en la institución vive en la zona de bajo Seguencoma con su esposo y su hijo en la casa de sus suegros. Se dedica a la venta de chocolates y cereales por mayor y menor distribuye sus productos a distintos puestos de venta de los mercados de la ciudad y su depósito se encuentra en la zona del tejar. Anteriormente obtuvo el crédito para compra de mercadería, ahora el crédito será destinado a la compra de material de construcción para mejorar su vivienda ya que contaba solo con dos habitaciones y con la construcción dará mayor comodidad a su familia, se siente muy agradecida con  la institución por el apoyo brindado, ella es una persona muy  trabajadora se esfuerza día a día para dar un futuro mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Sharon is an existing client of the institution who lives in Bajo Seguencoma district together with her husband and child.  They live in her in-laws' home.  Sharon's business is selling chocolates and cereals wholesale and retail.  She distributes her products to different sales stalls in the markets in the city and her warehouse is located in El Tejar district.  Sharon used her previous loan to buy merchandise for her business.  This loan will be used to buy building supplies to improve her home as it only has two bedrooms.  This building work will provide her family with more comfort.  Sharon feels very grateful to the institution for the support they have given her.  She is a very hard-working person who works hard every day to provide her family with a better future.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in buying men's and women's clothing

loans.name: Phares

texts.en:
Phares is 29 years old and married to Esther, who contributes to the family income. They have one child. 

He has a milk supply shop which is attended by his wife, while he operates the motorcycle transport business. He gets a monthly income of about 18,000 kenya shillings.

This is his third loan in KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous ones. He wants to use the loan to add to his stock of milk in his business and to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. He hopes to expand his business and build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy a stock of milk and also motorbike spare parts.

loans.name: Gimena

texts.es: La señora Gimena es cliente nuevo de la institución, sin embargo la mama de la Sra. Gimena  es cliente antigua de emprender,  la Sra., Gimena es soltera y vive en  casa de su mama, queda ubicado en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, la cliente se dedica a la comercialización de carne de cerdo en uno de los mercados mas concurridos de la ciudad, ella es una persona muy joven y trabajadora reciente mente termino sus clases de peinados y peluquería, por este motivo solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos y materiales ya que desea abrir su salón de belleza y así tener un ingreso mas, y de esta manera poder mejorar sus calidad de vida, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que le brindan para seguir creciendo.
texts.en: Gimena is a new client of the institution, though her mom is an existing client of Emprender.  Gimena is single and lives in her mom's home which is located in Tembladerani district, in the city of La Paz.  Her business is selling pork in one of the busiest markets in the city.  She is a very young and hard-working person who recently finished her studies in hairdressing.  For this reason, she has requested a loan to buy the supplies and materials that she needs as she would like to open a beauty salon in order to make additional income.  This will enable her to improve her quality of life.  She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support that they are giving her which helps her to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to invest in equipment for her second business (a beauty salon)

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong was born in 1975 and has 3 children who are in high school and secondary school. She is running a small shop that sells ready to wear pants and shirts. Her business started many years ago and creates a stable income for her family. Joining in our credit program in 2003, she has invested loans in her shop. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh was born in 1982 and has 2 children who are in secondary school. She is a worker. After working hours, she raises pigs and chickens. Joining our credit program in 2003, she has used loans to expand her raising scale. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 VND to buy construction supplies to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Maria Celia

texts.es: La Sra. María es casada no tiene hijos por el momento pero desea pronto tener hijos,  vive en la casa de su suegra  en la zona de Oroncota, se dedica a la venta de artículos y repuestos para movilidades, su tienda se encuentra ubicado en un lugar estratégico de la ciudad de Cochabamba atiende de lunes a domingo,  su esposo realiza el servicio de transporte (taxi) y de esta manera colabora con los gastos de hogar. El préstamo lo invertirán en la compra de artículos por mayor para incrementar  su mercadería, y así de esta manera poder ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, y tener mas ingresos, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindada, es una persona joven con ganas de superación con el tiempo desea poder tener otra tienda en otra zona de la ciudad.
texts.en:
María is married.  She does not currently have children but she hopes to have them soon.  She lives in her mother-in-law's house in Oroncota district.  

María's business is selling vehicle spare parts and other items.  Her store is in a strategic location in the city of Cochabamba and she serves there from Monday to Sunday.  Her husband provides a transport service (taxi) and helps towards the household expenses.  María will invest this loan in buying items wholesale so that she can increase her stock and offer a variety of products to her customers.  This will make her more income.  María feels happy and grateful for the opportunity that she is being given.  She is a young person who has a desire to do well.  Over time, she would like to be able to set up another store in another area of the city.

loans.use: to buy items with which to stock her store

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Sitha, 39, is married and resides with her mother, her husband and two school-age children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling palm juice for over two years, earning approximately USD 7 per day. Her husband is a construction worker. He earns about USD 4 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Sitha is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase more palm juice to sell. By doing so, she will be able to generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to run a grocery store to generate extra income for the family and to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide better living conditions for her family. Moreover, she hopes to help her children get bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more palm juice to sell.

loans.name: Silveriana

texts.en: Silveriana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a native hat making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her hat making business. She has been in this business for 5 years. Silveriana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her native hat making business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: El  señora  María tiene como actividad  principal tejido de mantas de lana ardilla  a mano todo el trabajo lo realiza de forma manual, realiza trabajos de buena calidad ya que tiene pedidos que entregar, también realiza la venta semanal, viven con su esposo,  tiene un hijo de 4 años,  el momento de la visita se encontraba  tejiendo manta,  esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ellos,  en esta ocasión solicitan financiamiento para la compra de un lote de terreno en la zona de San Roque, hacer construir con el tiempo y para vivir bien en su casa propia. Ya que este es el deseo de la Sra. María, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
María's main business activity is hand knitting blankets from Ardilla yarn.  She does all her work by hand.  She does good-quality work as she has orders to fill.  She also sells weekly.  María lives with her husband and has a four-year-old son.  At the time of our visit, she was found knitting a blanket.  This activity is her main source of income. 

On this occasion, María is requesting a loan to buy a plot of land in San Roque district.  Over time, she would like to build on the plot so that she can live comfortably in her own home.  This is María's wish.  She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity that she is being given.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es: La señora  Fabiana tiene como actividad  principal el tejido de mantas de alpaca y su venta a pedido de sus clientes, vive con su esposo que es albañil, el momento de la visita se encontraba tejiendo manta en su domicilio,  esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ellos, en esta ocasión solicitan financiamiento para la compra de material de construcción para la construcción de un cuarto en su domicilio y así de esta manera  pode vivir un poco mas cómoda, la Sra. Fabiana realiza como una cinco mantas mensualmente por el buen trabajo le realizan pedido, con el tiempo desea poder tener su taller de tejido y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Fabiana's main business activity is knitting blankets from alpaca yarn.  She sells to order.  Fabiana lives with her husband who is a builder.  When we visited, we found her knitting a blanket in her home.  This activity is her main source of income.  

On this occasion, Fabiana is requesting a loan to buy building supplies with which to build a room in her home so that she can live a little more comfortably.  Fabiana knits around five blankets a month and, because of her good work, people make orders with her.  Over time, she would like to be able to have her own knitting workshop so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: La Sra. Luisa tiene 58 años  es soltera con 3 hijos que son 30, 27 y 25 años ya todos mayores de edad, la Sra. Luisa se dedica   comercio de ropa, su puesto de venta se encuentran en un acalle muy concurrida de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  Este préstamo es su quinta secuencia con la institución, La Sra. Luisa, va a usar este préstamo para compra de ropa  por docenas y así de esta manera incrementar su mercadería y por ende sus ingresos, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es para tener ropa variada . Luisa enfrenta retos en su negocio que son contar con ropa de acuerdo a la época del año,  va a utilizar los beneficios realizando promociones en su puesto de venta, sueña para su negocio es hacer crecer su tienda y ampliar mas su negocio, se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Luisa is 58 years old.  She is single and has three children who are 30, 27 and 25 years old.  They are all adults.  Luisa's business is selling clothing.  Her sales stall is located on a very business street in the city of Cochabamba.  This loan will be Luisa's fifth from the institution.

Luisa will use this loan to buy clothing in bulk so that she can increase her stock and thereby her income.  She is requesting this loan so that she can have a variety of clothing to sell.  The challenge that Luisa faces in her business is having available the right clothing for the right season.  She will use her profits to offer special promotions on her sales stall.  Luisa's dream is to grow and expand her business.  She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing wholesale

loans.name: Rouhiyeh

texts.en: Rouhiyeh is a 33-year-old Lebanese engaged woman. She lives with one parent and two siblings, one of whom is working. Her mother is their main source of income and Rouhiyeh is trying her best to be as helpful as she can. She started her own job at an earlier age. She opened a beauty salon in 2007. She has her loyal customers, and is glad with the results she has attained so far. Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a wax machine for her business. In that way, she will be able to serve her customers with good quality products. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty center.

loans.use: to purchase a wax machine for her business.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly, 61, is widowed and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. All of her children are employed in a garment factory where they earn approximately USD 12 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Ly is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her children to go to work on time and use the saved money on their transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a concrete house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 26 years old and married to Peter. They have two children who are in school. Lucy has operated her clothing business in Olkalou town for the last two years.  She was introduced to KADET  LTD by one of our existing clients, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more clothes to add to her business. She hopes to expand her business and open a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Maria  continua con su pulperia y venta de cosmeticos ayudandose economicamente, productos de la Avon, Zertmat, el cual vende al credito de quincena, vendiendose mucho por ser accesibles de precios.
Para ella, el crecimiento de su pequeño negocio, es de pioridad siendo el sustento de cada dia, quien vende junto a su esposo, logran pagar, agua, luz, y cubrir sus medicinas y gastos personales.
Hoy con este nuevo financiamiento invertira en compra de ropa escolar, cosmeticos, zapatos. Obteniendo mejores resultados en ventas.
texts.en:
Maria continues running her grocery store and selling cosmetics which helps her financially.  She sells Avon and Zertmat products on two weeks' credit.  She sells a lot because her prices are affordable.

The growth of her small business is a priority for Maria as it is how she supports herself every day.  Selling together with her husband, she manages to pay her water and electricity bills and cover the cost of their medicines and other personal expenses.

Maria will invest this new loan in buying school clothing, cosmetics and shoes.  This will give her better sales results.

loans.use: to buy school clothing, shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
This is Janet, 53, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a single parent and a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Janet operates a food stall. She sells snacks like halo-halo (mixed fruit with crushed ice), banana que (sugar coated bananas) and other street food staples, and also cooked viands that she sells in their community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw products and supplies she uses in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Janet dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: Henry, tiene la edad  de29 años, está casado,  vive con su  hijo y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad y su pequeño hijo. El con el crédito pretende comprar los alimentos para engordar los cerditos pequeños que comprara. El cuenta con los locales ya establecidos y con mucha experiencia en el conocimiento y manejo de cerdos. El tiene como meta tener los cerdos rápido para su venta y generar ganancias. El con las ganancias quiere mejorar su calidad de vida familiar y economía más estable. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Henry is 29 years old.  He is married and lives together with his son and his wife who are his main priority.  He plans to use his loan to buy feed with which to fatten the piglets that he will also buy.  He already has an established location for this and a lot of experience and knowledge in caring for pigs.  His goal is to quickly prepare the pigs for sale and make profits.  He would like to use his profits to improve his family's quality of life and enjoy more financial stability.

This is Henry's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received any previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have offered him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten and also pig feed

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es: Marianela, tiene la edad  de 24 años, está casado,  vive con sus  hijos y su esposo que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos como abono y plaguicidas para mejorar su cafetal. Ella cuenta con un terreno ya sembrado en producción y tras esta cosecha anterior su cafetal le quedo en condiciones regulares por lo cual decidió asistirlo. Ella quiere que su cafetal este próximo año le quede en buenas condiciones de cosecha para así generara mayores ingreso. Ella quiere que con la cosecha del próximo año mejorar la economía de la familia y tener cada día un futuro más estable. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marianela is 24 years old and married.  She lives together with her children and her husband who are her main priority.  She plans to use her loan to buy supplies such as fertilizer and pesticides with which to improve her coffee plantation.  She has a plot of land which is already sown and under production.  Following her previous harvest, her coffee plantation was left in a so-so condition so she decided to improve it.  She would like her land to be in good condition for her harvest this coming year so that she can make more income.  She would like her upcoming harvest to improve her family's finances and provide them with a more stable future. 

This is the first loan that Marianela has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not received previous loans from State banks but FUDECOSUR have offered her this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to care for her coffee plantation

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Mauricio, tiene la edad  de 23 años, está en unión libre,  vive con su  hijo y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los terneros pequeños para engordarlos para su venta. el cuenta con un terreno apto para la explotación en buenas condiciones de estos animales. El tiene como meta tener sus animales listos para la venta en un tiempo rápido y así generar el máximo de ganancias aprovechando sus potreros. El quiere generar a la hora de la venta el máximo de dinero para así salir adelante con el crédito y aumentar sus ganancias y tener  un bienestar familiar excelente con su familia en el futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 23 years old.  He lives with his son and his common-law wife who are his main priority.  He will use his loan to buy young calves to fatten and sell.  He has a suitable plot of land for raising these animals in good conditions.  His goal is to have his animals ready to sell in a short amount of time and thereby make a maximum of profits, making the most of his pasture.  When he comes to sell his animals, he would like to make as much money as he can so that he can make progress with his loan, increase his profits and enjoy an excellent quality of life together with his family in the future.

This is Mauricio's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received any previous loans from State banks but FUDECOSUR have offered him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy calves to fatten

loans.name: Olivier

texts.es: Olivier, tiene la edad  de 34 años, está casado,  vive con sus hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los terneros pequeños para engordarlos para su venta. El cuenta con un potrero apto para la explotación de estos animales. El quiere tener estos animales listos para la venta en un tiempo rápido y así generar el máximo de ganancias que puede generar. El tiene pensado generarles el máximo de dinero a estos animales a la hora de la venta para así tener una economía más estable para su familia en el futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Olivier is 34 years old.  He is married and lives together with his wife and children who are his main priority.  He will use this loan to buy young calves to fatten and then sell.  He has a suitable plot of pastureland on which to raise these animals.  Olivier would like to have his animals ready to sell quickly so that he can make as much profit as possible.  He plans to make the maximum amount of profit possible from these animals when he sells them so that his family can enjoy a more stable position in the future.

This is Olivier's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received any previous loans from State banks but FUDECOSUR have offered him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy calves to fatten

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es: Esmeralda,  tiene la edad  de 30 años, está casado,  vive con su hijo y su esposo que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito va comprar todos los insumos para asistir su cafetal. Como lo son los abonos, herbicidas, plaguicidas y otros más. Ella cuenta con el cultivo en condiciones regulares, por lo cual lo asistirá para así la próxima cosecha aumentar producción. Ella con esta mejora quiere generar con la cosecha el doble de las ganancias para así tener dinero para los tiempos duros y tener un bienestar familiar mejor cada día.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is 30 years old.  She is married and lives together with her husband and child who are her main priority.  She will use her loan to buy all the supplies she needs to care for her coffee plantation such as fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides, etc.  Her crops are in a so-so condition and she would like to care for them so that she can increase her production with her next harvest.  As a result of the improvement she makes, she would like to double her profits from her harvest so that she will have money available for hard times and enjoy better family well-being.

This is Esmeralda's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  She has not received any previous loans from State banks but FUDECOSUR have offered her this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to care for her coffee plantation

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene,  tiene la edad  de 47 años, está casado,  vive con su 3 hijos y su esposo que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito va comprar todos los insumos para asistir su cafetal como el abono y los químicos necesarios.  Ella cuenta con el cultivo en condiciones regulares y ya la cosecha está por terminar, por lo cual es que lo  asistirá para así la próxima cosecha aumentar producción que la de este año. Ella con esto quiere generar con la cosecha del próximo año el doble de las ganancias para así tener un bienestar familiar mejor cada día y un futuro económico más estable.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marlene is 47 years old, married, and lives with her husband and 3 children, who are her greatest priorities.  With her loan, she will buy supplies such as fertilizer and necessary chemicals to support her coffee plantation.  She counts on the farming under regular conditions and the harvest is about to finish, but she would like to help her following crop to have better yields than this year’s.  With this help, she would like to double her earnings from next year’s crop and, in this way, support her family more each day and have greater financial stability in the future. 

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not had any previous loans in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has been able to better facilitate a loan and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: support her coffee plantation to increase her crop yield.

loans.name: Santa Rosalia Group

texts.es:
Santa Rosalia es el grupo formado por 11 mujeres de la ciudad de caacupe, se formo gracias a una de las miembros, quien se informo e invitó a sus amigas y vecinas y decidieron formar el grupo, ya que ven una gran oportunidad de progreso en el programa de la fundación paraguaya.
La presidenta del comité es la señora Charlis, es casada, trabaja en la venta de comestibles, ella como también sus compañeras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo  de la fundación, pues es una gran ayuda la que reciben. Comenta que le va muy bien en la venta de sus alimentos, y que desea poder seguir con su trabajo, pues gracias a el ayuda a su marido con los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, condimentos, verduras, panificados y demás insumos para que pueda seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende. Están muy agradecidas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo por parte de kiva y fundación paraguaya
texts.en:
Santa Rosalia is a group of 11 women from the city of Caacupé.  The group was formed by one of the members who found out about the program and invited her friends and neighbors to create a group.  They see Fundación Paraguaya's program as a great opportunity to make progress.

The committee's president is Charlis who is married and whose business is selling food.  She and her fellow group members are very satisfied with the support that they receive from Fundación Paraguaya as it is a great help to them.  Charlis says that her food sales are doing very well and that she would like to be able to continue in her work.  Thanks to her business, she is able to help her husband with their household expenses.

Charlis is requesting a loan to buy meat, seasonings, vegetables, baked goods and other supplies so that she can continue making the food that she sells.  All of the group's members are grateful for the opportunity that they are receiving from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making food to sell

loans.name: Saoudatou

texts.fr: Madame Saoudatou  est une femme mariée  qui vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont  l’âge  varie entre 9 et 25 ans. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce et exerce la vente de tissus, parfums et autres produits divers. Elle a une expérience de 15 ans dans cette  activité qu’elle a choisie par passion et amour. Les deux éléments qui l’intéressent  le plus sont les chiffres d’affaires qu’elle réalise et aussi les relations qu’elle entretient avec la clientèle. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 6ans et 7 mois et a déjà remboursé  3 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de nouveaux tissus et autres articles divers destinés a la vente . Son souhait est de renforcer son activité de commerce et augmenter son chiffre d’affaires.
texts.en:
Ms. Saoudatou is a married woman who lives in Senegal. She is a married mother of four children whose ages range from 8 to 25. She works in the commercial sector and sells fabrics, perfumes, and a variety of other goods. She has 15 years of experience in this business, which she chose out of passion and love. The two aspects that interest her the most are the sales she makes and also the relationships she keeps up with her customers. 

Ms. Saoudatou has been a member of one of the U-IMCEC branch offices for six years and seven months, and she has already repaid three previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs for buying new fabrics and other diverse items for resale. Her wish is to bolster her commercial business and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy clothing, cosmetics and shoes in order to increase sales.

loans.name: Saraen

texts.en: Saraen, 36, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been producing baskets and flat baskets to sell for over 20 years, earning approximately 2 USD per day. Her husband runs the business of buying knives to resale for a profitable price. In order to improve her family’s economy, Saraen is requesting a loan of 500 USD to raise capital in her husband's business for purchasing more knives to resale in order to generate more income to support the family. In the future, if she has enough capital, Saraen would like to change her business by purchasing a car for her husband to run as a taxi and help her children get bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more knives to resale

loans.name: Adonay Group

texts.es:
Adonay es el grupo formado por 16 mujeres de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas oyeron hablar acerca del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya y deseosas de salir adelante se unieron a el, hoy en día se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto dentro del programa y desean seguir en el.
Sabina se dedica a la costura, y comenta que la mayoría de sus vecinos se acercan a su casa a traerles trabajo para que haga, es por ello que le va muy bien. En el barrio es muy conocida por la buena calidad de las prendas que confecciona, y así se fue haciendo de clientela, hoy en día ya es una microempresaria muy exitosa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos,botones, cierres y demás insumos necesarios para poder seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Adonay is a group of 16 women from the city of San Lorenzo.  They are all friends and neighbors from this city.  They heard about Fundación Paraguaya's 'Entrepreneurial Women Program' and joined it because they were keen to make progress.  They are now working very happily within the program and would like to continue.

Sabina's business is sewing.  She says that most of her neighbors come to her home to bring her work to do.  For this reason, her business does very well.  She is very well known for the good quality of the clothes that she makes and this is how she has gained customers.  She is now a very successful micro-businesswoman.

Sabina is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, fasteners and other supplies she needs to keep working and filling her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her sewing workshop

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been selling roasted pigs and roasted chicken for over 20 years, earning approximately 7 USD per day. For over 10 years, her husband has run the business of buying maize to resale for a profitable price, earning approximately 5 USD per day. In order to improve her husband's business, Srey is requesting a loan of 500 USD to raise capital in her husband’s business to purchase more maize to sell to gain more profit. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and bigger to provide a better living condition for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more maize to sell

loans.name: Mansour

texts.en:
Mansour is a 55-year-old married man and has five children. He lives in Taiz,Yemen. He has a grocery store where he sells various products. His objective is to improve his family’s standard of living in order to offer them better alternatives for progress. He has spent two years working in business.

Mansour was an officer in several banks and then retired and opened a grocery. He has always liked having his business; he saw the necessity of opening a store to obtain a stream of income for his family and it has been profitable. Every four days he has to travel to buy the products for his store. The trip is 40 minutes by bus to the city where he is able to make his purchases. As of recently, he describes his biggest business challenge as the delay of payment from his customers.

So, Mansour is asking for a loan of 400,000 YER from AMB to buy more merchandise for his store like soft drinks, mineral water, beans, biscuits, shampoo, etc. so as to offer more products to his clients in order to always cover the delay of payment from his customers and thereby generate more income for his family.

Mansour is hoping that he can provide his children with opportunities to study in universities so they can be prepared academically and so that his business will continue to grow even more.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for his store like soft drinks, mineral water, beans, biscuits, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la ciudad de Caacupé. Son 14 mujeres que se unieron con ganas de trabajar juntas y ayudarse las unas a las otras para poder progresar. Tienen un gran espíritu emprendedor y quieren poder seguir ayudando a sus familias por medio de su trabajo. Actualmente se encuentran en el 5to. Ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras y desean poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
Maria, es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la peluquería, cuenta que tiene un negocio con todo lo que necesita para poder trabajar cómodamente. Gracias al buen servicio que brinda a sus clientes, ha podido formarse ya una clientela fiel que siempre acude hasta su negocio. Su sueño es poder seguir creciendo y poder dar puestos de trabajo a otras personas.
Ella solicita la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y de kiva para poder abastecer su peluquería con shampoo, enjuagues, cremas, esmaltes y demás insumos necesarios para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The women of the present committee are from the city of Caacupé.  They are 14 women who organized as a group with a desire to work together and help each other to progress.  They have a great entrepreneurial spirit, and want to keep helping their families by means of their work.  Currently, they are in the 5th cycle of the program for entrepreneurial women, and they want to reach the highest level of the program.

Maria is one of the members, and she dedicates herself to hairdressing.  She states that she has a business with all the necessary amenities to carry out her work comfortably.  Thanks to the excellent service she provides to her customers, she has established a loyal client base that frequents her business often.

Her dream is to continue growing her enterprise, and to provide job opportunities for other people.  She requests help from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva to supply her beauty salon with shampoos, conditioners, creams, nail polishes and other necessary products to be able to keep working.

loans.use: buy supplies to equip her beauty salon.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 26 years old, a married man who  lives in Sana`a with their two children of 2 and 1 years of age. He has been operating a grocery store that sells basic products for 3 years. He started his business with supporting capital from his mother in order to open this grocery that would be able to support his young family. Because of his dedication to his work, he has been able to attract customers to his business.

Mohammed said he needs to fill his store with more food products in order to serve his customers. So he applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy more merchandise for his store like soft drinks, mineral water, beans, biscuits, eggs, oil, etc. that bring in more profit.

In the future, Mohammed would like to expand his business to open a wholesale store instead of his grocery.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for his business like soft drinks, mineral water, beans, biscuits, eggs, oil, etc.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 55 years old and lives in Baybay, Liloy, Zambonaga del Norte. She is married with 4 children.

Elsa has a boarding house business, eatery and lodging house business and earns approximately 40,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase construction materials for expansion of her lodging house. Elsa has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. 

In the future, Elsa hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for expansion of her lodging house

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, 49, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ronelio, a carpenter, and she is a mother of two children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilyn operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 11, 000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marilyn dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
This is Estelita, 50, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jerson, a laborer, and she is a mother of three children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Estelita operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. She also sells basic ingredients in her stall for additional income.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Estelita dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a 25-year-old women committed to succeeding and helping her family. Growing up she witnessed the potential of developing a business through her family’s flower shop. Unfortunately, before she was old enough to step in and manage the family business, her father passed away and the business ran into challenges, mainly from increased competition. After gaining an education, Noor began volunteering and working in several positions to gain experience. She now is opening her own mini-market and is investing in her future as a business owner. Her mini-market is centrally located. It borders a large neighborhood that sorely needs a convenience store and is also right near an elementary school. Her customer potential is significant.

Noor needed this loan to pay for renovations, including painting and remodeling, and to purchase stock for her store.

Noor has significant support from her family and friends, who have even helped her with renovations. In the future she wants to expand the mini-market, hire additional staff and manage the business full-time, giving up her part-time work after she is secure with the profit made from her business.

loans.use: To pay for renovations, including painting and remodeling, and to purchase stock for her store.

loans.name: Tavai Group

texts.es:
Tavai es el grupo formado por 11 mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé, son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que trabajan todos los días, para que de esa forma puedan sacar adelante a sus familias. Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación.
Francisca, es una mujer que tiene muy buenas habilidades para la cocina, ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de variados comestibles y en lo que le va muy bien, pues ya tiene una clientela fiel que siempre compran de ella los alimentos que prepara. Su meta es poder tener un local donde poder ofrecer mayor comodidad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, pollo, condimentos, verduras y demás insumos para poder seguir con su trabajo.  Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que están recibiendo ella y su grupo.
texts.en:
Tavai is the group formed by 11 women from the city of Caacupé.  They are very hard working and entrepreneurial women who work every day in order to help their families get ahead.  Currently, this group finds itself in its second cycle of the Fundación's program for entrepreneurial women.

Francisca is a woman who has a great facility in the kitchen.  She comments that she dedicates herself to selling a variety of food items, and that this is going very well given that she has a loyal customer base that always buys the food she prepares.  Her goal is to have a locale where she can offer a greater level of comfort to her customers.

She requests this loan to buy meats, chicken, condiments, vegetables, and other supplies to be able to continue her work.  She is grateful to the Fundación and to Kiva for the opportunity she and her group are receiving.

loans.use: buy supplies for preparing food.

loans.name: Tanjung Sanyang 5 Group

texts.en:
Hitayati is married with two children. She is pictured with one of her children. She has been selling fried snacks and "lontong" ( Indonesian food: rice cake made from steamed rice wrapped in banana leaf) since 2010. She sells fried snacks by distributing them to a store near to her house. Her business is running smoothly; now she can buy clothes for her children. 

Hitayati's husband is a security guard. She can contribute to her family by having this business. Even though sometimes it is hard to find banana leaf, she likes to run her business; she enjoys it. In the future she wants to have her own kiosk to sell her fried snacks. 

Other group members will be using their part of the loan to sell clothes on credit and to sell snacks.

loans.use: to pay for more ingredients such as flour, eggs, and sugar to make fried snacks to sell

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina, 18, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working in a garment factory for over two years, earning approximately USD 10 per day. Additionally, she is involved in growing vegetables and fruit to sell to generate extra income of about USD 2 per day. 

Lina is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase the dirt to fill up her vegetable and fruit plantation. In the future, she would like to purchase more farmland for growing more vegetables to gain more income for the family. Moreover, she plans to build a concrete house and help her children to get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase dirt to fill up her vegetable and fruit plantation

loans.name: Majd

texts.en:
Majd is 32 years old, a married man and the father of two children who are 3 and 1 years old. He lives in Taiz,Yemen. He has been a person who has gone through many adversities in his life. Some time ago he had a great difficulty in that he was unable to find employment so was unable to generate sufficient income to cover his household expenses. He decided to open his own grocery store where he sells basic staple items. Thanks to the store, he generates enough income to help his family cover household expenses.

Majd`s sales are currently very good and his customers know him in the neighborhood because of his good service. He’s not been able to meet all his customers’ needs, however, because he has little merchandise and not much variety. Because of this, he wants to stock the store by buying basic staple items but he does not have enough capital to make these purchases and this is why he took a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB that will allow him to buy  items such as rice, beans, soft drinks, and cheese to increase the variety of items he stocks for his customers.

In the future, he is hoping that he can provide his children with opportunities to study in school.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items such as rice, beans, soft drinks, and cheese.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, 47, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Cesar, a taxi driver, and mother of three children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  
        
Marilyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also operates a small barber shop for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marilyn hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sok Ngan

texts.en:
Sok Ngan, 52, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been growing vegetables to sell for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 4 per day. All of her children are employed; two are garment workers and another one is a motor mechanic. Approximately, they earn USD 12 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s economy, Sok Ngan is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase fertilizer and vegetable supplements for growing vegetables. In the future, she would like to build a wooden house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and vegetables supplements for growing vegetables

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
This is Jean, 36, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Alfredo, a driver, and mother of two children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  
        
Jean operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also operates a small barber shop for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jean hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 53 years old and lives in Ndunyu Njeru. He is married to Alice, and they have four children, all of whom are in school.

For the past 20 years, David has been a farmer. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy farm inputs, spraying chemicals, and fertilizers, and to pay for labor. He hopes to boost his business and get a good harvest in the future.

loans.use: To buy spraying chemicals and other farm inputs, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
El comite lleva por nombre Santa Catalina, debido a que hay una capilla cerca de sus casas, han asumido el compromiso de  mantener reunido el grupo y trabajar bajo un marco de responsabilidad mutua. Actualmente se encuentran en el  noveno ciclo con calificación regular, integrada por  10 mujeres quienes invierten sus prestamos en sus respectivas actividades.
Manuela es una de las miembros del grupo, ella tiene una despensa bien abastecida con la cual provee a la mayoría de sus vecinos y los demás de las zonas aledañas. Comenta que le va muy bien debido a que siempre está muy bien abastecida y es por ello que ya tiene una muy buena clientela, lo que la ayuda a mantener su negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de lácteos, bebidas, panificados, azúcar, fideos y demás insumos necesarios para seguir abasteciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
This committee is called 'Santa Catalina' owing to the fact that there is a chapel nearby.  The group's members have pledged to keep their group united and work together within a framework of mutual responsibility.  They are currently in their ninth loan cycle with an average rating.  The group is made up of ten women who invest their loans in their respective business activities.

Manuela is one of the members of this group.  She has a well-stocked grocery store where she provides goods to most of her neighbors and people in neighboring areas.  She says that her business is doing very well because it is always very well stocked.  For this reason, she has a very good customer base which helps her to keep her business running.

Manuela is requesting this loan to buy dairy products, drinks, baked goods, sugar, noodles and other supplies she needs to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Mujeres Guapisimas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres guapisimas es e la ciudad de Villa Elisa, son 15 mujeres que se unieron con la esperanza de poder ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio el trabajo en conjunto. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras que siempre se esfuerzan al maximo para poder dar a sus familias el pan de cada dia.
Alexandra es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de variadas joyas, con lo cual ha podido ayudar a su familia a seguir creciendo. Ella comenta que muchos de sus vecinos son clientes suyos que compran de ella, y que estos la ayudan a poder seguir extendiendo su clientela. Su meta es poder tener algún día una joyería donde vender sus productos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de joyas en plata, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y de esa forma cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación ya kiva por la oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
'Mujeres Guapisimas' (Pretty Women) are from the city of Vila Elisa.  This group is made up of 15 women who came together in the hope of helping each other through their joint work.  They are hard-working and entrepreneurial women who always work as hard as to they can to provide their families with their daily bread.

Alexandra is one of the members of this group.  She says that her business is selling a variety of jewelry.  This business has enabled her to help her family to continue growing.  She says that many of her neighbors are customers who buy from her and they help her to continue expanding her customer base.  Her goal is to some day own a jewelry store where she can sell her products.

Alexandra is requesting this loan to buy silver jewelry to stock her business.  This will enable her to meet her customer demand.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 33 years old, married to Monicah, and blessed with two children, ages six and three. He sells different types of products like basins, jugs, buckets, cups and plates - a business he started six years ago. He earns a monthly income of about KES 15,000.

He has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase bags, basins, cups and plates. This is his third loan. The profit earned will help him repay his loan and pay school fees. His dream is to see himself prosper in his business as well as to improve his living standards.

loans.use: To purchase bags, basins, cups and plates.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 22 years old and a single mother of one. She operates a carrot selling business and has been in the business for the past two years. She gets an income of about KES 15,000 a month from the business.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a field officer and this is her first loan. She will use the loan amount to purchase carrots for resale. Her hope is to have a well established wholesale carrot business.

loans.use: to purchase more carrots for resale.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
This is Cesar, 33, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Winnie, a teacher. Cesar, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Cesar operates a buy and sell business. What he basically does is buy general herbal/organic products from wholesalers and then sell them with a little profit. His products are herbal coffee, supplements and other products of the kind. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options he offers. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 24,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Cesar hopes that his business will continue to be successful. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for herbal supplies and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
This is Pinky, 35, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Edy, her business partner, and is a mother to her child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
                            
Pinky operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Pinky hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
La Sra. Mirna tiene 33 años de edad,  está casada con el Sr. Lorenzo de 42 años, tienen  2 hijos, quienes son el motivo de trabajo de la pareja.
La Sra. Mirna tiene una peluquería y su marido cuenta con una carpintería en su domicilio, se dedican a ambos rubros hace mas de 10 años por lo que actualmente están contando con una clientela totalmente formada.
Ella desea ir ampliando su peluquería y enseñarle esa profesión a su hija de tal manera que pueda emprender dicha actividad a lo largo del tiempo y anhela verles a sus hijos convertirse en profesionales y que sean personas de bien.
Ella solicita el crédito para realizar mejoras  en su peluquería ya que cuenta con muy buena demanda con sus servicios y desea brindarle todas las comodidades a su clientela.
texts.en:
Mirna is 33 years old.  She is married to Lorenzo, who is 42, and the couple have two children who are the motivation behind their work.

Mirna has a hairdressing salon and her husband has a carpentry workshop in their home.  They have been working in these trades for more than ten years and have an existing customer base.

Mirna would like to expand her hairdressing salon and teach this profession to her daughter so that she can start working in the business.  Over time, Mirna would like to see her children become professionals and upstanding citizens.

Mirna is requesting this loan to carry out some improvements in her salon as she has very good demand for her services and she would like to make her customers as comfortable as possible.

loans.use: to refurbish her beauty salon

loans.name: Experiance 1 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Marierose est la coordonnatrice de son groupe Expérience. Elle habite dans la région de BRAS-de-Lance d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Marierose a dirigée sa commerce de divers Produits pendant les 5 dernières années. Marierose voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir à plus que des vêtements, chaussures, accessoires, etc.

Marierose espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à ouvrir une grande Boutique parce que maintenant elle vende ses Produits dans la marche.

Des autres membres Expérience ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces vendre des produits Alimentaires et des autres commerces comme charbon.

Marierose dit que sa rêve est de gagner plus argents pour qu’elle achète plus des produits moins chers et d’une meilleure qualité.
texts.en:
Marierose is the coordinator of the Experience group. She lives in the BRAS-de-Lance region of Haiti where the electricity is rare and water very restricted.

Marierose has managed her commerce of various products for the last five years. She would like to use this loan to invest in more clothes, shoes, accessories etc.

Marierose hopes that this loan will help her to open a bigger shop because now she sells her wares at the market.

Other members of Experience also need a loan for businesses in foodstuffs and coal.

Marierose says that her dream is to earn more money so that she can buy more products at a time and of better quality.

loans.use: to purchase clothing,shoes,accessories,etc.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
