In future, Stephen hopes to grow his business and make a lot of profit.

loans.use: To buy a bull

loans.name: Sylvia's Group

texts.en:
Sylvia's group is comprised of 3 hard working women. Sylvia is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells snacks. 

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy cooking oil and flour, and will help Sylvia to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Sylvia hopes that in the future she will be able to start selling clothes. 

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Sylvia's future prospects by helping her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and flour,

loans.name: Ronah

texts.en:
Ronah, age 21, is a member of a group of hard-working women. Ronah earns an income by making and selling bread. She lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past four years, Ronah has been working hard to manage her small business.

To help expand her business, Ronah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more flour for making bread, and will help Ronah to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Ronah hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Ronah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Ronah's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more flour for making and selling bread

loans.name: Felecial

texts.en: Felecial is 34 years old and lives in Gardnersville.  She is married.  She had to stop her education in 12th grade. For the past seven years Felecial has been selling  charcoal the market to sustain herself. She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal to expand her business. Felecial's dream is to become a international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to  expand her business

loans.name: El Sol (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Sol está formado por 4 socias y 2 socios, quienes se caracterizan por el carisma y la cordialidad, laboran diariamente en diferentes actividades  las mismas que les permiten aportar la economía de sus hogares. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por ser desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, la variedad de su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa, tiene 65 años de edad, es viuda y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 10 hijos de los cuales 8 son casados y viven independientes y sus dos hijos solteros trabajan y estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Rosa es comerciante de carnes y también tiene una picantería (restaurante) donde prepara platos de comida típica, labora en esta actividad hace 20 años.

Se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para prepara la comida y carne para la venta.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The El Sol communal bank is made up of 4 female and 2 male members, who are noted for their warmth and charisma.  They are involved in different economic activities that allow them to support their households.  The members live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  The city was recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in December 1999.  Its residents maintain their culture and traditions, and the variety of its cuisine captivates the palates of locals and foreigners alike.

One of the members of the group is Rosa.  She is 65 years old, widowed, and has 10 children from that relationship.  8 of her children are married and live independently, while 2 of her children are single and study at a school in the city.  Rosa does not have her own house, but lives in a rented residence.

Rosa sells meat, and also has a ‘picantería’ (restaurant) where she prepares traditional dishes.  She has worked in this business for 20 years.

This is Rosa’s second loan with her communal bank, and she will use it to purchase supplies for preparing meals at her restaurant along with meat to sell.

Rosa’s dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for preparing meals and meat to sell.

loans.name: Faiza

texts.en:
Faiza, age 24, operates a bicycle spare parts business. She sells her goods at the market and has worked in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. 

She joined Yehu to access capital in order to benefit her business, and she will use the Kes 50,000 loan to purchase rims, spokes, and tires. 

She and her husband Selim, who is employed as a public servant, own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. They have two children: one is an eight-month-old baby and one is three years old. The eldest is enrolled in school.

Faiza aspires toward expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rims, spokes, and tires

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher has operated his retail shop in Nakuru town for the last two years.  He is 36 years old, separated, and has one child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of soaps, wheat flour and washing detergent for sale in his retail shop.

In the future, Christopher hopes to grow his retail shop to a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soaps, wheat flour and washing detergent for sale.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a tailor who lives and works in Malindi, Kenya. She owns a tailoring shop that has been in operation for three years. She started up the business with the help of her parents’ savings. She is single and has no children.

Prisca became a member of Milango after hearing about it from friends. Her main challenges are price fluctuations, inflation, and tax, as well as the lack of capital to purchase stock. She is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy additional sewing machines.

The extra income expected to result from this loan will be saved to be used in case of emergency in the business and will assist her in her loan repayment. She aspires toward opening a boutique in future.

loans.use: to buy additional sewing machines for her tailoring business

loans.name: Sahr E.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleases to present to you this group of primary school teachers from Koidu city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan. SMT/Kiva loans designed for teachers have proven to be very helpful to teachers. Usually, teachers’ salaries are small, making it impossible to invest in anything great. But with the help of these loans, they are now in positions to buy or invest in bigger things, and at the end of each month they repay the loan using their salaries. 

Sahr is the leader of this group of borrowers. The 45 year old is a native of Ngandorhun village in Eastern Sierra Leone. A husband and a father of 2 children who are attending primary and secondary school, Sahr has been a teacher for 14 years now. With the help of this loan, he is going to buy house building materials – iron corrugated zinc sheets, sand, nails, cement, etc. - for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials - iron corrugated zinc sheets, sand, nails, cement, etc. - for the construction of a dwelling house

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman. She has 5 children. Her husband's name is Tsuma and he works as a farmer. Chizi operates a cereals-selling business and sells her goods in a shop. Her primary customers are passersby and neighbours. Chizi's other source of income includes her husband's income.  Her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Chizi will use the 50,000 KES loan to purchase sacks of rice and wheat flour. Chizi aspires to establish a wholesale shop in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice and wheat flour

loans.name: Chau

texts.en:
This is Chau, 51, a resident of Ho Chi Minh City. She is married with two children. 

Chau and her husband have operated a shop which sells many kind of soft drinks to the people in her community for over three years. To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a loan that she will use to buy more beverages to expand her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business and she hopes that this will enable her to better provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy more beverages to expand her business

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, age 50, owns and operates a general store which is located in front of her house. She started this business 18 years ago. She intends to use her loan to buy a variety of products to offer for sale, such as soft drinks, milk, tanks of drinking water, and confectionery. She and her husband have two children. The family lives in Ho Chi Minh City.

She is confident that her business will continue to run smoothly, allowing her to improve her family's living conditions and to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to offer for sale, such as soft drinks, milk, tanks of drinking water, and confectionery

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
13 mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé se enteraron acerca del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya y con mucho deseo de progresar decidieron unirse. Ellas son jefas de familias que se encargan de llevar el pan de cada día a sus casas. Actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del programa y desean poder llegar al máximo nivel, siempre trabajando dentro de un marco de respeto y ayuda mutua.
Cecilia vende lencerías, tanto para hombres como para mujeres, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y comenta que gracias a la buena calidad de prendas que tiene ha podido formarse una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella las prendas que vende. Este trabajo la ayuda en el día a día de los gastos que surgen.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de lencería, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con pedidos de sus clientes y a la vez darles un poco más de variedad.
texts.en: 13 women from the city of Caacupé learned about a program for motivated women from the Fundación Paraguaya (the Paraguayan Foundation) and with great desire to get ahead they decided to join the group.  They are heads of families who take on the task of bringing daily income to their homes.  Currently they are in their second cycle of loans and they hope to reach the highest level, always working within a framework of respect and mutual assistance.  Cecilia sells intimate apparel or lingerie, both for men as well as women.  She is a very hard working woman and comments that thanks to the high quality of her garments she has been able to build a good client base that always buys clothing from her.  This work helps her to take care of the daily expenses that come up.  She is requesting a loan in order to purchase lingerie.  With those purchases she will be able to stock her store and meet requests from clients as well as give her clients a bit more variety.

loans.use: To purchase lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Lugwe

texts.en:
Lugwe is a 30-year-old married man. He has 3 children between the ages of 2 and 6, and 2 of them are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Umazi and she works as a farmer.

Lugwe operates a retail shop business and sells his goods in a shop. He's worked in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are neighbours and passersby. Lugwe's other source of income includes livestock keeping for the sale of milk, and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Lugwe will use the 120,000 KES loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice.  Lugwe aspires to expand to a wholesale shop and establish real estate houses in the future. He joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward, age 32, works for a motorcycle transportation business. His wife Millicent runs a grocery business. Between their two incomes, they are able to provide for themselves and their three children. The family lives in the town of Nakuru.

Edward was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of its existing clients, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to support his wife's grocery by adding more stock of fruits and vegetables, allowing her to better sustain her business.

In the future, Edward hopes to own his own vehicle and transportation business. This would allow him to earn more income, allowing him to provide better living standards for his family.

loans.use: to boost his wife's grocery business by adding more fruits and vegetables for her to offer for sale

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maricela; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de carne de res, ella lleva a diferentes en las disdintas ferias que hay en la provincia de Anta a la vez ella cuenta con un puesto en el mercado de Anta, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual mediante este ella saca asu familia adelntae ,la socia esa un persona responsable ,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de carne.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar carne al por mayor.
                                                     
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maricela is a member of the “RICHARY ANTEÑA” Communal Bank, which is located in Anta, a district in the Anta province in the department of Cusco.

Maricela mixes her daily chores with her business buying and selling beef. She attends the various fairs in the Anta province, while she also has a stand in the Anta market. She has been working this way for years, which has helped her to provide for her family. Maricela is a responsible person. She would like to increase her meat-selling business.

Maricela requests the loan to purchase meat at wholesale prices.

Maricela is happy to receive the loan, and is committed to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase meat at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura tiene 62 años de edad y tiene una relación libre  de la cual tiene tres hijos. Maura vive en la ciudad de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo y donde realiza todo tipo de actividad, ella se dedica a la venta y crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Maura requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. Maura pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maura is 62 years old and has an open relationship from which she has three children.  Maura lives in the city of Huancarani in the province of Paucartambo where she does all kinds of activities.  She works selling and raising small animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  She has been working in this field for several years and it is going very well thanks to the hard work that she puts into her job.

At this time Maura needs a loan in order to purchase more small animals like for example guinea pigs and chickens.  Maura belongs to the communal bank "Mamacha Rosario" from the Arariwa Association and she is very grateful for the opportunity brought through this organization and she also promises to comply with the loan repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to purchase more small animals like for example guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga, 57, is married and earns a living to support her family by planting and selling orchids. Her husband is a teacher. She lives with two children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Nga started her business two years ago. She would like to take a loan to expand the business. With the loan, she intends to buy a greater quantity of different orchids that will enable her to attract more customers and increase her sales. She hopes that this will generate more income and that she can save money for her family.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of orchids.

loans.name: Kuña Renda 1 Group

texts.es:
Kuña Renda 1 es el grupo formado por 22 mujeres de la ciudad de Caaguazú, que trabajan juntas para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio de ese trabajo. Son mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy emprendedoras, que luchan día a día para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Actualmente estan en el 5to. Ciclo y desean poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
Ilda es vendedora de ropas desde hace un buen tiempo, con lo que ha logrado formarse una buena clientela. Ella comenta que siempre tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes, pues tiene prendas de buena calidad, y no muy caras. Este trabajo la ha ayudado a poder realizarse como comerciante y también ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.
Ella acude a la fundación y a kiva para solicitar un crédito, ya que tiene pedidos y quiere poder cumplir cumplir con sus clientes. Quiere comprar remeras, pantalones, camisas y demás.
texts.en:
Kuña Renda 1 Group is comprised of twenty-two women from the city of Caaguazú who work together to be able to help one another. They are hard-working, enterprising women who do not give up easily. They work hard every day to improve their families’ quality of lives. Currently they are in their fifth loan cycle, and would like to be able to reach the program’s highest level. Ilda has been selling clothes for quite a while, which has enabled her to develop a significant customer base. She says that she always has many orders from her customers, especially since she has good quality garments that are not very expensive. This work has helped her to be able to achieve her potential as a merchant, and it has also helped her to provide for her family.
She is turning to the Foundation and to Kiva to request this loan since she has orders and would like to be able to fill them for her customers. She would like to purchase T-shirts, pants, dress shirts, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a 40-year-old married woman. She has 5 children who are all enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Mnachai. Mwanaidi operates a retail shop business and sells her goods at retail. She has worked in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are passersby and neighbors. Mwanaidi's other source of income includes a side job as a tailor. She describes her greatest business challenge to be the high cost of goods. Her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Mwanaidi owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mwanaidi will use the KES 50,000 loan to repair her business premise and add stocks of wheat flour and maize flour. Mwanaidi aspires to expand to a wholesale shop in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to repair her business premise and add stocks of wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An is a 60-year-old married man with four children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. For the past ten years, he and his wife have run a food stall to cover all family living expenses and their children's education fees. They sell meals for breakfast and lunch for the local people. The business is going smoothly and he would like a loan to buy new furniture, bowls, chopticks and better quality food and beverages to provide to his customers.

He hopes this will increase his income, help him to improve his living conditions and allow him to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy new furniture, bowls, chopsticks and better quality food and beverages.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en: Tabu is a married woman. She has five children between the ages of 6 and 16. All five are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Muthoka, and he works as a mechanic. Tabu operates a business selling french fries from her home. She's worked in this business for four years. Her primary customers are passers-by. Tabu's other source of income includes her husband's income. She describes her greatest business challenge to be competition. Her highest monthly expense is school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Tabu will use the 40,000 KES loan to establish a vegetable business. Tabu aspires to establish a restaurant business in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to establish a vegetable business.

loans.name: Tien

texts.en:
Tien, 34, is the mother of two children. Together with her husband and children, Tien lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a bricklayer. The family also depends on the income that Tien makes from selling meat and groceries from her stall in a local street market. Tien began this business seven years ago.

Every morning, Tien buys vegetables and meat from wholesalers to sell in her stall. Tien would like a loan to buy a greater variety and higher quality of vegetables and meat so that she can attract more customers. 

She hopes that through this loan she will be able to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and higher quality of vegetables and meat to sell from her store.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is a 36-year-old married woman with two children, a son and a daughter. Her husband is a driver for hire. She has been raising dairy cows for fifteen years. Loan lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Loan would like to take out a loan to buy a greater number of cows and animal feed to increase the size of her business. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income, improve her family's living conditions, and cover the education costs of her children.

loans.use: To buy cows and animal feed.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas nació en el distrito de Kosñipata de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 34 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. Felicitas vive en la ciudad de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo y donde realiza todo tipo de actividad, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles pues tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Felicitas requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, sacos de fideos, sacos de arroz y otras cosas más. Felicitas pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Felicitas was born in the Kosñipata district in the Paucartambo province of the department of Cusco. She is thirty-four years old and married with three children. Felicitas lives in the city of Huancarani in the Paucartambo province, where she performs many kinds of jobs. She sells foodstuffs in her small grocery store which is located in her home. Her business is doing well thanks to her dedication to her work.

At this time, Felicitas is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise such as bags of sugar, bags of noodles, bags of rice, and other items. Felicitas belongs to the “Mamacha Rosario” communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa [Arariwa Association]. She is grateful for the opportunity offered to her by the Association, and is committed to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as bags of sugar, bags of noodles, bags of rice, and other items.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 57-year-old poultry farmer in Voi, Mombasa. He is a married father of three. He has been doing this business for the last three years with success. 

This marks his first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the loan to purchase more chicks to raise on his farm. He sells chicken and eggs to his customers. The proceeds from the business will be used to expand his business and repay his loan. 

He hopes to excel in this business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks to raise

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a married woman. She has 3 children and 2 are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Wilson and he works as a businessman. Nelly operates a potato-selling business and sells her goods from home. She has worked in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are passersby.

Nelly's other source of income includes her husband's earnings. Her highest monthly expense is food. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. Nelly will use the KES 20,000 loan to put up a stall for selling potatoes. Nelly aspires to sell at wholesale in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to put up a stall for selling potatoes.

loans.name: Esther B.

texts.en:
Esther  is 45 years old and lives in Gardnersville.  She’s married and her husband is a builder, they have four children aged 13 to 21 years old who are in school and live at home.

Esther has had her business for 15 years.  She operates a cook shop (restaurant).  She was taught how to run the business by her elder sister.  Her main challenges are the increases in prices for the things she buys.  She is happy when she sells and when her food finishes on time.

She’s requesting a loan to purchase rice by the bag, peppers, coal by the bag, a vat, onions and container of oil for her cook shop business. She would like to get money to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, peppers, coal, a vat, onions and a container of oil

loans.name: Elizabeth Finda's Group

texts.en:
Presented to you in the photo above are primary school teachers from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan. With the help of this loan, they will be able to pay school fees for their children, buy house-building materials, invest in business, etc. And at the end of each month, they repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. 

The leader of this group of borrowers is Elizabeth. The 62-year-old is a native of Njagbwema in eastern Sierra Leone. A widow with four children, Elizabeth has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials for the construction of a family dwelling house

loans.name: Tien

texts.en:
Tien, 56 years old, is married and has two sons and two daughters. He lives with his wife and children in Ho Chi Minh City.

Tien and his wife earn money by making mechanical spare parts at their house. He intends to use his loan to buy materials and equipment to increase his production. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help to improve his family's living conditions and send his children to school.

loans.use: To buy materials and equipment to increase his production of machine parts.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo en la Ciudad de Caaguazú son 18 mujeres quienes se agruparon para formar un  comité solidario, las mismas son señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, poseen un espíritu emprendedor y de ayuda mutua. Son personas que se reunen semalmente, con el compromiso de no fracasar y sobresalir trabajando en equipo con el Apoyo que le ofrece la Fundación Paraguaya. Actualmente están con mucho sacrificio en el 11° ciclo.
Nancy es miembro de este trabajador grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo de manera ambulante desde hace varios años. Este trabajo ha sido su medio de ayudar a su familia con los gastos del día a día. Nos dice que comenzó con muy pocos clientes, pero que en la actualidad ya tiene muy buena clientela.
Ella pide la ayuda de kiva y de fundación paraguaya para la compra de prendas de variados tipos, con los cuales podrá cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee was formed in the city of Caaguazu. There are 18 women who came together to make this united group. They are very responsible and hard workers, they have an entrepreneurial spirit that is of benefit to the whole group. They meet every week with the goal of not failing, to continue to move forward as a team with the support that is offered by the 'Fundación Paraguaya'. Currently they are burdened by a lot of work and are in their 11th cycle. 

Nancy is a member of this group. She makes a living selling clothes of all kinds, by selling house to house, which she has done for a few years.
This work has been her way of helping her family cover daily expenses. She told us that she started with very few customers, but that now she has a good customer base .

She asked for the help of Kiva and 'Fundacion Paraguaya' to be able to buy clothing of various types, with which will allow her to fulfill the requests of her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ascencia

texts.es:
Ascencia nació en el distrito de Caica de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 54 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. Ascencia vive en la ciudad de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo y donde realiza todo tipo de actividad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria los días domingos en la plaza principal de la ciudad de Huancarani. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Ascencia requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo verduras, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, carne y otras cosas más. Ascencia pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Los socios del Banco Comunal se reúnen cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Ascencia was born in the Caica district of Paucartambo province, in the department of Cusco. She is 54 years old, is in a common-law marriage, and has 2 children. Ascencia lives in the city of Huancarani in the province of Paucartambo, and this is also where she has her business. She sells food from a stand in the main plaza of the city of Huancarani on Sundays. She has had this business for a number of years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

At this time, Ascencia requests a loan to buy supplies such as: vegetables, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, meat and other products.  Ascencia belongs to the communal bank “Mamacha Rosario” in the Asociación Arariwa, and she is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means. Furthermore, she is committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

The members of her communal bank meet every 30 days in Huancarani district in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Peru. Cusco is known for being a city with a lot of tourism and commerce, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because it is the gateway to one of the 7 Wonders of the World: Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as vegetables, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, meat and other products

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has been extracting stones from quarries in Naivasha town for the last six years. He is 27 years old and single. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy another quarry and employ casual workers (day workers) so that he may increase his production.

In the future, David hopes to grow his business and own many quarries.

loans.use: to purchase another quarry and employ casual workers.

loans.name: San Jorge Group

texts.es:
Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal. Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La Sra. Isabel, presidenta del grupo, está casada, tiene 3 hijas, es una mujer muy activa y promueve el fortalecimiento del comité. Ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de electrodomésticos, como ser licuadoras, mixteras, planchas, y demás tipos. Empezó con la venta de algunos pocos electrodomésticos, pero hoy en día gracias a su trabajo ha mejorado mucho.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de electrodomésticos, con lo que podrá cumplir con los pedidos que tiene. Están contentas ellas por el apoyo que han recibido.
texts.en:
This communal bank is from the city of San Lorenzo.  The main goal of each of the members of this group is to experience growth at the economic and personal level.  They are known locally as hardworking women.

Isabel, the president of the group, is married and has 3 daughters.  She is a very active woman who promotes the strengthening of the group.  She has a business selling all types of appliances, such as blenders, mixers, irons and other products.  She started out selling just a few appliances but today, thanks to her hard work, her business has improved a lot.

Isabel is requesting a loan to buy appliances, so that she can fill some orders that she has.  This group is pleased with the support that they have received.

loans.use: to buy appliances to sell

loans.name: Thom

texts.en:
This is Thom, 52, a resident of Ho Chi Minh City. She is married and has four daughters. Her husband is retired. 

Thom operates a general store which provides for the people in her community many kinds of household products such as instant noodles, cooking oil bottles, soft drinks, and confections. She started this business over ten years ago. 

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a loan that she will be utilizing to buy toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business and hopes that she will be able to better provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas, 28, is married to Doreen, and they have two children. He has operated his retail business in Nakuru for the last four years.

Douglas was introduced to KADET LTD by one of its field officers, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use a 20,000 KES loan to buy home products to add to his store. In the future, Douglas hopes to change his retail business to a wholesale one.

loans.use: To buy home products to add to his store.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en: Jeniffer has operated her clothing business in Nakuru town for the last 10 years. She is 42 years old, married, and has two children, ages 23 and 13. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more clothes to add to her inventory. In the future, Jeniffer hopes to expand her business and open a boutique.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Muchiri

texts.en: Muchiri is a 45-year-old married man. He has two children, ages 2 and 16. He describes himself to be a consistent man. He operates a retail store where he sells motor vehicle spare parts. He has been involved in this business for 11 years. His business is located at a conducive area for business. His primary customers are mechanics and motor vehicle owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be shortage of spare parts. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more spare parts for selling. His business goal is to expand his retail store within five years.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien, forty years old, is married and has a daughter. She lives with her husband and daughter in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire.

Lien earns money by sewing and repairing clothes at her house. She intends to use her 15,000,000 VND loan to buy better quality sewing materials and a scooter for transporting and delivering her work.

Lien hopes her business runs smoothly and will help to improve her family's living conditions. She also wants to send her daughter to school.

loans.use: to buy better quality sewing materials and a scooter for transporting and delivering her work.

loans.name: Karol Andrea

texts.es:
Karol es una joven de 21 años de edad y vive con su esposa e hijos en la comunidad de San Carlos, en la provincia de Alajuela. Esta comunidad rural presenta mucho potencial de desarrollo, ya que a través de las actividades agrícolas ya que tiene un clima caliente, lo que permite la producción de ciertas frutas que se desarrollan con más fuerza en este tipo de clima asi como la siembra de mango, el melón y otros propios de la zona, es que ha logrado desarrollar actividades conexas y de servicios en la comunidad, tales como el ganado de engorde y la oportunidad de pequeños comercios y microempresas entre otros. Localidad que se caracteriza por sus parques nacionales, su extensa variedad en la flora y en la fauna. 

Desde hace unos meses Karol es estilista y tiene una sala de belleza, la cual necesita sacar adelante ya que le urge aportar económicamente en su hogar, ella es madre de un precioso niño y debe cuidarlo es por eso que estableció su salón en la casa.

Ella está solicitando el monto de ¢750,000.00 (Setecientos cincuenta mil colones), para comprar  una silla, un lavatorio para el cabello, químicos y otros materiales para su negocio.

Karol es miembro de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de SCSAR S.A, este será su primer préstamo razón por la cual está  muy agradecida, por las oportunidades  de acceso al crédito que esta le brinda y poder llevar a cabo sus proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Karol is 21 years old and lives with her husband and children in the community of San Carlos in the province of Alajuela.  This rural community offers much potential for development due to its farming activities and its hot climate, which allows for the production of certain fruits such as mangos, melons, and others that grow well in the area.  This has spurred the growth of related activities and services in the community, such as raising livestock and opportunities for small businesses.  The area is known for its national parks and for its great variety of flora and fauna.    

Karol has worked as a stylist for a few months now and has her own beauty salon.  She needs her salon to get ahead, since she urgently needs to support her family economically.  She has a beautiful baby boy that she has to take care of, which is why she set up the salon in her house.

Karol is asking for ¢750,000.00 (750,000 colones) so she can purchase a chair, a sink for washing hair, chemicals, and other supplies for her business.

Karol is a member of the Empresa de Crédito communal bank of SCSAR S.A.  This will be her first loan, and she is very grateful to be offered the opportunity to access credit, since it will allow her to carry out her life projects.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 27-year-old business man, who lives in Juba Nimule. He is married and has two children, ages 4 and 1. One of his children goes to school. 

Joseph runs a general store, and he has been in the business for three years. He has one employee. Joseph heard about Finance Sudan from the loan officer’s promotion done in the market. He is taking a loan of 1,000 SDG to purchase more items like water, soda, Nescafe, biscuits, and many others. Joseph has no other source of income. 

In five years, Joseph would like to have an expanded business and two shops. His major challenges include the low income rate and expense of goods not from South Sudan. Joseph says that he is appreciating Finance Sudan’s effort in South Sudan, which is able to help lift him out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase items such as water, soda, Nescafe, and biscuits

loans.name: David F.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are primary school teachers from Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. Teachers and other monthly salaried workers frequently go to Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org., to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they are better equipped to accomplish things that their salaries do not permit. For example, some will use this loan to pay school fees for their children, others will buy house-building materials for the construction of family dwellings, some will invest the loan in his spouse's business, etc. At the end of each month, their school’s bursar will deduct the repayment from their salaries and repay SMT/Kiva lenders.

David is the leader of this group of teachers. A native of Koardu village in Eastern Sierra Leone, this 60-year-old is married to a housewife and the father of four children – three in secondary school and one in college. David, who has 38 years of experience in the teaching profession, has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials – corrugated iron zinc, cement, etc. - for the construction of a family dwelling.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials – corrugated iron zinc, cement, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia is one of 12 members of the village bank “Luz del Sur” located in the Andean highlands of Cusco. Antonia is 50 years old and married with six children. Her children are ages 13,17, 23, 26, 27, and 28. Antonia works as a street vendor selling a variety of equipment including kitchen supplies. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase merchandise for her business. She hopes that the loan will enable her to grow her business and support her family, and is committed to making her payments on time.
texts.en: Antonia is one of 12 members of the village bank “Luz del Sur” located in the Andean highlands of Cusco. Antonia is 50 years old and married with six children. Her children are ages 13,17, 23, 26, 27, and 28. Antonia works as a street vendor selling a variety of equipment including kitchen supplies. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase merchandise for her business. She hopes that the loan will enable her to grow her business and support her family, and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as kitchen equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy assorted drinks and food to sell.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman. She has five children between the ages of three and twelve, three of whom are enrolled in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past twelve years Rehema has run a tailoring business, selling her goods from her shop. Her primary customers are passersby and her neighbors. Rehema's husband is also working. Seasonality is her greatest business challenge.

Rehema will use a 50,000 KES loan from Yehu to purchase cloth, thread and pins. She wishes to establish a textile business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread and pins.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia has operated her beauty salon in Nakuru town for the last 11 years. She is 45 years old and a widow with two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of salon equipment for use in her business and to buy cosmetics.

In the future, Sophia hopes to grow her business and open various beauty salons and cosmetics shops, thereby getting more income to provide better living standards and a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more stock of salon equipment, e.g., a hair dryer and cosmetics.

loans.name: Mushvig

texts.en:
Mushvig is married and a father of two children. He is a hardworking and goal-oriented person. 

Mushvig has been involved in a taxi service for over four years. He is requesting a loan in the sum of 800 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) to give the vehicle a repair. His family depends on the money he earns from the taxi service. He relies on your help and support.

loans.use: To give the vehicle a repair.

loans.name: Adilia Natalia

texts.es:
Adilia Natalia, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada desde hace 20 años, tiene seis hijos con edades desde 2 a 20 años, dos de ellos están estudiando, vive en Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. Su esposo se desempeña como guardia de seguridad en una empresa privada.
Adilia tiene su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 9 años, elabora tortillas de maíz normal y especial para elaborar tacos. Atiende a sus clientes todo el día, cuenta con dos personas más quienes le ayudan en el negocio.
Inició esta actividad con sus propios esfuerzos, luego solicito préstamos a ODEF con los cuales ha hecho crecer su negocio. Actualmente está solicitando el doceavo préstamo a ODEF, para comprar los insumos como el maíz para elaborar las tortillas. Sus planes son seguir trabajando para obtener más ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adilia Natalia is 39 years old, and she has been married for 20 years.  She has six children ranging in age from 2 to 20.  Two of them are in school.  She lives in Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortez.  Her husband works as a security guard at a private company.

Adilia has had her own business of making tortillas for nine years.  She makes regular corn tortillas and special tortillas to make tacos.  She waits on her customers all day, and she has two more people who help her in her business.

She started this business activity through her own efforts.  She then requested loans from ODEF, which have made her business grow.

She is now requesting her 12th loan from ODEF.  She will use it to buy ingredients like corn to make the tortillas.  Her plans are to continue working in order to get more income and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like corn to make tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en:
Felecia, 35, lives in Gardnersville with her husband, a businessman. They have three children between thirteen and fifteen years old; all three of them are in school and live at home. The cost of transportation is her main challenge.

For the past fifteen years Felecia has been selling oil, salt, pepper and many other items in the local market. She learned this business from her mother and says there are so many things that the earnings from her work can do for her.

Felecia is requesting a 10,000 LRD loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase pepper, salt by the bag, palm oil and many other items to sell. She hopes to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy pepper, salt, palm oil and other items to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 32 years old and has a son who is 13 years old. Emily has a secretarial bureau that she has been running for the past one year.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more more printing papers for photocopying and to service her photocopying machines.

In the future, Emily hopes to expand her business and open a boutique.

loans.use: To buy printing papers.

loans.name: Rocío Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Pedro se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rocio, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas  de  13 y 11 años de  edad, las dos  estudian en colegio. Su esposo tiene un taller de aluminio y vidrio. Ella aprendió belleza en una academia en la ciudad de Manta hace varios años.

Doña Rocío para ganarse algo por su cuenta se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y también realiza trabajos de belleza como pintado uñas, cortes de cabello, tinturados, entre otros trabajos, ella realiza sus trabajos a domicilio y allí mismo ella también aprovecha para vender su mercadería, la misma que deja a crédito y que cobra cada 8 días,  lleva 14 años con este negocio el mismo que lo empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco.
 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, esmaltes, tintes de cabello y otras herramientas de belleza necesarias para su trabajo, ella espera muy pronto poner su salón de belleza en su casa. Lleva 14 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
The San Pedro Communal Bank meets every fortnight in the neighborhood by the same name located in Manta, a town renowned for her beautiful beaches, visited all over the year, and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Here we meet Rocio. She is 37 years old, she is married and she has two daughters aged 13 and 11 who go to school. Her husband runs an aluminum and glass workshop. She completed her studies at a beauty school in Manta a few years ago.

In order to earn an income on her own, Rocio sells clothes of every fashion as well as providing a series of beauty services such as nail varnishing, haircuts, hair coloring and many more at her customers’ houses, making the most of it by selling her products as well. She sells on credit and she collects cash every 8 days. She has been engaging in this activity for 14 years, and she started it with the first loan received from the Communal Bank.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy clothes, nail varnishes, hair dyes and other beauty equipment that she needs for her job. She hopes to set her own beauty salon in her house. She has been working with the Communal Bank for 14 years and she likes it because thanks to the first loan she was able to start her activity.

She dreams of running her own beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy nail varnishes, hair dyes and other beauty equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for irrigation on her farm and to purchase potato seedlings.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia, 28, is single and lives in Gardnersville with her two children aged fourteen and eight. The children are presently in school and live at home.

For the past nine years Patricia has sold charcoal in her community. She makes a good profit, and has many customers. She is requesting a 10,000 LRD loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more charcoal to sell.

Patricia wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 45 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Teodolina de 41 años de edad. Tienen 4 hijos, todos ya mayores, que trabajan de forma independiente.
Miguel tiene una Joyería - Relojería y Empeños en el centro de la ciudad, comenta que le va muy bien en el negocio, que va creciendo de a poco gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio. Cuenta con clientela ya formada, debido al tiempo que lleva en su trabajo.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de joyas, con lo cual podrá surtir su negocio, para que de esa forma pueda seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Miguel is from the city of Santaní. He is 45 years old and married to Ms. Teodolina who is 41 years old. They have four children, all of them grown and who work independently. 

Miguel has a jewelry, watch and pawn shop in the city's downtown. He comments that it is going very well for him in the business and that he is growing little by little thanks to his effort and sacrifice. He already has an established customer base owing to the amount of time he has in the business. 

He is seeking the loan for the purchase of jewelry with which to stock his business, so that he may, in this way, continue helping his family.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia tiene 37 años de edad y tiene una relación libre de la cual tiene seis hijos. Virginia vive en la ciudad de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo y donde realiza todo tipo de actividad, ella su actividad económica principal es la elaboración  de artesanía como por ejemplo chompas y frazadas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Virginia requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como por ejemplo lana de alpaca.

Virginia pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Virginia is 37 years old and is in an open relationship from which she has six children. Virginia lives in the city of Huancarani in the province of Paucartambo, where she engages in all kinds of activities. Her principal economic activity is the making of handicrafts such as sweaters and blankets. She has dedicated herself to this business now for a number of years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. 

On this occasion, Virginia requires a loan to buy more materials such as alpaca wool. 

Virginia belongs to the communal bank "Mamacha Rosario" of the microfinance organization Asociación Arariwa, and she is grateful for the opportunity offered through this group. As a result, she is committed to completing her repayments according to the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy more materials such as alpaca wool

loans.name: Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El comité Kyrey está formado por 12 señoras muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras de la ciudad de Lambaré. El grupo se inicio con la idea de poder trabajar juntas, dentro de un ambiente de respeto ya que todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Su meta es poder ayudarse las unas a las otras y de esa forma salir adelante.
Juana es una de las miembros, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas sobre pedidos, como así también a la elaboración y venta de bijouterie. Ella es una persona muy dinámica, y muestra de ella es la cantidad de actividades que hace. Gracias a estos trabajo ha podido ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para tener un mejor estilo de vida.
Ella se ha acercado a la fundación y a kiva para solicitar un crédito, el cual desea invertir en la compra de prendas, ya que tiene pedidos de sus clientes y le gustaría poder cumplir con ellos.
texts.en:
The Kyrey committee is formed of 12 very hardworking and enterprising women in the city of Lambaré. The group began with the idea of being able to work together in an atmosphere of respect as they are all friends and neighbors in this city. The group's goal is to each be able to help the others and, in this way, to be successful.
Juana is one of the members. She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman. She tells us that she works selling clothes to order and also making and selling jewelry. She is a very dynamic person and this is demonstrated by the number of things that she does. Thanks to her work, she has been able to help her family and give them what they need to have a better quality of life.
She has come to the foundation and to Kiva to request a loan which she wants to use to buy clothes as she has orders from her customers and she wants to be able to fulfill these orders.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Toton

texts.en:
Toton is 47 years old and married to Josephine. For the last three years he has practiced mixed farming in Naivasha.

Toton was introduced to KADET by one of its field officers. This will be his second loan. He paid off the previous loan satisfactorily. He plans to use this 50,000 KES loan to purchase sheep and a goat to raise and sell later at a profit.

Toton hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Naivasha.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and a goat to raise.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
San Roque es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Carapeguá, se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo con 10 integrantes, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que se dedican a diversas actividades de todo tipo.
La Sra. Maria es tejedora, con 65 años de edad cumplidos aún se dedica a dicha actividad. El deseo de ella es implementar e invertir en su actividad para así ver crecer su negocio.  Ella ha trabajado toda su vida y desea poder seguir sintiéndose útil, y seguir aportando en la casa, es por ello que se esfuerza siempre.
Ella solicita la ayuda de kiva y fundación paraguaya para la compra de hilos y  agujas para poder seguir trabajando. Maria está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que ha recibido, ya que muchas veces las personas ya no quieren ayudar a las personas muy mayores.
texts.en:
San Roque is a communal banking group formed in the city of Carapeguá, which is in its fourth cycle with 10 participants, all very hardworking and entrepreneurial women who dedicate themselves to various activities of all kinds.

Maria is a knitter, and even at 65 years old is still dedicated to this activity. She wishes to invest in her activity so that she can grow her business. She has worked all her life and would like to continue to be able to feel useful and to continue providing for her home which is why she is always working so hard. 

She is asking for help from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya to buy needles and thread to be able to continue working. Maria is very grateful for the opportunity that she has received, especially as many times people do not want to help older people.

loans.use: to buy needles and yarn

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 43 years old and from Nakuru, Kenya.  He is married to Selina.  They have two children between 15 and 19 years old.

Richard has a motorcycle business that he has been doing for the past three years.  He has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy another motorbike.  He is optimistic that his business will do better after the loan.

He hopes to venture into cattle rearing in the near future.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Ysela

texts.en:
Ysela is thirty years old and is raising an eleven-year-old son with her partner. She is one of twelve members of the village bank “Luz del Sur” located in the Andean highlands of Cusco.

For nine years Ysela has operated a juice stand in the market. Her most popular juice is a blend of juices, though flavors such as papaya, pineapple, banana with milk, and orange and carrot are also customer favorites.

Ysela is requesting a 1000 PEN loan from Asociación Arariwa to invest in appliances such as a blender and to buy fruit for her business. Her ambition is to open more juice stands in other locations.

loans.use: to invest in appliances such as a blender and buy fruit for her business.

loans.name: Kristel Ariana

texts.es:
La clienta vive en una comunidad rural, ubicada en la provincia de Cartago, cantón de Alvarado, llamada  Cervantes.

Vive con su esposo y su pequeña hija de un año de edad.
 Quiere crear un negocio familiar  aprovechando las condiciones que se dan en este momento de atender una población que requiere de productos como calzado y ropa casual . Que  les permita generar ingresos para solventar sus necesidades , autorealizarse , lograr independencia económica y dar un futuro mejor a su hija.
Durante las mañanas ella cuida de su hija, realiza las tareas domésticas . Por las tardes y fines de semana junto con su esposo venden calzado en su comunidad y lugares aledaños.
En este momento lo hacen con un vahículo que les presta su suegro. Ella solicita a la fundación un crédito para cubrir parte del valor del vehículo que comprará, ya que tienen unos ahorros.
Tiene como metas lograr un negocio con solidez, continuar con sus estudios universitarios y tener estabilidad económica.
Entre  los obstáculos que enfrenta en este momento es la falta de capital para adquirir su vehículo, que considera puede resolver con el apoyo que le brinde la fundación.
texts.en:
The borrower lives in Cervantes, a rural community in the Cartago province belonging to the Alvarado canton.

She lives with her husband and her little one year old daughter.

She wants to create a family business by taking advantage of the now favorable conditions to take care of a population that needs products like footwear and casual clothes.  This would allow them to generate income to pay for their necessities, to become self-sufficient, to achieve financial independence, and to give their daughter a better future.

In the mornings she takes care of her daughter and does the household chores.  In the afternoons and on the week-ends she and her husband sell footwear in her community and the surrounding areas.  They are doing this now with a vehicle that her father-in-law is lending them.

She is requesting a loan from the Fundación to cover part of the value of the vehicle they will buy.  They do have some savings.

Her goals are to manage to have a solid business, to continue with her university studies, and to have financial stability.  Among the obstacles that she now faces is the lack of capital to get a vehicle.  She believes she will be able to resolve this with the support from the Fundación.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Kristel Ariana from  Costa Rica

loans.use: to buy a vehicle, which will facilitate shoe sales.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 39-year-old tailor in Mariakani, Kenya.  She is a married mother of four and has been sewing clothes for her customers for the last 12 years with great success.  

This is Jane’s third loan from KADET.  She plans to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing threads and clothing materials.  She will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land to build a business premises. 

She hopes to have a prosperous life with her family.

loans.use: purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 34 years old.  She is from Nakuru and has a son who is 10 years old. 

Peninah is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, to enable her buy more school uniforms to add to her stock. She was introduced to KADET  LTD by its staff. This will be her first loan and she is optimistic that her business will do well after getting it.

She hopes to be able to sell all types of clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a 39-year-old lady and is married to Habel, 53 years old. Sofia and Habel have four children: Febby, 21, working; Maksi, 18, in the 2nd grade of Senior High school; Dewi, 11, in the 5th grade of Elementary School; and Jevan, 6.

In addition to being a housewife, Sofia spends her days cultivating plants at the farm. She cultivates string beans, mustard greens, peanuts and corn. From farming, Sofia recently harvested string beans, mustard greens, peanuts and corn. She sold them at the nearest market. The income from selling the harvest was spent to cover their household and the educational expenses. 

Sofia plans to cultivate more plants; she needs more capital to do so. She heard that TLM provides loan assistance; Sofia then submitted a loan application and requested a loan of IDR 4,000,000 to purchase seedlings, pesticide and fertilizer as well. She is hoping that TLM will approve the application so she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, pesticide and fertilizer as well

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 48 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. Alejandrina vive en la ciudad de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo y donde realiza todo tipo de actividad, ella su actividad económica principal es la venta de comida y agricultura. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Alejandrina requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo fideos, azúcar, verduras, carne, arroz, aceite y otras cosas más. Alejandrina pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 48 years old, is married, and has three children from this marriage. Alejandrina lives in the city of Huancarani in the province of Paucartambo where she engaged in various kinds of activities, but her principal economic activity is the sale of food and agricultural products. She has dedicated herself to this business for many years and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. 

On this occasion, Alejandrina requires the loan to buy more basic necessity products such as beans, sugar, vegetables, meet, rice, oil and other things. Alejandrina belongs to the communal bank "Mamacha Rosario" of the microfinance organization Asociación Arariwa. She is very grateful for the opportunity provided through this group, and as a result is committed to completing her loan repayments according to the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy more basic necessity products such as beans, sugar, vegetables, meet, rice, oil and other things

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 30 years old and married to Vera.  He sells maize, a business he started five years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 35,000. 

He has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more bags of maize to sell.  The profit from his business will help him repay his loan and improve his living standards. 

He hopes to be economically stable.  This is his first loan.

loans.use: purchase more bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a 25-year-old man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is the father of two children. He has a shop selling basic grocery products in a small public area. He is not literate but has 10 years' experience in this field. He started his business by selling his wife's jewelry in order to open a general store with a small amount of capital. 

As his business is small and a far distance from town, he uses that to help older families so they don't have to go to the market in the city, and he attempts as much as possible to provide his customers' needs himself. His business is a source of income and profit. 

Recently, he would like to expand his business but  the wholesalers hesitate to provide him with the required goods, dealing with him as a lower class person, which has become a challenge for him. In spite of that, he was able to return his shop back to usual but he could not buy all the items he had before as he needs financial support. 

So, he applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB in order to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, mineral water, etc. for his business. This loan would help to meet the demand of his clientele, bringing in all that they require. 

In the future, he hopes to purchase a small vehicle to use for transporting materials for his business from the market easily in order to improve his profit.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, mineral water, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret, 56-year-old mother of a 31-year-old, has operated her retail business in Nakuru for the last seven years.  Introduced to KADET LTD. by one of our field officers, this will be his first loan, with which she plans to buy more eggs, flour, and cooking fat for resale. In the future, Margaret hopes to develop her business into a wholesale enterprise.

loans.use: to buy eggs, flour, cooking fat, etc.

loans.name: Gloria Mariana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Pedro se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mariana, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos, ambos mayores de edad, uno de sus hijos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es jubilado.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarse con sus gastos y los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo. Ella sale a recorrer tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas diarias, también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando quieren alguna prenda o cuando le llega mercadería nueva ya que a ella le mandan la ropa desde España, también cuando necesita mercadería compra en Manta en una distribuidora. Tiene más de 25 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que tiene muchos clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisas, ropa de niños entre otras prendas. Esta desde hace 15 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.

 Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su vida y en su negocio.
texts.en:
The San Pedro Communal Bank meets every fortnight in the neighborhood by the same name located in Manta, a town renowned for her beautiful beaches, visited all over the year, and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Here we meet Mariana. She is 60 years old, she is married and she has two adult children, one of whom still lives with her. Her husband is retired.

She is a housewife who sells clothes of every fashion in order to earn some money on her own to help paying for her expenses and those of her family. She sells door-to-door three days a week for 2-3 hours a day; she also sells in her house where her customers come to when they want some clothes or when she receives new products, as she receives clothes form Spain; when she needs products she also buys them form a supplier in Manta. She has been engaging in this activity for more than 25 years and she has many customers.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy trousers, blouses, shirts, children’s clothes and other products. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for 15 years, and she likes it because the repayments are is easy to make.

She dreams of getting ahead in life and of carrying on with her activity.

loans.use: To buy trousers, blouses, shirts and children’s clothes.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a single man who is 25 years old and lives in Nakuru. Simon is a farmer and has been doing it for the past two years.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a farming supplies for his farm.  Simon hopes to expand his business and make more profits.  Hence, he will improve his living standards.

loans.use: To buy more farm isupplies.

loans.name: Phyllis

texts.en:
Phyllis is 55 years old and a single mother of 5 children. She has been in the rental housing business in Nakuru town for the last six years. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD, by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to complete the construction of one of her rental houses.

In the future, Phyllis hopes to expand her business and own plots to build both residential houses and commercial buildings, thereby increasing her income and improving the family's living standards.

loans.use: to complete a rental house

loans.name: Amon

texts.en:
Amon is a 40 year-old a businessman.  He is married to Eunice, a business lady. They are blessed with four children. He has been selling tomatoes for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Amon will use the loan to buy tomatoes for selling. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes for selling

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, 29, lives in Kisumu City and is married to Oballa. They have six children aged between one and fifteen years of age. Three of them are stepchildren that she cares for.

For the past ten years Rose has sold shoes, making a monthly profit of 10,000 KES. She is taking a 20,000 KES loan (her first from KADET LTD) to buy men and children's shoes to sell. Her profits will be used to buy more shoes to sell.

Rose’s ambition is to have a big shoe shop.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
El señor Wilson tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su madre en la ciudad de Carapeguá. Desde los 14 años de edad empezó a salir a vender las colchas que ellos mismos producen con su mamá, después de 6 años se independizó y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia.
Lleva los productos artesanales a venderlos por las ciudades de Villa Elisa y Asunción, se transporta en su motocicleta que gracias a su trabajo logró comprarse y también brindarle a su madre la ayuda necesaria, ya que prácticamente depende de él. Es un joven muy emprendedor y trabajador, en el barrio es conocido por esas cualidades.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hamacas, frazadas y sábanas, puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos y quiere poder cumplir con sus clientes. El está muy agradecido por la ayuda que recibe, pues este trabajo le ayuda en su día a día.
texts.en:
Wilson is 32 years old, is single, and lives with his mother in the city of Carapeguá. Starting when he was 14 years old, he began to go out to sell the quilts that he and his mom would produce together, and after 6 years he became independent and began to work for himself.

He takes handicrafts to sell in the cities of Villa Elisa and Asunción, which he transports on his motorcycle which he was able to buy thanks to his work. He is also able to provide his mother with the help that she needs, as she is practically dependent on him. He is a very entrepreneurial and hardworking young man, and he is known for these qualities in his neighborhood.

He is asking for this loan to buy hammocks, blankets and sheets, given that he has had many orders for these products and he would like to be able to serve his clients. He is very grateful for the help he receives, as this job helps him with his day to day expenses.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, blankets, and sheets among other things

loans.name: Tamba Alex's Group

texts.en: Tamba is the leader of this group of teachers and has been a teacher for 30 years.  59-year-old Tamba is married to a teacher and the couple has eight children who are in college.  Tamba and his colleague teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan.  With the help of this loan, they will be able to pay school fees for their children, invest in business and buy pieces of furniture.  At the end of each month, their school’s bursar deducts the repayment from their salaries and repays SMT/Kiva on their behalf.  Tamba is going to use his share of the loan to pay college fees for his children.

loans.use: pay college fees for his children.

loans.name: Juanita Hisavel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Pedro se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Juanita, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y el menor de 11 años, todos sus hijos aun vive en su casa y estudian los mayores en universidad y el menor en colegio.  Su esposo es taxista.

Ella tiene un negocio en su casa, venden computadores, impresoras, repuestos y accesorios para estos artefactos, allí también tienen una pequeña distribuidora de gaseosas y agua mineral, trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos, tiene 4 años con este negocio y es una muy buena fuente de ingresos que tienen sin salir de casa.
 
Este crédito es para comprar ciertos repuestos para computadoras que le faltan así como también gaseosas y aguas. Esta desde hace 11 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son muy importantes para su negocio.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The San Pedro Communal Bank meets every fortnight in the neighborhood by the same name located in Manta, a town renowned for her beautiful beaches, visited all over the year, and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Here we meet Juanita. She is 41 years old, she is married and she has 2 adult children and an 11-year-old child. All of her children live with her and they are all students: the first two study at the university and the youngest goes to school. Her husband is a taxi driver.

She runs her activity in her house: she sells computers, printers and their accessories and spare parts. She also owns a small vending machine with fizzy drinks and mineral water. She works every day helped by her children; she has been running this activity for 4 years and she can count on this good source of income without leaving her house.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy some computer spare parts that she needs as well as fizzy drinks and water. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for 11 years, and she like it because the loans are very important for her activity.

She wishes that her children become good professionals.

loans.use: To buy computer spare parts, fizzy drinks and water.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa makes fried riped plantain and bean stew.  She also cooks banku and okra stew to sell in Elmina.  She has six dependents.  Theresa uses her income for the general upkeep of her children.  She needs this loan to purchase plantains, beans, maize and other ingredients for the preparation of her food for sale.
