With the new profit from her expanded business, Theresa will mount a better stall for the sale of her banku, fried plantains and beans.

loans.use: purchase ingredients to make food to sell.

loans.name: Juana Concepción

texts.es: Juana Concepción de cincuenta y nueve años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda en el lugar donde reside, ahí vende productos de primera necesidad, su negocio es muy conocido en la zona y se ha hecho de mas clientela, pues es el mas surtido y donde hay productos de primera calidad a precios bajos, además el servicio es excelente; Juana es una mujer muy activa y con muchos sueños que quiere alcanzar, esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para lograrlo y cree que su mejor arma es el amor y la dedicación que le pone a su labor, es por eso que esta convencida de solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, pan, golosinas, especies, etc. Juana Concepción tiene fe que así podrá llevar a su hogar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juana Concepción is 59 years old, and she lives with her partner and their children in her own house. She runs a shop in her house where she sells basic necessities. Her shop is well-known in her area and she has many customers, because her shop is the best furnished, she sells first quality products at low prices and her service is excellent. Juana is a very lively woman with many goals to achieve. She is ready to work very hard to succeed and she thinks her best weapons are the love and dedication she puts in her job. For this reason she decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan that will help her purchase basic grains, bread, sweets and spices. Juana Concepción firmly believes that through her activity she will succeed in providing for her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, bread, sweets and spices.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is 35 years old, a married man who has six children, three of them in school. To make a living, he owns & operates a bookstore. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. He has been in this business for over 10 years.

He started his business with limited capital with which he purchased a plot of land in his area, then he worked hard to look after his young brothers. He gained access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to improve business activities.

He is very friendly and has already gained some permanent customers. He helps himself by bringing in new goods from another city such as stereos, cosmetics, and perfumes. Due to the current bad situation which Yemen has met, however, his business has had lower profits and fewer customers. So, he requested a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy additional inventory & use as working capital for books, toys, and cosmetics so that will  increase his sales since this type of product is very popular.

He  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income as well as his dream to see his brothers get married.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory such as  books, toys, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah  produces kenkey (fermented dough) for sale. In the photo, in front of Hannah, are bags of the maize she uses in producing the kenkey. She is a single parent and has 5 children. Hannah has been into this business for 4 years now. 

As a single parent she uses her income to feed, clothe and pay her children’s school fees. 

Hannah will use her loan to purchase maize in a large quantity to enable her to produce more kenkey for sale. With the new profit Hannah wishes to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase maize in a large quantity to enable her to produce more kenkey (fermented dough) for sale.

loans.name: Achan

texts.en:
Achan is a 30 year-old business woman, who lives in Juba. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 7 months and 9 years. Two of them go to school. 

Achan runs a tea service business, and she has been in the business for 2 years. She has no employee. Achan heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients as well outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. She is taking a loan of 1000 SDG to purchase more items like milk, sugar, charcoal and others. In addition to this business, Achan has her houses for rent as another source of income.  In 5 years time, Achan would like to change from tea services to hotel services.  Her major challenges include a low income rate and home expenses at the moment.

Achan says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support, especially for women.  It really encouraged women to do their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like milk, sugar, charcoal and others

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
Kuña Aty  se denomina el buen grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que una de las contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 12 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 5° ciclo, en forma conjunta y dentro de un ambiente de respeto y ayuda.
Eustaquia se dedica a la lavandería y comenta que siempre tiene mucho trabajo, por lo que da gracias a Dios.  Comenzó lavando solo para algunos vecinos, pero de a poco fue creciendo que hoy en día, de barrios aledaños también recibe clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de jabones en polvo, en pan, suavizante para ropas, lavandinas, desinfectantes y demás insumos que utiliza en la lavandería. Ella está muy contenta con la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya y de kiva.
texts.en:
Kuña Aty is the name of this group of women formed in the city of Itá, as a result of one of the women contacting the loan officer in a weekly meeting the officer had in the area about the way the Committee of Entrepreneurial Women works. After being assessed with respect to the program, she was able to gather 12 women who now find themselves happily working together in their 5th loan cycle in a respectful and helpful environment. 

Eustaquia, one of the group members, works in laundry service and tells us that she has always had a lot of work, thanks to God. She began doing laundry for a few neighbors, but this small amount grew and now she also receives clients from surrounding neighborhoods. 

She is asking for this loan to buy powdered soap, fabric softener, bleach, disinfectant and other laundry ingredients. She is very happy with the help that she receives from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy laundry ingredients

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia  produces kenkey for sale.  In the photo, Sophia is standing beside the  maize she uses in her kenkey production. She is married to a driver and has one child. She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of the family. Sophia needs this loan to purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production. With the new profit, Sophia will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca  produces kenkey for sale.  She is the lady sitting with maize in front of her.  Around her are the leaves she uses to cover the maize dough.  She is married to a driver and has 3 children.   Rebecca  has been in this business for 7 years.  She uses her income to assist her husband to feed and clothe her children and to pay their school fees.  Rebecca  will use her loan to purchase maize in large quantity to enable her to produce more kenkey for sale. With the new profit,  Rebecca wishes to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase maize in large quantity to enable her to produce more kenkey for sale

loans.name: Paulina Yaa

texts.en: Paulina Yaa is a petty trader at Elmiina. She has done this for five years now.   The items she sells  are milk, Milo (a breakfast drink), sugar, soups, tinned tomatoes, tinned fish,  biscuits, toffees,  etc..  She is married with five children. Her husband is a driver.    Paulina  uses her income to assist her husband to pay the utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Paulina plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 43-year-old Adama from Waterloo, eastern area, Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 18 years and 22 years. Two of her children attend school. 

Adama runs a general merchandise store, where she sells biscuits, soap, candles, toothpaste, hair cream, baby oil and baby power. She has been running this business for 18 years. She works at the business from 7:00 am until 10 pm, 7 days per week. Her business is the only source of income she has.  Adama says that the main challenge to her business is transportation problems and price inflation.

Adama has requested a loan in order to buy more biscuits, soap, candles, toothpaste, hair cream and baby oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to do international business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy biscuits, soap, candles, toothpaste, hair cream and baby oil

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Fatmata from Fullah town in Central area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 12 years and 18 years. Fatmata's children are currently attending school. 

In 2006, Fatmata established her boutique business. Her other source of income comes from small-scale animal rearing. She began her business because she needed a permanent source of income to support her family. She works at the business 7 days per week and 8 hours a day. She says that the main challenges to her business are price variation and slow sales.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more female dresses, shoes, shirts and bags. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's standard of living. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more female dresses, shoes, shirts and bags.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia  sells cosmetics at Elmiina.  She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a driver. Cecilia has been selling cosmetics for 3 years.  

She uses her income to assists the husband in the general up keep their family. Cecilia will use her loan to purchase more cosmetices for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to aquire a shop for the sale of the cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetices for sale.

loans.name: El Cruce Hacia El Futuro (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Cruce hacia el Futuro está formado por 10 socias, quienes viven alrededor de la parroquia de Sinincay ubicada a 8 Km. de Cuenca, los habitantes de esta parroquia han aprovechado los recursos naturales como la arcilla utilizada desde la época de la colonia como materia prima para la fabricación de tejas y ladrillos, su gente laboran en la agricultura, cría de animales, comercio y muchos laboran en la ciudad. Nuestras socias laboran diariamente en diferentes actividades las mismas que le permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares, se caracterizan por ser mujeres luchadoras, amables y carismáticas. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Zoila, tiene 32 años de edad, está separada de su esposo pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 18 y 7 años  y sus últimos hijos son gemelos de un año seis meses de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente y su segundo hijo está en una escuelita de la ciudad. Vive en casa de sus padres con quienes compartes los gastos del hogar.

Doña Zoila trabaja como empleada y cuida personas de la tercera edad, se encuentra en esta actividad hace un año y medio y trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Los fines de semana labora en un mercado de la ciudad vendiendo frutas, se inició en esta actividad hace 6 meses.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su mamá. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
El Cruce hacia el Futuro Communal Bank is made up of 10 members who live around Sinicay Parish, located 8 km. from Cuenca. The inhabitants of the parish have taken advantage of the natural resources such as clay, using it since colonial times as primary material in roof tiles and bricks. The people work in agriculture, animal raising, trade and many other jobs in the city. Our members work every day in different jobs that enable them to contribute to the upkeep of their households. They characterize themselves as hardworking, friendly and charismatic women.

Sra. Zoila is one of the members of this group. She is 32 years old and separated from her husband. However she had 4 sons from this union. They are 18 and 7 years of age, with the youngest twins, who are 1 and a half years old. Her oldest son works and helps her financially and her second son attends a little school in in the city. She lives with her parents and shares household expenses with them.

Zoila has been employed as a caretaker for the elderly for a year and a half and works from Monday to Friday, from 8 in the morning until 8 at night. On weekends, she works at a market in the city selling fruit and she has had this business for 6 months.

This is her first loan from the communal bank. She was invited to join it by her mother. She will invest her loan in the purchase of fruit.

Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase fruit.

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru:
Динаре 52 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Динара работает учителем русского языка и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для семьи, Динара занимается животноводством и полеводством.  Начатое еще в период Советского Союза с 15,000 сом  (KGS) хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. На данный момент в хозяйстве Динары  имеется три коровы и семнадцать овец. Также, Динара обрабатывает 1,30 га земли, где ежегодно косит клевер, используя его в качестве корма для собственного скота.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Динара обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы Динара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Dinara is 52, married, and has two children. Dinara works as a Russian language teacher. She is also involved in animal husbandry, which is a secondl source of income. Her business, which was started back in the Soviet era with 15,000 soms (KGS), now earns about 15,000 soms (KGS) a month. Dinara's business currently numbers three cows and seventeen sheep. Dinara also farms 1.2 hectares of land, on which she annually mows clover and uses it to feed her own livestock. In order to to further develop her business, Dinara has requested a loan of 100,000 soms (KGS) from the Bai Tushum & Partners Company to purchase cattle. With the revenue, Dina plans to invest into further increasing her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba  sells fabrics and watermelons at Elmina which she has done for 8 years. She is a single mother and has 2 children. She uses her income to feed her children and pay school fees. Aba needs this loan to purchase fabrics and watermelons   for sale. With the new profit, Aba will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase  fabrics and watermelons   for sale.

loans.name: Lira

texts.ru: Лире 54 года, замужем. Лира в течении многих лет проработала учителем начальных классов в школе села Хан-Бурго, сейчас на пенсии. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, 10 лет назад  Лира начала свой бизнес в животноводстве с покупки одной дойной коровы. Благодаря упорному труду Лиры, на сегодня  ее хозяйство насчитывает 2 коровы, 1 теленка, 1 кобылицу и 15 овец. Также Лира обрабатывает 2,0 га орошаемой земли, где выращивает фасоль и картофель. Для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Лира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Лира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Lira is 54 yeas old and married. Lira worked for many years as an elementary school teacher in the village of Khan-Burgo, and she is now retired. Seeking a source of income for her family, Lira started her own animal husbandry business ten years ago by purchasing one dairy cow. Thanks to her hard work, Lira's business now numbers two cows, one calf, one mare, and 15 sheep. Lira also farms two hectares of irrigated land, where she grows beans and potatoes. In order to further expand her business, Lira requested a loan of 70,000 soms (KGS) from the Bai Tushum & Partners Company to purchase livestock. With the revenue, Lira plans to invest in further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Matilda Abena

texts.en: Matilda Abena  used to sell cooked rice and stew but now  operates a grocery at Elmina, which she has done for 6 years now.   The items in her grocery shop are milk, Milo (a breakfast drink powder), sugar, soups, different kinds of soft  drinks, tinned tomatoes, tinned fish,  biscuits, toffees, powdered milk  etc.  She is a single parent with 2 children. Matilda uses her income  to pay her children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Matilda  plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba cooks kenkey for sale at Elmina.  She is married to a farmer and has 5 children.  Araba has been selling kenkey for 15 years now.  She uses her income to support her husband to pay their children's school fees.  Araba will use her loan to purchase bags of maize for the preparation of her kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for the preparation of her kenkey for sale

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is a baker, and in the photo she is cleaning the oven she uses in baking.  Vida bakes  bread for sale  at Elmina, which she has done for 6  years now.  She is married to a teacher and has 2 children.  She uses her income to help her husband to  feed and clothe  their children.  She will use her loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar and oil for her bakery.  Vida hopes to use the new profits  to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of flour, sugar and oil for her bakery.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells cloth and fabric at Elmina.  She has done this for 20 years. She is a single mother and has 3 children. She uses her income to pay her accommodation and utility bills. Elizabeth needs this loan to purchase more cloth for sale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Elizabeth will acquire a shop for the sale of her cloths and fabrics.

loans.use: purchase more cloth for sale.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
El Sr. Lorenzo tiene 38 años de edad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos, vive en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Actualmente es Taxista tiene vehículo propio, y nos comenta que anteriormente trabajaba como chofer en el taxi, luego compro para su vehículo propio y de esa forma logró independizarse.
El se define como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, su lucha diaria es por su familia, ya que ellos son quien lo motiva a poder seguir trabajando. Su meta es seguir creciendo y algún día poder tener su propia parada de taxis.
El solicita el crédito para invertirlo en el mantenimiento de su taxi, ya que este es su elemento de trabajo esencial, sin el cual no podría trabajar. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la ayuda que le están dando.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 36 years old, married, has two children, and lives in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. He is currently a taxi driver and has his own vehicle. He tells us that previously he worked as a chauffeur and later he bought his own vehicle, and in this way was able to become independent. 

He defines himself as a very hardworking and entrepreneurial person, and his daily fight is for his family as they are the ones who motivate him to continue working. His goal is to continue growing and one day to be able to have his own taxi stand. 

He asks for this loan to invest in the maintenance of his taxi, as this is the fundamental component of his job, without which he would not be able to work. He is grateful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the help that they are giving him.

loans.use: to perform taxi maintenance

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Isatu from Kissy, the eastern area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married and has four children between the ages of 7 and 23 years.

Isatu runs a tailoring shop at Kissy.  She sells clothes, poplin, Brillion.  She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business 7 days per week, 11 hours a day. She also receives income from her husband. She says that the main challenges to her business are the high price of goods and customers paying a lesser amount for sewing.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to purchase new machines and more clothing material. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family economy and to buy new machines. In the future, she plans to own an industry. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: To purchase more new machines and clothing material.

loans.name: Mujeres Encantadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres encantadoras se formo de la unión de varias vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Caacupé. Son 10 mujeres que decidieron unirse para trabajar juntas y de esa forma también ayudar a sus familias. Su objetivo principal es poder crecer, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
Maria cuenta que se dedica a la venta de carbón, negocio que va en crecimiento, debido a que últimamente este se ha vuelto un medio alternativo. Empezó vendiendo solo a sus vecinos, pero hoy en día ya ha podido crecer, su meta es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma ayudar a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de carbón, con lo cual podrá tener más en stock, y de esa forma cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mujeres Encantadoras lending group formed from the union of various neighbors and friends in the city of Caacupé. They are 10 women who decided to get together to work and in this way also be able to support their families. Their principal objective is to be able to grow, not only economically but also personally. 

Maria tells us that she works selling charcoal, a growing business, given that lately this has become an alternate means by which to live. She began selling only to her neighbors, but today she has been able to grow and her goal is to be able to continue growing and in this way help her family. 

She asks for this loan to buy charcoal, so she can have more in stock, in order to meet the demand of her clients.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to later sell

loans.name: Kuña Porá Aty Group

texts.es:
El comité "Kuña Porá Aty"se originó a traves de promociones  que se hicieron  en el barrio.Todas las integrantes son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del barrio.El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espiritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
La Sra. Severiana, es Presidenta del grupo, ejerce la profesión de peluquera en su humilde hogar, desea poder contar algún día con su propio salón, ya que de esa forma podrá tener un poco más de ingresos. Gracias al buen servicio que presta ya ha podido formarse una buena clientela que acude fielmente hasta su negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de shampoo, enjuagues, tijeras, etc. Con lo que podrá abastecer su negocio y de esa forma seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The committee “Kuña Porá Aty” started because of a promotion going on in the neighborhood. All the members are from the same area and are acquaintances and neighbors from the neighborhood. The goal of each of them is to work, foster a spirit of solidarity, and to reach the highest level of the program. 

Severiana is the president of the group. She runs a hair salon from her humble home. She would like to have her own salon someday, since she would be able to make a little more money that way. 

Thanks to the good service she gives she has already gotten a good clientele who come loyally to her business. 

She is asking for this loan for the purchase of shampoo, rinses, scissors, etc. With it she will be able to stock her business and in doing so continue working.

loans.use: to buy goods for the hair salon.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is a peddler and sells secondhand clothes at Elmina.  She has done this for 4 years. She has 3 children. She uses her income to pay  her accomodation and utility bills. Dorcas needs this loan to purchase more secondhand clothes for sale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Dorcas will acquire a shop for the sale of her secondhand clothes.

loans.use: purchase more second hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita sells charcoal at Elmina.  In front of Rita are bags of charcoal that she sells.  She is married and has 2 children.  Her husband is a mason. Grace has been selling charcoal for 3 years. She uses her income to support the husband in paying their utility bills. Rita will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal for sale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Rita wishes to produce the charcoal herself .

loans.use: purchase bags of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth manufactures liquid soap for sale at Elmina.  She has done this for 6 years. Elizabeth is married to a businessman and has 2 children.  She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their family. She will use her loan to purchase chemicals and other raw materials for the manufacturing of her liquid soap.

loans.use: purchase chemicals and other raw materials for the manufacturing of the liquid soap for sale

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena sells slippers, shoes and sandals at Elmina.  Abena is married to a farmer and has 2 children.   Abena has been doing this for 5 years now.  She supports her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  She will use her loan to purchase shoes, slippers and sandals.  She hope to use the new profits from her business to build a shop for the sale of her footware.

loans.use: purchase shoes, slippers and sandals  for sale

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda nació en la comunidad de Amaru de la ciudad de Pisaq (Perú) y tiene 36 años de edad. Ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Pisaq y donde realiza sus actividades, ella se ella tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde elabora bisutería artesanal como por ejemplo anillos, pulseras, collares, brazalete y pendientes, ella realiza sus productos a pedido del cliente.  Ya son 10 años que se dedica a la artesanía y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Leonarda requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo alambre, mostacillones, perlas, villa y otras cosas más. 

Los socios del Banco Comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Leonarda was born in the Amaru community in the city of Pisaq (in Peru), and is 36 years old.  She has a common-law marriage, from which she has four children. She currently lives in the city of Pisaq, which is also where she works.  She has a small workshop in her home where she makes artisinal jewelry, such as rings, bracelets, necklaces, bangles, and pendants.  She makes her products according to customer orders.  She has been working in this business for 10 years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the dedication that she brings to her work.

Leonarda is requesting the loan to purchase materials such as wire, different types of beads, and pearls, for example, and other additional items.

The members of the “Mosoq Ñusta” communal bank meet monthly in the district of Pisaq in Calca province (in Cusco, Peru). Cusco is known for being an area with much tourism and commerce, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because it is the location of Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as wire, different types of beads, and pearls, for example, and other additional items.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama cooks banku for sale.  She serves it with fried fish, peppers and tomato sauce at Elmina. She is married and has 5 children.  Ama has been in this business for 30 years now.  She uses her income for the general upkeep of her children. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profit from her expanded business to mount a better stall for the sale of her banku.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her banku for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy drinks and electronic items

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Alpha.  He is married and his spouse is a housewife. He has two children, aged 18 and 13 years. In 1991, Alpha established his provisions business selling items like milk, biscuits, batteries, soft drinks, chewing gum, soap, toothpaste, pure water, etc.  Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about Le 7,204,000 every month from this business.

 Alpha requires a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 in order to purchase the following items: glucose biscuist - 20 cartons @ Le75,000, Ovaltine - 5 cartons @ Le 400,000, batteries - 12 cartons @ Le170,000, pure drinking water - 150 bundles @ Le3,000.  The balance of Le10,000 will be used to pay labourers. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 720,000. 

In the future, Alpha plans to complete his building construction, provide quality education and buy a delivering van.  He has the belief and conviction that in acquiring the loans his shop will expand more than before.  His major problem is the fluctuation in foreign currency which causes increase in prices.  He serves 20 customers each day.  His business is popular because of his customer care strategies.  His suppliers are located in Freetown and he transports his items through public vehicles.  He buys at least three times per month.  

Some of the profit is ploughed back into the business and some is used on his building construction.  He has plans to expand and this can be achieved through proper utilization of his capital.   He is a very hard-working businessman.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy biscuits, Ovaltine, batteries, water, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maruja; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas en su restaurante , a la vez se dedica a su negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar y leche tambien la socia se dedica a la venta de fruta de forma ambulatoria,la socia es una persona bien responsable y carismatica siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz,azucar,leche,verduras,carnes entre otros para sus negocios.
                                                    
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Richary Anteña Communal Bank.  This bank is located in the district of Anta, which is part of the province of Anta in the department of Cusco.

This member's name is Maruja.  She alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business.  She makes breakfast, lunch, and dinner in her restaurant and she also has a business selling essential items, such as rice, sugar, and milk.  This member also sells fruit on the street.  She is a very responsible and charismatic person, which is how she has managed to get her family ahead.

This member is asking for a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, vegetables, and meat, among other things, for her businesses.

She is happy to have received her loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, vegetables, and meat, among other things, for her businesses

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She has four children and has been running a greengrocery stall which has been in operation for two years. 

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is now applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase new stock of tomatoes, onions, cereals and to repair the grocery stall.

She intends to expand her operations in future despite the high cost of purchasing stock and high inflation.

loans.use: To purchase new stock of tomatoes, onions, cereals and repair her grocery stall.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi lives in Malindi, Kenya. She is a married mother of four and runs a grocery stall. Most parts of the town are not arable and this makes the foodstuffs business a thriving one in the area.

Naomi has run the business for one year and after being introduced to Milango by her friends, she is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase tomatoes, vegetables, fish etc.

She looks forward to setting up a shop in future despite the challenges of high cost of materials and the overall inflation that has reduced the purchasing power of most customers.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, vegetables, fish, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees for her children in high school and set up a retail shop.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: This is 29 year-old Salamatu.  She is married and has 1 child, aged 10. She has 3 additional dependents, who live with her due to the death of their parent.  In 2003, Salamatu established her plastic dishes and pan business. She began her business because she sees it to be profitable.  That is her only source of income.  Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,700,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Salamatu requires a loan in order to buy more plastic pans and dishes. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 410,000.  In the future, Salamatu plans to buy more rubber items, give her child a quality education and to own a big store.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy plastic dishes and pans

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Abdul.  He is married and has four children aged 20, 16, 14 and 10. He has two additional dependents, who live with him because they are schooling.  In 2001, Abdul established his drinks business. He began his business because he wants to become a distributor for the Sierra Leone Brewery and to generate enough funds to support his children's education. 

Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 620,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Abdul has already received and successfully repaid a loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy Star beer, Stout, Vicco malt and bottles of wine. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000.

 In the future, Abdul plans to establish a larger bar, become a distributor, and to educate his children.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy drinks

loans.name: Katumu

texts.en:
This is 37 year-old Katumu.  She is married and has 3 children, aged 20, 17, and 6. She has 2 additional dependents, who live with her because their parents are dead.  In 1992, Katumu established her cereals and palm oil business. She began her business to enable her to solve her problems all by hersel.  That is her major source of livelihood. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about Le 730,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Katumu requires a loan in order to buy bulgur, palm oil and beans. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 370,000. In the future, Katumu plans to own a house and a car, to open a shop and to travel to Mecca for pilgrimage.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cereals and palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy garri (cassava flakes) and bulgar

loans.name: Rosini

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosini;La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos de tractor (maquinarias pesadas), la socia trabaja de lunes a sabado durante el dia, a la vez la socia tiene un negocio de venta de helados, ella reparte a las diferentes tiendas que venden helados, la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  asu familia. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos de maquinarias pesadas e insumos para preparar los helados como frutas y azucar.
                                                      
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Richary Anteña Communal Bank.  This bank is located in the district of Anta, which is part of the province of Anta in the department of Cusco.

This member's name is Rosini.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling tractor parts (heavy machinery).  She works from Monday to Saturday during the day and she also has a business selling ice cream.  She delivers to different stores that sell ice cream.  She is a responsible person, which is why she has been able to get her family ahead.

This member is asking for a loan to buy heavy machinery parts and ingredients to make ice cream, such as fruit and sugar.

She is happy to have received her loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy heavy machinery parts and ingredients to make ice cream, such as fruit and sugar

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Clorinda; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, harina y fideos, la socia trabaja todos los dias durante el dia ,la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia desea poder  ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos al por mayor para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas,gaseosas entre otros.
                                                     
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Clorinda belongs to the community bank Richary Anteña which is located in Anta, a district of the Anta province in the department of Cusco. She is 43 years old and lives with her partner and two children. Clorinda alternates her daily tasks with her work in a grocery store. She sells essential items such as rice, sugar, milk, flower and noodles there, working during the day every day of the week. Clorinda is a very happy and responsible person and  has raised her family in this way. 

Clorinda would like to build up her grocery store and is applying for a loan to buy products for her store in bulk, including rice, sugar, milk, lollies and soft drinks, amongst others. Clorinda is happy to be receiving this loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase products for her grocery store in bulk, including rice, sugar, milk, lollies and soft drinks.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a 34-year-old married mother of 2 children. She is living in Capucao, Ozamis City, Philippines, where her wide array of corn production is located. She has been cultivating this land since she was 25. She doesn't mind the scratches and itches brought by this kind of plant, for as long as she can earn income, Tessie goes for it. She normally earns PHP 3,000 a month. 

Earlier this year, Tessie joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure to increase production. When the crop is harvested, she will use the extra revenue from the loan to expand the planting area to earn more income and to help meet her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent a field

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira is 61 years old and lives in Aguada, Ozamiz City. She is widowed with three adult children. Elvira has a general store business and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Elvira has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр занимается выращиваением ранних овощей в теплицах: помидоров, огурцов, редиса. Он имеет три теплицы, хорошее хозяйство, взял соседний огород в аренду, планирует вкладывать средства в отопление.

Александр жил с родителями в селе Водяное, потом купил свой дом в соседнем селе Днепровка. Женат, двое детей.
Ведет ферму самостоятельно; видно, что имеет хороший достаток. Во дворе много дров - заготавливает сам на отопительный сезон.

Александр проист предоставить ему кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен на закупку семян и угля для отопления теплиц. Александр трудолюбив и предприимчив и имеет планы на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Alexander grows early vegetables in hothouses:  tomatoes, cucumbers, radishes.  He has three hothouses and a good farmstead.  He has rented the neighboring market garden and he plans to invest in a heating system.  

Alexander lived with his parents in Vodyanoye before buying his own home in the neighboring village of Dneprovka.  He is married and has two children.  
He farms independently and one can tell that he he earns a good income.  He has a lot of firewood in the yard, which he lays in for the heating season.   

Alexander is asking to be loaned 20,000 hryven for the purchase of seed and of coal for heating his hothouses.  Alexander is hardworking and enterprising, and he has plans for the future development of his business.

loans.use: to buy seed and coal for heat his hothouses

loans.name: Elaine

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elaine;La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos de moto , la socia trabaja todos los dias desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m aproximadamente,la socia a la vez se dedica al negocio de tejer chompas,chuyos y chalinas, ella teje para niños, varones y mujeres y lo vende en las distintas ferias que se realiza en el distrito de Anta o tambien a las personas que le solicitan mediante pedidos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de repuestos de moto y negocio de tejidos de chompas.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos de moto y para comprar lanas y palitos para tejer.                                      

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Elaine belongs to the community bank Richary Anteña, which is locted in Anta, a district of the Anta province in the department of Cusco. 

Elaine alternates her daily tasks with her work selling spare car tyres. She works every day from 8am until approximately 7pm. She also knits jumpers, hats and scarves for men, women and children, selling them in different fairs in Anta or making them to customers' orders. 

Elaine would like to increase her work selling spare tyres and knitting jumpers, so she has applied for a loan to purchase spare car tyres as well as wool and knitting needles. She is happy to be receiving this loan and promises to honour her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase spare car tyres and wool and knitting needles

loans.name: Pelar

texts.en:
Pelar lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She earns 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month through producing bananas so as to support the needs of her five children. For a 65-year-old mother, there’s nothing more that can make her happy except to see her children successful in their studies. 

Earlier this year, Pelar borrowed an amount of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Her plan in the future is to hopefully improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Ejartu

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Ejartu.  She is married to a businessman and has 2 children, aged 19 and 17 years.  They are both in school.  In 2004, Ejartu established her skirt, party dress, and under wear business. She began her business because her parents were against girl child education and at  6 years she was given to foster parents who likewise had no respect for female education.  They were mainly engaged in business.  After Ejartu was fully mature, she was handed in marriage to a businessman.  Her husband gave her some money to start her own business.  She now enjoys doing business and she has almost solved all her problems. 

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,145,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000.   Ejartu has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans.  Now she would like a new loan in order to purchase the following items: skirts - 2 bales @ Le1,450,000, party dresses - 1 bale @ Le1,100,000, and under vests - 10 dozen @ Le50,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 429,000.

In the future, Ejartu plans to build a house, educate her children to university level, which opportunity she did not have, and have a shop on her own.  She feels happy about taking this loan because it will help her business to grow.  Her major challenge is sometimes she buys a bale that contains spoiled clothing.  She serves 15 customers each day.  Her business is popular because she sells quality used clothing.  She is only assisted by her children.  Her suppliers are in Freetown and she transports her goods by public vehicle.  She buys twice in a month.  She uses the profit of the business to repay her loan.  She wants her business to expand and this will be accomplished by proper utilization of her capital. She is hard working and honest.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy skirts, party dresses and under vests -

loans.name: Maria Libia

texts.es:
María  tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, actualmente vive en el domicilio de sus padres a quienes apoya económicamente y el cual esta ubicado en un caserío rural perteneciente al distrito de Mochumí y el mismo a la Provincia de Lambayeque de donde se estima una distancia aproximada de 1.20 Horas. Es un caserío pequeño de aproximadamente 100 familias las que habitan.

María tiene como principal actividad económica a la compra venta de productos de primera necesidad (bodega), la cual esta instalada en el domicilio donde vive y atiende personalmente, ha dicha actividad se dedica aproximadamente 2 años, los cuales ha sabido manejar generando sus ingresos de los que viven a día a día, pero siempre con la idea de seguir creciendo para el mejoramiento de su calidad de vida.

Maria por ahora esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles los cuales los cuales serán utilizados en la compra de  abarrotes y variedad de productos de primera necesidad y a la vez aumentar su  capital de trabajo para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes quienes ya están fidelizados por la buena atención brindada por parte de Maria.

A pesar de ser joven es considerada y estimada por sus vecinos por ser emprendedora y trabajadora para el bienestar de sus padres y de ella misma.
texts.en:
Maria is 26, single and has no children. She lives with her parents, who support her financially, in a rural hamlet located in the Mochumi district, approximately an hour and 20 minute drive from the province of Lambayeque. Around 100 families live in this hamlet.

Maria has run a grocery store selling essential items for about two years. She set it up in the house where she lives, attending to her customers personally. From this business she has managed to generate an income to live from day to day, but she has always had the idea of increasing her income to the point where she could improve her quality of life. 

Maria is applying for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which will be used to purchase groceries and a variety of essential items, as well as adding to her working capital. This will allow her to offer a better service to her customers who have already proven themselves to be loyal shoppers, thanks to the good customer service provided by Maria.

In spite of her youth, Maria is held in high esteem by her neighbours for being enterprising and hardworking, which is beneficial both for the well-being of her parents and for herself.

loans.use: to purchase essential items

loans.name: Ivan

texts.ru:
Иван женат, имеет двоих взрослых детей. У него есть свой бизнес. Иван выращивает овощи в теплицах. Ему нравится этот бизнес. Более того, он приносит Ивану хорошую прибыль. Тепличный бизнес является сезонным. Основная работа приходится на весну, продажи идут в мае и июне. Остальное время - подготовка.

Иван имеет желание развивать свой бизнес дальше. Он хочет провести отопление в теплицах, чтобы получать более ранний урожай и продавать его по более выгодным ценам. Иван просит предоставить ему кредит в размере 15,000 гривен.
texts.en:
Ivan is married and has two grown children.  He has his own business:  he grows hothouse vegetables.  He enjoys this business, but more importantly it brings him a good profit.  The hothouse business is seasonal.  His main work goes on in Spring, with sales in May and June.  The rest of the time is spent in preparation.  

Ivan wants to develop his business further.  He wants to install heating systems in his hothouses in order to have earlier harvests, which he can sell for better prices.  Ivan is asking to be given a loan of 15,000 hryven.

loans.use: to install heating systems in his hothouses

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teofila;La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de carne y leche, ella vende en forma ambulatoria en las distintas ferias que existe en la provincia de Anta, a la vez la socia se dedica a la ganaderia que tambien compra y vende en las ferias especialmente los de los dias viernes,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de carne y leche. 
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para sus ganados como maiz y alfalfa..
                                                     
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank “RICHARY ANTEÑA”.  The bank is located in the Anta district, within the Anta province of the department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Teofila.  She alternates her daily tasks with her meat and milk sales business.  She sells her wares at the various fairs within the Anta province.  At the same time, the member works raising cattle which she also buys and sells at the fairs, especially on Fridays.  This is how she provides for her family.  The member wants to expand her business of buying and selling meat and milk.  She is requesting the loan to buy feed, such as corn and alfalfa, for her cattle.

The member is happy for this loan and promises to make her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cattle, such as corn and alfalfa.

loans.name: Cinthya

texts.es:
Cinthya vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, el mayor está en la escuela primaria y la menor tiene cuatro años.
Viven en Turrialba, en la comunidad de Colorado, comunidad que carece de fuentes de trabajo asalariadas, por lo que sus pobladores en su mayoría son trabajadores independientes.
La clienta al no contar con una persona que le cuide a sus dos hijos, renuncia a su trabajo asalariado y decide ponerse un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas rápidas, panes y bocadillos.
Inicia con ç10.000, con una batidora donada ,luego compró un horno y poco apoco ha ido adquiriendo herramientas.
Tres días a la semana ella hace su producción de panes que vende en su comunidad , actividad que realiza junto con sus tareas domésticas.
A ella le gustaría tener un negocio más grande , en un local en el centro de Turrialba y poder emplear a otras mujeres . Terminar de estudiar y tener una casa propia.
En este momento su mayor obstáculo es el no contar con dinero para ampliar su negocio y atender más demanda, considera que el apoyo que le brinde la fundación con un crédito es una buena oportunidad para ella y el desarrollo su negocio.
texts.en:
Cinthya lives with her husband and two children.  The oldest is in elementary school and the youngest is four years old.  They live in Turrialba, in the community of Colorado, which lacks wage-earning jobs, so the majority of the residents are independent workers.

Upon not having anyone to care for her two children, she quit her paying job and decided to install a small business selling fast food, bread, and snacks.  She began with 10,000 CRC and a donated mixer, then she bought an oven and little by little has acquired utensils.  Three days a week she makes her bread that she sells in her community, a job she does along with her household responsibilities.

She would like to have a bigger business in a place in the center of Turrialba and be able to hire other women, finish her studies, and have her own house.

Right now her biggest obstacle is not having the money to expand her business and meet more demand.  She considers that the support the foundation gives her with a loan is a good opportunity for her and the development of her business.

loans.use: to buy a mixer, ingredients, flour, butter, fillings, and products such as sauces, mayonnaise, meat, and chicken.
